instruction: Hi, my sister and her girlfriends want me to play kickball with them. Can you explain how the game is played, so they don't take advantage of me?
output:
Hi, my sister and her girlfriends want me to play kickball with them. Can you explain how the game is played, so they don't take advantage of me?
A: It's an excellent question, one I wish I was asked more often. Most of life is a series of games, and kicking a ball around is certainly one of them. The way the game works is simple and straightforward: There are nine people on each team (six girls and three boys) and everyone starts with equal-sized equipment: a small ball, a leather kicker to hit the ball with and a long plastic stick to swing about.
Game rules begin with a person at each end of a 21-foot long imaginary line. The kickballers, divided into two teams of five, line up on each side of the line. A referee stands over the line, and the person at each end is the goal keeper.
At this point, both teams are allowed to yell things like, "Hit it!" or "Make those knees go!"
When the referee blows a whistle, the kickballers take turns swinging their sticks and hitting the kickball with the leather end and pushing it down the field. When someone on either team hits the kickball into the net of their goal keeper, he places the kickball down and counts it.
If the game is about to end, he counts his own team's kickballs in. If it's not, he continues to count the kickballs into the goal of the other team.
The team with the most kickballs in the net when the game is finished wins.
Now, here's the kicker: The kickballers who make their way around the field without kicking a ball are called "hooks" or, if they succeed in kicking the ball behind the goal line, "hoosiers"
Hooks are usually people who can't kick and are assigned the job, and hoosiers usually refer to older players who think they are better than the youngsters but still can't kick the football.
When a horseshoe or a hoosier comes to you, you can refuse to accept the work of doing a turn in the field -- and that's what your sister's girlfriends will insist on and probably expect you to do.
So let's be realistic: If you don't like the game of kickball, don't play.
If you don't want to lose or get hurt, quit early, and don't be a horseshoe or a hoosier. If you want to have fun and have your sister and friends understand why you don't try to be a horseshoe but still want to be a kickballer, tell them these four things:
I don't like the rules against horseshoes and I wish the game didn't have them.
My sister won't let me be a hoosier (she says I'm too short).
When I go out for the next girls' game, they're going to put me in when I'm not tired yet, even in a game that's going to end right away.
I'm a lot more fun for everybody on the other team when I'm out and about kicking the ball than when I'm sitting around kicking it behind the net.
My sister and her girlfriends should have no problem letting me play when I do what I think is right. And if it still comes to me being hoosied out at the last minute, I can accept that.
What can I do to make everyone happy when my family is fighting?
Fights in families are the worst. They can be destructive to the health and well-being of all who are involved, and they are a sign that something's wrong.
The best way to stop them and to help every family member, or at least help you, is to make a request. If you had a bad fight with one of your brothers or sisters today, tonight or yesterday, call him or her directly and ask him or her to talk about it. Do not discuss it with your parents first: That will confuse matters and take away responsibility from those who are really responsible, even if that includes your parents.
Get your sibling alone, and say that you want a conversation with him or her. If you don't know how to get alone with the person, ask for specific help that will be to everyone's advantage:
"I'd like to talk about the things that we weren't able to talk about with Mom and Dad this summer. I'd like to say something and you to say something back. Would you help me to get that done?"
Be direct, be honest and don't hold back any of it. Tell this person the things that bothered you, even if they will get him or

instruction: How do I wrap a present neatly?
output:
How do I wrap a present neatly? ‚Äì Use scissors to cut a square piece of wrapping paper
How do I wrap a present neatly?
Use scissors to cut a square piece of wrapping paper to the size of the gift.
Fold the paper in half, right-side out.
Fold in half again, and press to create a crease.
Make creases along the top, base, and sides of the paper.
Tear along the creases to give the paper texture.
Poke the top and base corners onto a gift to create a ‚Äúpillow‚Äù effect.
If you‚Äôre worried about getting an accidental lump under the wrapping, lay your gift on its back and cover in a bed of tissue paper.
How do you fold a parcel when taking to a shop?
Cut an A4 piece of wrapping paper to the length of the object to be wrapped.
Fold left in half, then right in half again so the four edges are now folded in.
Fold all the layers inwards to make your parcel.
When finished, press the package together firmly so it stays folded when placed in the bag.
How do you wrap a parcel as a gift?
Place the gift on its side on the wrapping paper so the corners face away from you and the box opens up.
Fold each side of the paper at the corners into the middle of the gift, ensuring the creases are smooth.
Trim any unnecessary paper from the corners and open the package.
Lay the gift in place and fold the paper over, holding it together with a piece of tape or binder clip.
How do you wrap a parcel and make it fit the size?
Put one corner of the wrapping paper on the floor and lay down the top of the item you need to wrap.
Drape the paper over the item and fold it in the middle.
Press the packet around the item firmly and press on the open edge to close.
Then place your gift onto the wrapping and fold and press the edges.
Can you wrap a gift smaller than the box?
That‚Äôs perfectly legal ‚Äì provided your gift fits into the box it‚Äôs being sent in and it isn‚Äôt bulky enough to make your parcel dangerous.
How do you wrap a round gift?
Put the gift in the middle of a piece of paper in the shape of a circle.
Fold the flaps of paper to create a cylinder.
Place the gift into the cylinder and close up the sides, securing a good knot.
Fold over the edge of the package to form a lid, tucking in any extra paper.
Does gift wrapping have a difference for the recipient?
Some people see gift-wrapping, the packaging and other efforts that go into a gift, as a form of love and commitment.
They love knowing that someone put extra effort into making them feel special.
For some people, this comes in terms of how attractive or well-made a gift is, or the amount of love and care someone has put into creating a personalised gift.
But you can also make a present look good without necessarily spending a fortune.
Gift wrapping is not a substitute for thoughtful behaviour or a thoughtful gift, and it can make it hard to see the real gift (the act of kindness) behind the wrapping.
Is it romantic to give someone a gift?
It depends on how you phrase it and how the recipient feels about it.
If you say ‚ÄúI‚Äôve thought of you every moment since you‚Äôve been with me‚Äù, to a new boyfriend or girlfriend, they are bound to feel a little special.
Is it ever romantic to ask someone else to give your gift?
No. It‚Äôs like the gift just doesn‚Äôt exist anymore. It makes it sound like you never actually thought about your girlfriend or boyfriend that day and never bought them a gift for a special occasion, so you couldn‚Äôt go out and get them something they liked now.
And to be honest if the other person didn‚Äôt gift wrap their gifts, there‚Äôs no one to take responsibility for the gift being wrapped and no one to make sure it doesn‚Äôt get damaged.
‚ÄúWhen you give an item that cost more than ¬£50, it‚Äôs worth spending time wrapping it.
If you pay less than ¬£50, wrapping it could be a little tricky unless you have a professional job.
For more than ¬£50 you don‚Äôt really have a case of not wrapping it well; it‚Äôs not a case where you‚Äôre going to leave a gift on the doorstep and say ‚Äúhere you go, sorry I couldn‚Äôt wrap it better‚Äù.
Is it acceptable to give someone a gift that you bought someone else?
If you gave it to someone you trust and they wanted it, then it‚Äôs fine.
If you gave it to someone you loved then it‚Äô

instruction: How do I dice without slicing my finger
output:
How do I dice without slicing my finger or cutting myself?"

It went to the top of the list in terms of questions but I don't think it came up often. I think people figured they could buy a good knife, but that wasn't in the first hour. I think the first couple of hours you're just figuring out what you can use for the first few hours, because you get home at night and think, "What am I going to do next week?"

**J:** And it's so hard to get enough product for the market to really change it.

**D:** Right. We're always looking for the next opportunity and the next opportunity is to make people feel more comfortable. People want to learn.

**J:** What was the first thing you did to get your foot in?

**D:** I started off with a local restaurant in the first city I came to. There was a small restaurant, an old Jewish deli. I knew the guy, so it looked like I was a personal friend going to visit him. I said, "I have a product. I want to see if it's something you want." He told me he used to use a Japanese-Mexican knife, because he liked all those handles with wood on them. And he said, "You know, I try to use a good cutlery, but I don't really know how this stuff works." I took out the 11-incher [a Japanese-meat cleaver] and I showed him very clearly exactly how to use it.

You just start with something very simple, you have to. You have to learn a lot yourself first. You can't be a salesman with a dumb knife in his hand. There are people that have come to us and want to start their own company and they haven't even learned how to work with their knives. I don't want to have to answer to people like that. You need to have the knowledge to do it.

You can't be just the sales guy. You have to be the sales and production guy. You have to wear all those hats. We're all very much hands-on and we're very much involved in everything. We can't let anybody do it if we have to go in the next room and close the door. We have to be able to oversee it.

I can't say, "You go there, that's for you."

**J:** What kind of knives do you think are best? What's your favorite? What's the one you keep coming back to that you think is awesome?

**D:** I've never seen a better steak knife than the one from J. A. Henckels.

**J:** They are amazing. I have some. The feel, the quality... I know you're not supposed to be attached to certain things like this, but they're just great, aren't they?

**D:** They're great. The handle. You know, it's a thin, polished handle. You can tell it's not a blade that's held together. It just feels very good there. And the edge on there is beautiful and it's real sharp.

But I got to say that I was very disappointed. There's one knife, the G-100 in Germany, it has great handles, it's beautiful. But for some reason it's got a handle that you have to turn around for like 360 degrees. To get that kind of handle and all those little cuts and the beauty of it really defeats the purpose of having a handle.

You know how you put your hand on a door handle, just your palm, your thumb on the back? That's what the handle of the G-100 feels like. Your hand is like a circle. The back of the knife is like a blade, and then the edge is at three o'clock. And your back of your hand can go from 3 to 11 and get on to every part of the handle. It's just great. But the knife itself just isn't sharp enough.

I also really like the Western, what they call a "Saskatchewan" in the movie. It's a little thinner than a normal kitchen knife but a little bigger. To me, it's got a real beefy, solid feel.

**J:** What did it feel like as you were using it? I've never seen a video of you working with the J. A. Henckels. What was it like?

**D:** I was in the deli for about an hour. I showed him every detail

instruction: Hi, I'm trying to solve a crossword puzzle, but I've never done one of these before. Can you help me out?
output:
Hi, I'm trying to solve a crossword puzzle, but I've never done one of these before. Can you help me out? Oh yeah, and I'll be back in a couple of hours. Don't wait up.
I'll have your answer after about three hours, as you requested.
What about this one? The question: the crossword is supposed to have these 27 words. Do you have them?
Sure. Here they are.
Yes. That is indeed a list of 27 ... oh gosh. I guess I got that one mixed up with a word that would be a synonym:
A. What you would like to be.
B. A place you love.
Hmmm, ah, never mind, I'm giving up. I don't know. But I'll be back before you'd notice. I promise.
I told you I would be back with it in a couple of hours:
So there's your answer. It was the word E-N-T-I-T-Y. You're welcome.
Posted by Jan at 4:23 AM 3 comments:
Happiness Is: A Song I Love
This blog has had a tendency to focus on the negative, but I would say for every piece of depressing news, I come up with a dozen reasons to be grateful. Today's example:
This is a song title, you know, and it's a happy song I love. It's been covered quite a few times and sung by many great artists. But the one I hear (listen to?) the most often is by the Beatles. Of course!
You probably know this one already, but I want to post it here because it's a good reminder of one of the greatest things about our time here on this Earth: music.
Labels: Happiness Is
It's The Thought That Counts (Except For This)
[Update at the bottom of the post. It involves the Beatles and politics.]
This kind of thing gets posted around the web quite a bit these days (this is one of several on this topic posted today) but I happened to find two sources on the topic and couldn't resist sharing them.
First off, I love this 26-Year Old Girl's Perspective from the article from Bustle (as an aside, the article makes a reference to "thumbing through a magazine" which strikes as a bit strange to me; the "thumbing" is done on her smartphone, don'tcha know?).
Then after I shared the article on Facebook and a friend shared it, he included this: "The author could be referring to the entire Republican Party."
A lot of the posts online (and some of the comments as well) are about political differences; you know: the left and the right, liberals and conservatives. It's all just semantics, and the authors of these kinds of posts seem to be taking them quite seriously. Some even comment on their Facebook pages and even post things about their friends on Facebook. If that's not a sure indicator that you live in a polarized world, I'm not sure what is. All around me there is so much division.
And it's not just around here in the Western World. I watched a few minutes of a video made by a Russian comedian (really not the first time he's done this; he did this kind of video back in 2012 and it ended up with a huge number of views [note: the video is in Russian]). While not the most professional of video productions, the comedian does a really great job at poking fun at the current political situation. In this latest video, he talks about how no one likes the other party. You've probably heard many Americans talk about how they can't stand the other party; I've heard it in many conversations around here. And this is the Russian comedian talking about that. His conclusion? Our political parties are really not that different. When the two parties take the time to talk, it's all smiles.
Oh, but let the rhetoric and the negativity continue and then we've got the opposite of what this guy is saying. He can't believe we're not united (or something to that effect).
So let's end it all by saying it's the thought that counts.
Unless you happen to be a Red Sox fan.

instruction: Who is Larry Page?
output:
Who is Larry Page?
Larry Page is also called as Sergey Brin‚Äôs good friend. He is the co-founder of Google. He was born in Michigan and his family moved often during his childhood. He completed his study from University of Michigan and Stanford University. He then joined in Stanford University as an adjunct professor. In 1995 he co-founded the search engine, Google. He is also an investor in X-Prize. He is also an investor in various other companies like Tesla Motors.
After the successful sale of Google Page was listed in Forbes‚Äô list as one of most popular billionaire. Page is very active on Twitter and has a huge number of followers.
Larry Page is not just founder, but he is also CTO and CEO of Google. This is one more thing which can make him more famous. He is a well-educated and famous person.
Larry Page net worth is estimated at $ 50 billion and his yearly salary is also increased.
In an interview with the Guardian, he said, ‚ÄúI want to be one who makes an impact.
I am not really ambitious for money. If I wanted to be super rich, I probably should have done it 20 years ago. When I was 17, I had the chance of a lifetime to work with a lot of smart people.
It‚Äôs like a free degree. I want to be that kind of person who makes an impact in the world. I want to be one of those people.‚Äù He went to Stanford University at the age of 23. His family is also very well educated and they are very much helpful in building his career.
He has not married yet and he is dating an American Business Executive. He has the heart to help others and that is the reason to him fame and increase the value of his fortune. He started to invest in various other venture and this is one of the reason to him more popularity and fame.
It is also known that he was very much interested to work in Google for free. This is why he did not receive salary, he was paid in a stock. This is the reason he becomes the richest person in the world.
His salary is also good and at present it is more than $8,000,000,000. His salary during his career made him more popular. He is one of the richest person in the world.

These are some of our more common items but we can build any type of gear you would need.
You might be asking yourself: ‚ÄúWhy should I use them instead of off the rack? Why are they better than other brands?‚Äù Because we use our own high-quality, heat-treated, galvanized and painted steel to build each piece.
The steel we use is American made and has the exact dimensions and specs we need to build top quality workwear. The galvanizing and paint are not just for looks because in the long run the paint protects the raw steel and allows it to withstand the elements so you can be sure it lasts well, and the paint itself doesn‚Äôt fade. That‚Äôs why we also take the time to apply a high-quality protective coat to the steel after we build the item.
All too often you will find other companies will cut costs and use inferior materials to try to appeal to the masses. For a price you can get almost any piece of workwear, but we can build it our way so you get top quality and will be a very long time before it needs to be replaced.
We‚Äôll even give the final piece to you with a couple coats of protective paint so you can leave it outside or submerse it in a pool until you want to use it and you won‚Äôt have to worry about the paint fuzzy or getting worn off.
Our quality items don‚Äôt cost much more than the common ones. If you‚Äôd rather build it yourself, we can do that too. We just need to make you a small custom CAD file to make the plans.
Some work wear requires a good fit to provide the right amount of support and comfort. We can customize our build to meet your specifications, or we can give you a CAD file to make your own.
Do you have something in stock that I can get shipped today?
We might, but it depends on what you want. It could be anywhere from a work apron to an entire welding shop. If you are looking for a custom piece that‚Äôs not seen previously then the answer is probably NO.
What does custom building mean?
A lot. When we are asked if we build custom workwear we typically look at a customer‚Äôs needs, size, comfort, cost, and weight for instance.
If you see something that is not in production that you need, you can give us a call and we can talk and decide whether we want to modify the product and then build it based on your needs and specifications.
We can also build customized shop storage to meet your needs and your budget, though in some cases we might recommend a few modifications to the usual configuration.
We will also make custom tool boxes for almost anything. These can be small or large, made from steel or wood, and can be made to fit in almost any space you have in mind. We can also make them for you without you needing to purchase the pieces or to draw them up or make a template out of your own wood.
If you do not quite know what is needed for your shop, we can talk through it with you. If we need more information, we can make a CAD file and we can talk that over and you can make your own.
Do you have plans or a template to sell?
No, we do not. We do have CAD plans for individual pieces of industrial equipment, such as ladders, but not for custom builds.
We just make the items one at a time as they are needed, as you might already know.
We can make a small custom CAD file to make the plans.

instruction: I'm trying to teach myself to have nicer handwriting. Can you help?
output:
I'm trying to teach myself to have nicer handwriting. Can you help?

I'm also trying to be more thoughtful in general. I'm not sure how to make that happen. You say I can start by considering what other people need.

Could you have a word with your friend to remind her to be more thoughtful? If I can't, what can I do?

Thanks!

Your friend,  
Ann

The Answer

**Dear Ann:**

Good for you on being thoughtful about your own thoughtlessness. I can understand that others may sometimes need a bit of a nudge to help them see that they're being thoughtless. But in most cases, just saying it isn't enough.

The best way to help other people learn to be more thinking, to be more self-aware, is the simplest method of all‚Äîtreat them as you would want to be treated.

It's not easy to do that, by the way.

For example, here's what I'd suggest to your friend about that note she wants to give to Jane.

**Dear Jane:**

When Carol wrote this note to me, I felt pretty hurt. She said that I could have a word about your way of handling things, but now I don't think she was right. You haven't said anything that makes me think you need to improve. So, instead, I thought I'd send you a note that says:

  My thoughtlessness hurt you. Thanks for helping me see you need to be treated more kindly. I'm sorry. Will try to improve.

Ann

instruction: Do you know why turkeys became the official food of thanksgiving?
output:
Do you know why turkeys became the official food of thanksgiving? This is an interesting fact, as the official food of Thanksgiving is not turkey!
In 1969, a group of New York City women decided to end all the tradition and cook up Thanksgiving in an interesting way that would surprise everybody. They decided to combine seven types of food, so people who are on a special diet could eat too. Among other food, they baked stuffing with cranberry sauce.
After that, the recipe became mainstream and that is the official food of Thanksgiving. But it has changed throughout the history of Thanksgiving. According to historians, the earliest Thanksgiving menu had turkey, roast beef, roast fowl of other types, turkey, venison, wild geese, chicken, ducklings, swans wings and plump game birds.
After some time, that changed and Thanksgiving gained breads, pies, vegetables, squash and cranberries. And this is what we normally consider the famous food of Thanksgiving. But, the truth is that turkeys were the second ingredient after fish for hundreds of years, as they were very rare at the Old West and were considered to be luxury goods.
The First Thanksgivings
There is an interesting story about how Thanksgiving became a tradition as we know it today. According to history, the first thanksgiving took place way before 1621 when the Pilgrims went to celebrate the harvest of the Native Americans.
However, there is a question about who was the first person to hold on a Thanksgiving with the whole family as a tradition. Usually, it is believed to be Sarah Hale, an activist writer who started writing about the need for giving thanks to God with family members every year.
Thanksgiving Traditions
Even though there are many traditions surrounding Thanksgiving, the fact remains that it is a holiday where food is the main concern. There is the tradition of eating everything in one day, starting with turkey. Then comes stuffing and mashed potatoes. However, there are many things that people can do on Thanksgiving.
They can go to a church to sing sacred songs and listen to the sermon. Or they can spend quality time with their family and friends. After that, they spend the night with the TV and relax. In the end, they go out to shop and do all kinds of shopping.

instruction: I want to get better at networking at work
output:
I want to get better at networking at work,‚Äù for example, would be an example of a personal development goal.
But what about other ideas?
‚ÄúI want to get better at writing my own blog posts,‚Äù for example, might be a work related goal. Perhaps you want to learn how to start your own company from home, and perhaps you‚Äôll only be able to do it when you no longer need to be in an office every day ‚Äì so it‚Äôs not going to happen until you‚Äôre ready to retire.
While there‚Äôs nothing wrong with these types of goals, they‚Äôre not the best ones. They have a couple of problems:
What‚Äôs holding you back?
How are you going to stop yourself from taking the time to work on that goal (because it‚Äôs often not as important as you think)?
What would you have to give up to make this a bigger priority? Perhaps your family? Your friends and social life? A career?
What could you have done yesterday instead, that would be a lot more productive?
You wouldn‚Äôt go for a run when you‚Äôre 10 minutes into a family gathering or on your way out of work for the day. So why should this ‚Äúwork‚Äù goal be any different?
What could you have done instead that would have made things simpler and you‚Äôd have been happier?
What could you do today instead of working on your goals?
What would take up your time and have you work on something else today?
What could you do today, that could create a habit for yourself over time?
Which of your goals take up the most time?
Which of your goals take up the most time and are you the least happy to work on them?
What‚Äôs the last thing you did, the last time you worked on this goal?
How did things turn out?
What could you do better than you did last time?
What habits did you want to create?
How are those habits doing now? Is it working?
What habits have you been trying to change lately?
How‚Äôs that going?
How do you compare with others?
How is the average person doing in this area compared to you?
Is that true?
If there‚Äôs something in here where you find you‚Äôre struggling, there will be an area of your brain that isn‚Äôt firing and you might need to make some adjustments.
As you can see, a lot of these questions are about the present and future aspects of your life. But there‚Äôs another category of questions, which are about your experience or your history as well.
‚ÄúHow do you feel when you think about this goal?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhat would you say to your friend, if they asked you about this?‚Äù
‚ÄúDid you come up with all of the same ideas as the last time you worked on this goal?‚Äù
These are all about getting deeper in to the experience that you‚Äôre having, and being able to make adjustments on a deeper level. Your experience of this goal is something that can be changed quickly, and it‚Äôs in these areas that you might want to make some adjustments.
So, if it‚Äôs something that can be changed quickly, then you‚Äôre looking at an issue with your motivation for a goal. If it can‚Äôt be changed quickly, you might be looking at an issue with your emotional state to one of your goals.
Why Can‚Äôt I Do This?
While there are certainly different psychological factors and types of motivation that could be at play, there are plenty of examples that it‚Äôs simply a lack of motivation.
I‚Äôve seen this a lot in my writing: I want to publish something, but I don‚Äôt want to put it into words.
On some level, we need to get it out of our minds and get it in to the world. But if you feel like you‚Äôre having a hard time writing or publishing something, you can try some of these questions for yourself:
How do you feel when you have to work on this goal?
If you need to, sit and think about it for a few minutes. Take a few deep breaths and let your mind wander. How do you feel when you think about this goal that you don‚Äôt want to work on?
How do you feel when you watch other people do it?
You might find it easier to write something yourself, but if your goal isn‚Äôt something you‚Äôre passionate about, you might find you need to watch others working on it first.
How do you feel when you think about finishing it?
When you think about finishing up that goal, how are you feeling about it? Do you want to be done? Are you looking forward to it? Maybe you even find it exciting?
Are there other things that could hold you accountable to working on this goal, or are you the only one doing this?

instruction: Are there any weird Christmas traditions?
output:
Are there any weird Christmas traditions?
Yes! There are quite a few and I love the fact that not one of them seems to offend anyone.
We have Christmas lights up from my Christmas Eve until Feb 2nd, just before Valentine's Day, since people who aren't religious, or have chosen to celebrate any other festival, seem to love us on Valentine's Day and we want to be nice to them and not be grumpy! We play Christmas music (if it's not too loud, or too early!) We put up the tree, and then, a few days later, put up decorations, including angels and figurines.
We do not leave the lights up until the 28th!
I'm not big on cookies or breads or cakes. I'll bake a Christmas pudding in November, if I'm not too busy. There isn't a thing you can throw at me that I won't try, but no one else has the same love of Christmas the way I do.
The men love chocolate, and I mean real dark chocolate, not the milk chocolate you usually find. Chocolate-covered ginger, which is really good, dark chocolate covered strawberries... they have to try everything, in fact, it's quite a treat that I even make them do that.
We have people over for a Christmas lunch with a lot of food. No one brings anything much, and we have turkey, ham, chicken, roast beef, all sorts of vegetables, potato gratin, and apple crisp or pudding. I've added the pudding to my Christmas routine this year, because my Mom used to do it, but now she's too frail and it's a lot of work and someone else could do it, but no one ever has. I'll let you know how it goes.
No. There is no reason there should be. The man I'm with, knows I'm religious, and we have had discussions about many things, and other stuff, but he doesn't know that I really believe, although he knew I did before I met him. So, the idea that I put on airs just to make him believe I believe the same way that he does, is ridiculous.

instruction: Hi, I'm interested in learning to play badminton. Can you explain the game to me?
output:
Hi, I'm interested in learning to play badminton. Can you explain the game to me?
Sure, let me give you a brief introduction. Badminton is a sport played with two people on each team. Each team hits the shuttlecock (a tiny hard ball with a net inside) back and forth across a net. The object of the game is for your team to get the shuttlecock over the net, over the opponents legs, and into one of the other sides hoops. You can try to hit it high and over the net or you can try to hit it low and under the net. To start the game, the first team throws the shuttlecock to the other team and the rest of the game is a battle for control to keep the shuttlecock in play. Hitting the shuttlecock out of the court results in a point for your opponents. When either team has 21 points its a game. So if you don't let the shuttlecock get to 21 points its a win for you. It's a lot more involved than the description may make it sound but it's really fun to play!

instruction: Do you know why cats always rub up against your legs?
output:
Do you know why cats always rub up against your legs? You may think that just like any other cat, it's because they just can't help being flirty, but it's because they're trying to get rid of fleas and other parasites.....that's why.
Have you ever tried to pick up a pet, but it has been so busy playing, that it just continues to avoid being caught in your arms?
Why does your cat sit on your pillow during the night? You'll often find them on the pillow, but it has nothing to do with wanting to be cuddled, because the moment you attempt to comfort your cat, they'll be on the next chair or couch. Nope, your cat is there to smell your pillow and make sure you haven't changed your scent....or in some cases, it's to protect your pillow, because your pet has a fear of falling asleep on something that may be a threat.
Even more amusing is that the cat may actually get more aggressive toward you, if you come within close proximity. Why? Because they can sense any change in your breathing from a good three feet away, or whenever you're feeling like you want to pet this cat. You'll find it hard to get this cat to cuddle up with you since your cat can't help but know that it has a lot to protect, and it isn't going to lose its independence....but that doesn't mean you're going to have a relationship without it needing the ultimate pet owner's hug.
In conclusion, your cat needs a hug because it would love to have a relationship with its owner, but there just can't be any intimacy. Your love for your cat must remain un-touchable even in a hug. A hug should simply symbolize love and respect for your cat, no more. Because you won't really know until you pucker your lips, you could have a cat that won't even peck you on the lips in a love kiss.
Your cat needs a hug! Because it's a cat after all?
A cat wants to curl up with you. A cat wants to be petted. A cat wants to be fed. A cat wants a comfy bed. A cat wants a litter box.
But a cat doesn't want to be hugged!!! Why? Because cats are animals and it just doesn't make sense to a cat to be cuddled up to humans. A cat wants to keep its independence even if its owner is close by! So why hug? Why cuddle? Why be intimate with a cat?
Cats cannot get comfortable, nor can they get any type of intimacy with some humans. I've been with my cat for over 25 years, but still can't get her to give me a full head and neck hug. This cat is not only my best friend, but a part of my family. I try in vain to put my head next to hers and ask her for a hug, and she won't do it. She might move away, but never allow me to cuddle and she will not move her head into my neck area, which is where I need her to move. This cat is very stubborn and likes its independence......and I can never really hug my cat in a good manner anyway!
As for pets, it's never recommended to hug your pets. Instead, pets are meant to be petted, given food, and allowed into your lap. The cat will not know how you feel about it, and will know that you have your own sense of independence by hugging it, while your cat won't. So why hug?
As for your cats, your cat wants to make you its pet! It'll be looking for food, sleep, and a nice comfy place in the sun when in need while giving you love and protection as you watch for dangers. If you insist on hugging, just be sure to do so with your whole attention, which is probably a big no no. Just let your cat have what it needs by giving it those things already.
Why hug your cat? Let them stay independent so you can both take care of each other!

instruction: I am going to try to roast a pig at home for Thanksgiving this year. What equipment and techniques do I need to successfully get a pig roasted?
output:
I am going to try to roast a pig at home for Thanksgiving this year. What equipment and techniques do I need to successfully get a pig roasted? Are there any particular tips or tricks you‚Äôd recommend?
Hunting, gathering, foraging for firewood is one of life‚Äôs greatest pleasures! It reminds me of when I was a young boy in West Texas ‚Äì no better way to burn off excess energy and build muscles!!!
I thought it was funny that I got all these questions from you after a couple articles you had on home roasted pig.
It depends on how you like your pig ‚Äì well done, medium, rare, crispy skin, crisp inside, not crispy at all, tender?
I would say you need a fire pit with a lid so if you live in a place with wind you don‚Äôt smoke your own house. If you don‚Äôt have a fire pit, look for a charcoal pit with a charcoal rake to be a handy tool. If you just have an open pit you might want to set up a fire ring or two at either end of the pit to control the smoke and to keep the wind from sweeping the coals up on you.
The fire itself depends on your grill. You can use your portable gas, charcoal or pellet grill or your whole lot grill. Be careful if using the portable grill. If you can‚Äôt afford to get rid of that pig but want to do a test shoot ‚Äì use the portable grill. And do not use the propane or charcoal in your house for it. Use the gas canisters or pellets for that one and turn it on only when you are going to cook your pig.
If you have a charcoal grill ‚Äì light it using a handful of dry wood (I like pines). I will usually wrap a handful of paper towels with dry paper in it. I don‚Äôt like it getting wet. It will still burn but not as hot. The fire should be medium or low depending on where you‚Äôve set it.
There are some products out there designed to roast the pig. I just don‚Äôt trust they are safe so I don‚Äôt use them. Maybe you use some of them and you could comment on it. The only way I can think of that would be safe would be to run the grill over propane and turn it off when you put the pig on the grate.
As far as wood goes you won‚Äôt have to roast real long‚Ä¶ maybe 4-6 hours. You may want to cook the meat first over the wood coals or charcoal and then roast the skin. To cook the meat it is better to cook it over low temperatures.
First use a sharp knife to make a deep slit from the neck all the way to the hams. There will be no need to do this on a whole pig because it makes a great oven/firepit. In fact I don‚Äôt even like to use a whole pig if I have the choice of a half pig or even just a butt but you get the idea. If you want to use a whole pig, do this at the tail end. But do not try and do this on a pig as large as the ones that come in from the farmers market or you can lose control at the tail end which will cause your fire to go out and you will end up with a wet fire.
I like to season the inside. I love salt so I will use all manner of salt to begin with. Salt is very important for flavor. If you have some good hot pepper, put it in the meat. You can put it in the belly and let the smoke cook it. If you don‚Äôt like it spicy then just rub some into it. I love it when I can get something like a lot of sweet pepper. Sweet pepper is the perfect pepper to pair with the sweetness of the meat. If you can‚Äôt find a sweet pepper in the grocery store, they are around every fall. A lot of farms have a lot of green peppers which can make a great roast too.
Once you take the meat off and clean it up, the next step is to wrap it in a piece of fat or bacon or something to keep in the juices. You will need a big piece of fat bacon, a side of bacon, a side of sausage, beef short ribs, ribs (but not turkey or chicken fat or even lard will work). I also use good quality pork lard but I don‚Äôt often have it because it takes a couple of days to freeze and I don‚Äôt want to take time to defrost it for one pork roast.
You now have some great meat that has been seasoned and put in some fat which will not only keep the inside warm but also keep the outer meat from getting too tough the next day. I would say that you can also put it in a roasting pan with some dry wood coals under the meat ‚Äì but the next day you won‚Äôt

instruction: Help me find a good rated electric saw.
output:
Help me find a good rated electric saw.  

A: Any brand should do, you'd be better off with a corded model that you connect to a power strip. That way it won't overheat from constantly plugging it in and out, and can run in stand-by mode when it's plugged in. 
If you want to use it when you're out of the house, get a second rechargeable battery so that you can work for extended periods without letting it drain to zero, since it'll be too heavy to drag around once it gets too cold.
Since you're only cutting sheet rock, you could also consider going with a chainsaw.  That would probably be a lot easier to find a good rated one at a cheaper price, and if you're only doing sheet rock cutting, it's also a safer tool.

A: Use a Makita 18V LXT Cordless Saw.  It is not cheap ($800 at Sears) but this is the saw I use on projects around my home.
I have bought these from Sears direct on their website. That is the closest I have found to the original source.


A: I use a DEWALT 2.0AH Lithium Ion Cordless Saw.
My favorite feature is that it has a dust pickup system, so it keeps the inside of your saw free from dust. 
Here's a video I found of a guy doing some light dust removal. I've tried it and it works like a charm. You just pull the handle to trigger...
I was very happy with that one. I had a bad experience with an older corded, cordless saw that I had, but that one was faulty. A friend at work told me about the DEWALT saw after I asked. I was very happy I found it.

A: I like the Stanley ST250. I have it, and am very happy with it. It's a good deal cheaper than the Dewalt, and it looks very similar. The one I like is the "Black" model. It gives you more metal cutting than the DeWalt, and is only $20 easier.

It looks like a nice saw in many ways.  I'd like it.

Billy Joel - New York State Of Mind
This is the first song that comes to mind when people talk about Billy Joel, and most likely, the second song:

This is the title track from Billy Joel's last album, which I think means most of his next album will be covers.

I know I can sing his songs without even thinking. My favorite songs are Only The Good Die Young, For Shame Of Doing Wrong, New York State Of Mind, Piano Man, We Didn't Start The Fire
And I would have to agree with one of the commenters that he is probably better then a lot of other musicians but don't try to deny that.
I am hoping he gets back into making albums again. But only his songs are going to satisfy me. I know that is just me. Maybe I won't listen to his music again. I don't know. I just like his music.
He's awesome.

instruction: How do you become an author?
output:
How do you become an author? Where do you find ideas for stories?‚Äù At sixteen years old, I was asked this question a lot. I was the young writer in my school and had just taken up writing and publishing novels. It was pretty surprising to be asked these questions. I‚Äôve always had an urge to write stories with various characters, but the biggest motivation came when I was nine and I realized my family was an average one. My father has a good job, a wife and a daughter (both living at home). They are the same as every other family out there. And this isn‚Äôt just the US either. I‚Äôve lived abroad, visited multiple countries and have seen numerous families all around the world. I‚Äôd be hard pressed now to say I haven‚Äôt seen a one that doesn‚Äôt resemble this.
So, my novels focus on a family that‚Äôs pretty average. Every girl likes to read these stories because she wants to be the hero, to save someone who is being hurt and to find love. The idea is very simple is it not?
I realized how many similarities a normal family has, and decided to focus on my own family, and to add my own tweaks to it, but to keep the essence. This gave birth to my novels, which focus on my family. My family as they really are. I wanted everyone to see the real family, with its good sides and flaws. I really believe that one should always be real and not pretend the world is like Disney, which it obviously isn‚Äôt. We are all made of imperfect beings and we never get it right, but I believe our families are the greatest gift we‚Äôre given, and they need to be appreciated.
So, this is my reason for writing, and the reason I wish to share with everyone that has a family who are special, unique, and amazing.
I believe many adults will take away from this story a lesson that can and will change their lives for the better, and children will be inspired to do better for themselves, their family and their future.
I know I have been inspired by my family to become the best person I can, and after reading this story, I truly can‚Äôt see anyone who isn‚Äôt touched by the story. It is truly moving, and a story that makes me proud, for now I can see where I got my inspiration from.

The Chihuahua is the smallest dog breed. The Chihuahua is a dog breed which originates in Mexico. They are generally 20 to 27 inches tall and 9 to 17 pounds with solid colors and a multitude of patterns including: Black and Tan, Blue, Brindle, Chocolate, Fawn, and Smoke.
Catahoula Cur was a popular dog breed. Its known as a large mixed breed dog, and it was used to help take care of cattle in the Louisiana and Texas regions. Now its one of the top ten working dog breeds in the United States.
Basset hound. Bassett hound.
The Basset Hound is the largest of the American hound breeds. Bassets were used to hunt rabbits from behind, and dogs that are too active dont make good hounds. That means Basset hounds must be calm, patient and well balanced.
Basset Hounds have a broad, flat face with no stop. Their muzzles are soft and smooth on both the upper and lower jaws. They have very short, soft ears and small eyes. They have a rather small, wedge-shaped head. They have small, flat, wide noses.
For example, according to a 2004 study at the veterinary school of Loma Linda University, two breeds that are commonly crossed with bassets are German Shepherds and Golden Retrievers.
Basset Hound vs Beagle
Beagle  15.1 inches. Basset Hound  15.5 inches.
Female Beagles are generally smaller than males, growing up to 23 pounds. Male Beagles grow to between 20-32 pounds. Female Basset Hounds are around 26 pounds, while male Bassets can weigh anywhere between 24-35 pounds.
The Pug breeds height varies from 11.2 to 15.0 inches. This puppy will grow between 7.5 and more than 22 kg (16.5 and more than 49 pounds).
It is known, that a short-nosed dog breed was used by the Egyptians for hunting the water animals, while the Basset Hound, although short-nosed, has a rather high nose.
The Labrador Retriever is the tallest breed in this group, standing at a minimum of 19 inches at the withers. The Beagle and the Bassett span from 15-16 inches. And the Bichon Frise is the smallest, although other breeds like the toy poodle and miniature dachshund span from 11 to 12 inches.
Chihuahuas can be small as a beagle or big as a Great Dane. In between youll pretty much find every size known to man. However, it is important to note that what is a Chihuahua depends on its length. It is determined by whether it is taller than 4.5 inches or not.
Basset Hounds are typically 20-22 inches in length, including the tail. They weigh approximately 31-40 pounds, but this can vary widely based on whether the breed is active or sedentary.
The Basset Griffon Vendene is not a mix of the Basset Hound and the French Griffon. It is another different breed altogether.
The best Basset Hound breeds to mix with are:Beagle  A Bassets second-best friend, the beagle also has an enthusiastic personality, is friendly and loyal and is a great fit for Bassets.Dachshund  A Dachshund can provide the right intelligence and athleticism that Basset Hounds need.
A Basset can be a mix of other breeds, such as:Beagle  This breed tends to be a larger version of the Basset.Labradoodle  This is a popular breed because it mixes a Lab with a poodle.
When used alone, either Bassett or Bassett hounds are often considered terriers. While both refer to a similar type of terrier, the term describes a dog which is primarily a sighthound, like a Bassett.

Bear species that are extinct: The great auk, elephant bird, moa, and hare-wallaby are all extinct species of bear.
There are three bear species that still exist in Australia, but it also was home to giant wombats, giant beaked bats, giant skink, giant wallaroo, giant pigeon, and Tasmanian tiger. None of these are still alive..
The Giant Bear (Ursus Mavrayi) The Giant Bear has the largest upper canine tooth ever found of any type of bear, and is believed to have lived in the area called the Pleistocene, back in 20,000 to 200,000 years ago. It weighed around 800 pounds and was around 7 feet high!

There have only been two bear species in Colorado for most of the last 10 million years (Ursus arctos and U. americanos), with occasional visits from the massive, long-extinct Ursa Americanus.
The brown bear population continues to decline, and the species is on the verge of extinction in many places, including Italy, the Canary Islands, Great Britain, and northern Europe. The brown bear‚Äôs current status is an excellent example of the consequences of a loss of habitat and fragmentation of species range.
There is now no brown bear in the Caucasus, although it had once swarmed the high valleys of Georgia. In the 1930s 9000 were killed in just 13 years. In this case humans were the main agents. The last bear, a male, was killed in 1992.
The extinct bear family also included the cave bear (Ursus spelaeus, meaning ‚Äúone who lives in the caves‚Äù), which was larger than polar bears and lived in Europe and parts of Asia.
They include the giant, woolly mammoths, the sabre-tooth tigers, steppe scimitar cats and giant ground sloths; the enormous dodo of the Indian Ocean islands, great auk of the North Atlantic and flightless emu of Australia; and dwarf elephants, mastodons, short-faced bears and other now-extinct forms of modern mammals.
Brown bears were considered extinct in mainland Europe by a team of researchers after their last confirmed sighting in 1871. Despite new evidence, the brown bear population across the entire European land mass remains under threat.
There are three types of bears that can be found in Colorado. They are the grizzly bears, the brown bears and the black bears. While the state of Colorado has no bears of their own, bears have roamed through Colorado more than 20,000 years ago and still occasionally visit.
Bears are listed as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List.
The polar bear is also a subspecies of the brown bear, known as a grizzly bear. Their coat is more brown or black, while the polar bear‚Äôs is usually a dull white. The polar bear has been designated as a protected species under the Endangered Species Act.
Polar bears are now in dire straits because of man-made global warming.

instruction: Why is kobe beef so damn expensive?
output:
Why is kobe beef so damn expensive?
Kobe beef is famous for not being all that famous. Only 6000 Kobe-certified cows are slaughtered per year, and the animals have been selectively bred for more than a century for ultra-luxe eating.
Why is Kobe beef so expensive? The high price points can primarily be attributed to the strict quality control standards the animals are required to meet. Kobe beef is only recognized by its distinctive brand stamp, and cattle are only labeled with the coveted designation when they meet certain production requirements.
What Makes Kobe Beef So Special?
The only way to get certified as a Kobe beef is if your beef must have a minimum of 120 days on feed. The process takes 21 months, as the beef also requires at least three years of being raised at a feedlot farm.
Furthermore, to get the coveted Japanese Kobe beef label, your animal must only have been fed grass for 35 days after slaughter. Most beef, on the other hand, could spend up to half a year being kept in a feedlot before slaughtered and sold.
Another issue with the way it‚Äôs produced is that cows are slaughtered in a specific way that keeps all the fat and tendons intact for better taste and texture. To avoid this, the animals are slaughtered in the butcher shop, not on the farm. This makes it more costly to produce than other types of meat.
The most expensive Kobe steak costs about $51 per serving, according to Forbes, making it over 10 times more expensive than your regular Angus steak. But don‚Äôt get fooled by these numbers ‚Äì don‚Äôt expect a $51 steak to be as expensive as it seems.
Another aspect to be considered is that the price of Kobe beef varies by the method of production, including where the cow is raised, where the beef was produced, and then finally how it is sold to the public.
That being said, there are some beef producers who try to replicate Kobe‚Äôs beef-producing process and replicate a similar taste by growing grass on a ranch, which is still not the same as what Kobe cows get to eat. But since some bovines still aren‚Äôt used to eating this kind of grass, the flavor is not quite as flavorful as it is for a certified Kobe cow.
What distinguishes the quality of Kobe beef from other kinds is the fat: the high concentration of marbles, or fat beads, inside the skin. These ‚Äúbuta‚Äù (Japanese slang for beef) have small fat globules called ‚Äúmarbling‚Äù that are so tight and small that they can‚Äôt penetrate beyond the first layer of muscle fibers when cooked, which means that they don‚Äôt leave any flavor on the surface.
Kobe‚Äôs marbles are larger than the marbling found in New York strip steaks, which allows them to break down into more flavorful juices when they‚Äôre cooked. These marbled areas are what make Kobe beef so highly sought-after.
When Kobe cattle are slaughtered for their beef, the fat will usually be removed from the meat, but these marbles can be preserved if they‚Äôre sliced carefully from the cut, allowing all of the juices to be retained (it also makes these cuts look gorgeous). That‚Äôs why, instead of cutting these marbled areas from the cuts, chefs typically serve them whole.
The ‚Äúcut of the beef‚Äù is all about how thick or thin the meat is, and the type of cuts are determined by the breed of animal. The meat is sliced into steaks called fillet (also known as ‚ÄúT-bones‚Äù), filets, cubes (cubed), rib-eyes, strip, and porter house.
When it is sliced and served in whole portions, Kobe beef is prized for its rich taste and is considered one of the finest cuts of beef. However, after cooking, the fat melts and creates oil that will seep through the meat and add flavor and richness to it. So when sliced, the fat tends to be more evident, making it look less attractive than when it‚Äôs served as whole portions.
Are the cuts different?
Different cuts produce different flavors, which is why Kobe beef is a popular choice for chefs who wish to showcase the full capabilities of their cooking talent. Kobe cuts are categorized according to their thickness, which affects the fat content of each meat (the more fat, the more flavorful the beef should be).
Fillet cuts are the most common choices for dining-out restaurants. They come with a thin center and are considered a tender, flavorful cut of beef, so they are ideal for cooking. The thin fillet cuts are also delicious when smoked and roasted.
A filet is a steak cut from the ribs that can include the rib section or the loin (in the case of sirloin). Most restaurants only have

instruction: How do I clean my armpits?
output:
How do I clean my armpits?
Some of us might use an antiperspirant to control sweat but we all know that doesn‚Äôt stop the stink. In fact, you need to change your antiperspirant routine, as you may be putting your skin at risk. The best way to keep your underarms free and fresh is to use a specially formulated cleanse and exfoliate product. This will remove dead skin from the surface and get your pores clean.
It doesn‚Äôt work. Just because you are getting your armpits clean, doesn‚Äôt mean that it will still smell fresh. If your armpits are still stinking, you need to address the cause ‚Äì if your armpits is stinking, they aren‚Äôt clean.
Here is the good news. You can use simple household ingredients to take care of your armpits!
This all natural way to remove the stink from your armpits will be your new life saver. Follow the below step-by-step for a clean and fresh way to stay cool this summer.
This will gently moisturize and clean the skin and remove any surface dead skin, making it more effective.
So you don‚Äôt have to worry about any of that.
Once your armpits are clean, you will still need to exfoliate your underarms to get rid of the dead skin. The same concept as your hands, but in a different area.
We are going to use a washcloth to remove any leftover dirt and grime without using an exfoliating cleanser. Your washcloth should have a smooth surface that is free of microbes. But, just like you shouldn‚Äôt use fabric softeners on your clothes, a non-sterile washcloth can harbor some pesky bad bacteria. We are cleaning the surface, we still need to exfoliate so make sure it is dead clean.
Let‚Äôs get this over with, we‚Äôre going to exfoliate armpits!
We‚Äôre going to use an anti-bacterial exfoliant that can remove surface dead skin. You don‚Äôt want to over do your skin. Remember to clean your armpits, but you do not want to peel the skin with harsh chemicals.
A little goes a long way. Start on a single underarm and work your way down and out.
Once you feel that it‚Äôs time, you can rinse off and wipe off the excess product. Make sure that you only apply just enough to get the job done. Using too much can burn your skin. It‚Äôll do more harm than good and cause breakouts!
Here are two ways you can make your life easier.
Washcloth: This is inexpensive, reusable and great for removing your exfoliant off the skin.
Microwave: A fresh hot washcloth and two microwaves? This is a pretty easy trick to make your life easier. Start your microwave without the pot.
After about 10 seconds to ensure your pot is warm, transfer the hot water into your washcloth to soothe your skin. For ease, I found the best way to exfoliate armpits is by using a washcloth. I usually use an old towel, but it can do a nice job.
If your microwave is ready, place the pot inside to soak up some of the heat. If not, let it sit until it makes a noise. We don‚Äôt want you to accidentally touch a hot wire.
For this, the washcloth is your best bet. It‚Äôll be a little rough on your skin. I‚Äôve tried it with and without a paper towel and it‚Äôs better without one.
You will also notice a lot of dead skin floating on the surface. This is great because it allows you to know exactly what you used and how long you used it.
These are only a few exfoliants to help freshen your armpits and they don‚Äôt require a trip to the store every time you wash your armpits. It‚Äôll save you time and money. It‚Äôs also a good idea to start a routine, because it gives you something you can count on every time you get a shower.
But keep in mind, that after a while, you will outgrow some of these products. You will want something that not only smells great but also contains ingredients that are gentle for your armpits. It‚Äôs important to choose a product that really works and won‚Äôt dry your skin that it‚Äôs out of control.
The same thing is true for washing your hair. You need to pay attention to your scalp and not the product you add to your hair.
If you want to find a good one, we made a list here: Best Natural And Organic Products For Hair.
When it comes down to it, any exfoliating product should do

instruction: How do I detail a car?
output:
How do I detail a car?
To detail a car, you must remove both visible and hidden dirt from all parts. Washing and drying are the first steps for cleaning. Dampen a sponge or chamois by dipping it in plain dishwashing liquid and rubbing it on a rag. Use these sponges to remove dirt before vacuuming. After the car is clean, use a vacuum to blow out the dust and other debris, and you can also use a hair dryer to remove any water stains. Use car shampoo or similar products to clean the interior. This ensures that you avoid using harsh solutions that damage plastic and fabric. When cleaning the outside of the vehicle, use an anti-rust product, such as wheel sealant. For the finishing touches, apply an interior conditioner or polishing product.
Is there any way to remove rust from a car?
Yes, rust can be removed from a car using methods such as using an acid cleaner, using a fine grit abrasive material, and using a heavy car or an equivalent substitute.
Can you polish a dented car?
Yes, it is possible to polish a dented car. First, you will need to sand it down, removing damaged paint and scratches. Next, you will need to apply a good quality car paint. Finally, you will need to use an aluminum polish to remove any imperfections.
How do you take care of a 10-year-old Jeep?
To take care of a 10-year-old Jeep, you will need to perform a few key tasks. The first is to make sure that the car is properly maintained. This means making sure the tires are in good condition, that the brakes are working properly, and that the fluids such as oil and coolant are checked regularly. The second is to give the car a regular check. This means checking for any signs of wear, such as a crack or leak in the body, or a worn or missing part. If there are any issues found during the check, they should be addressed quickly.
What are some helpful tips for cleaning a dirty car?
Some helpful tips for cleaning a dirty car include vacuuming the floors, wiping down the dashboard, and giving the interior walls a good clean. For best results, use a mixture of baking soda and vinegar to degrease stains and dirt.

instruction: What kind of foods do they eat in Thailand
output:
What kind of foods do they eat in Thailand?
Thai food can be very varied but most common are: coconut milk, chili peppers, fish sauce, rice and fresh vegetables. There are also three national dishes in Thailand: Som Tam (papaya salad with shrimp). Gai yang (grilled chicken thighs). Kaeng naam (Thai green curry) and tom yum (a kind of sour and spicy soup based on lemongrass).
What is the most traditional Thai food?
The dishes are generally served in individual ‚Äúbowlfuls,‚Äù while the main dishes are served with rice. Most Thai meals do not include a meat dish. Instead, they usually include one or several of one of the following main dishes: Tom yung goong (a shrimp-based broth); Som tam (papaya salad).

Is fish common in Thai food?
Fish are not only on the menu for Thai meals, but Thai people eat everything that is in the sea. If they were to eat only fish that would only be enough food to provide the population of Thailand with food.

**_Meteorites that have struck the planet_**

( _Note: An asteroid is an object made up of metal and rocks that is smaller than a planet. These are mostly irregularly shaped and have no atmosphere so they can be thought of as planets-in-waiting. However, they usually only have a diameter that is from 1 km to a few hundred kilometers, while the planet of Jupiter (Jovian) is so large that its diameter is from 14 to 70 times that of the Earth)._ )

#  **2.3 Meteorites (Meteorites and Asteroids)**

**Key Concepts 2.3.1 and 2.3.2.** Meteorite. Meteorites. What are meteorites? They are tiny or small pieces of rock that are fragments of asteroids that have been either melted into a liquid and then solidified, or they are broken off as pieces. Meteoritic materials are mostly iron and nickel, and they are very rare.

Asteroid. An asteroid is a relatively small rocky body circling the Sun within its own orbit in between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter.

Meteorites are a type of meteoroid that has impacted Earth's atmosphere. Some meteoroids are able to withstand the heat of entry into the Earth's atmosphere and crash without being vaporized.

For this chapter we will first try to answer the question of "Meteorites."

Meteorite. Meteorites is defined as "a piece of matter that enters the Earth's atmosphere and that comes back to the Earth's surface, where it is caught by a human. This occurs because most meteorites are small and do not vaporize or burn up before reaching the surface." ( _T_. _H_. _G_. _Gardner_ , _U_. _S_. _Prices_ , _and_ , _G_. _D._ _Masters_ , 1986, _Vol_. _1_ , _The Meteorites of the Earth_.) The size of a meteorite can vary from a few millimeters to a hundred kilograms or more.

Meteorites are the only objects in space with which we can make a close personal contact. There exist only limited opportunities to collect or examine meteorites as most were not recovered in time for people to gather them up. There are other collections, including some that were not in close contact with the Earth, but they were not considered in this book's consideration since they were not collected by the writer.

Metors, asteroids, and meteoroids all come from the same space debris or body. So it appears that they all might be called "meteorites," but for the purposes of this book it appears that they might all be called meteorites. Why is this important?

The only known body in space that is formed of rock and metal is the Earth and the Moon. The only objects in space that are formed of the same matter as meteorites are asteroids and the Moon. Therefore, _all_ rocks and metals that we encounter either on land or on our water are by nature meteorites, or meteoritical.

output:
Hi, I have some falafel, but no tahini to put on them. Can you give me a recipe for making tahini?
The basic recipe is quite simple: Put a few tablespoons of tahini in a bowl and stir in a little of the water from the sesame seeds. This way tahini will become very thick, almost as it is sold at the markets. But the tahini still needs some other flavors so that it can become delicious.
In a frying pan, heat a little oil (for example, canola oil) and fry onion, garlic, lemon and sometimes some parsley or cilantro. Use salt and black pepper to taste. And then put on top of the falafel as if it was salad.
I just have one question. It was my great-grandmother who taught me how to make the best falafels and the secret to their success was the way she pressed them to the pan, the tahini in the middle & how many you put on one plate & the way they were served. Could you please send back to her and thank her.
I was born in a big family of 3 sisters, 2 brothers and my father and mother. Growing up in a loving, open and fun family made us all very close.
I‚Äôm the youngest in the family, and as you will notice on all other posts on my blog, I‚Äôll put my family and my husband‚Äôs family ‚Äì my parents-in-law ‚Äì before any other issues, even my own blog.
There are some things which are really important to me.
For example: when an old aunt passed away, my parents (she was my dad‚Äôs aunt) she had no other family members to attend her, and my parents decided to organize an open-air funeral in our courtyard, everyone came and there was a big meal afterwards. Just a regular old fashioned Greek funeral, without the superimposition of modern ways. And everyone had a great time ‚Äì because of what‚Äôs important is in a family.

instruction: When was Canada colonized?
output:
When was Canada colonized?
Canadians have no idea when their nation was colonized; many confuse it with the time of the first known peoples to live here, the Clovis people which date back 11,000 years. What we did know was that it was very bad and most of the colonists were white and only very well-off white or in the process of becoming that, and most indigenous people were not treated well. A lot of the people were simply murdered or were worked to the point of exhaustion and death.
Most people are not aware that Canada was colonized much later than the United States. Most people think that Canada was colonized in the 17th century, the same as the United States. However, that was the case only in Nova Scotia and Newfoundland. By the start of the 18th century, only about 40,000 were colonized in Nova Scotia, Newfoundland and what would later become Prince Edward Island. By the end of the 18th century, there were about 200,000 and by the 1820s about 400,000. So, the British were relatively late to establish their North American Empire. This is why there are so many people who have a hard time believing this.
Another reason people don‚Äôt believe we were colonized is because, prior to this, we never had a written history. By the time we had started to write things, no longer lived in isolation.
The colonization process
The first major effort to colonize Canada was not so much by the British Crown but by private investors. We have to realize that in order for colonization to take place, a substantial number of people had to move a great distance to an unknown and often hostile land. Those moving were not all from the British Isles and were not all from wealth. They were seeking gold, land, to be with family and friends, etc.
First, we colonized eastern Canada. Most of this was done by small-scale operations, and in those days, a lot of men traveled to these areas and married local women. It was also much more difficult during that era to travel to Canada and get to know people. So, these small-scale operations had a lot of children that, due to the nature of the time, were raised as Christian and adopted or renamed new last names. This means that not everyone has the same last name as their mothers‚Äô last name. It is for this reason that some people in eastern Canada will insist to someone else that they are 100% European when genealogical research can easily show that they are not.
Then in 1815, we began colonizing of the North West. Here the colonists came into contact one of the most fiercely independent and dangerous groups of indigenous people: the Blackfoot. It was a very violent time and many men died. A few were killed by Blackfoot warriors; the rest were killed trying to find game to hunt for the winter or getting caught in the bitter and freezing cold.
The majority of European men who migrated to Canada arrived by the end of the 19th century; this was not the case in the West. The most recent arrivals were men who were either forced to migrate by the United States, or who were part of the Great Migration. The 19th-century migration was driven by the climate, economic conditions and by a few European nations, like Scotland. It was also by the North West Company and the Hudson Bay Company.
In 1885, we had 23,000 Europeans living in Saskatchewan, Manitoba and Alberta. This was the largest European group that could be found in western Canada at the time. Within a few decades, immigration slowed down due to the Great Depression, and the population began to decline.
As of 2011, there are 3.6 million Canadians, 0.5% of whom could not self-identify as one of us. That is quite a low number for a population that is 99.5% French Canadian and 0.5% others.
The second wave of colonization
Some of those who did not self-identify as French Canadian or Inuk Canadian were descendants of colonists who arrived in the early 1900s or later.
The population exploded in the post-war era, not just with people who came to Canada from the United States. We also saw thousands of immigrants from Asia, the Middle East, former Yugoslavia and elsewhere.
If you look at immigration at the provincial level it is easy to see that most immigrants choose the province where they can have the most say in terms of their religion, language, values, etc. For example, in Quebec (the province that most people think of when they think of the French) 66% of immigrants go to Ontario and 6

instruction: How can I  use my phone less?
output:
How can I  use my phone less? The phone-dependence culture is so engrained that some people think about it in terms of a time management problem. Can you carve time during the day (or weeks) to give to other uses of your time and focus? For many, the answer is "no." But you don't need to be in that camp. I will show you that you can, in fact, rewire your mind to live well with technology (including social media). I'll also offer some suggestions from experts like Gary Vaynerchuk (18) and Peter Diamandis (43) and from my own observations. And I'll describe how this rewiring helped myself and others make peace with technology in our daily lives.

How do you keep your head above the technology-turbulence? Do you think there is something you can do to reduce the craziness? Is it true that you can control your device a bit more, and give you more freedom and health, at the same time?

Yes, you can. In fact, it is the only way you can.

But how?

First, I will describe in a story what rewiring your mind to live well with technology means, and what life looks like when you succeed at this. Then I will present some suggestions drawn from experts who are working on this problem. They include Gary Vaynerchuk, who is one of the most successful entrepreneurs of my generation and whose advice I follow, and Peter Diamandis, who has been a successful entrepreneur and inventor, and is the co-founder and director of Singularity University (SU). I will also discuss some other advice and some examples that I have gleaned from others. The third part of this book is one big example where I have attempted to live the life of tech rewiring.

I will be taking about technology, but you don't need to be a techie. The concepts and ideas of reskilling and rescheduling are not specific to any technology or industry, but are important wherever you work. I believe that the tech rewiring mindset is an important part of the modern world that will help you in all spheres of life  no matter what your profession.

If you think you should be focusing more on your job or business, but find that you are being distracted and that you are missing opportunities, read on....

If you are worried about keeping up with technology, or thinking that the time that would be better spent doing other things, then read on....

If you think that technology shouldn't be getting into your head, or you should have been able to avoid it but you didn't, then read on....

If you think you should know what is going on in your child's school life, even when you don't have time to check your phone every day, then read on....

If you don't have enough time to focus on your family, so you can't respond to your kids or keep your family healthy, or you can't be there even when they need you, then read on....

If you can't go out of town because you are always at the phone, then read on....

If you are not able to get enough sleep because you are distracted by your smartphone, and/or you can't disconnect from your work when you come home, then read on....

If you don't have the time to do the things that you like because of your work, or you don't even know anymore what your work is, except for looking at your screen all day, then read on....

If you wake up and your first thought is what e-mail you missed or who is calling you, and how long your next task is, and what the next call is going to be about, then read on....

If your life is becoming dominated by technology and you don't think that it should, then read on....

If you want to free up more of your time, and have more in your life to get things done, and don't know how you can, then read on....

If you have started to think of your phone as an extension of yourself and cannot imagine your life without it, then read on....

If you feel a void and yearn for what you used to enjoy, without feeling that you have the time for this, and not even knowing why you used to enjoy it, but you know that things used to be different, then read on....

If you are overwhelmed by technology, and find it hard to control your emotions when you are frustrated because of it, if you feel you are struggling to live by your values with the current technology, then read on....
