instruction: Hi, I'd like to learn how to play racquetball. Can you explain the game to me?
output:
Hi, I'd like to learn how to play racquetball. Can you explain the game to me?
Racquetball is a fast paced game for two people. One begins the game and plays until he/she is forced to retire in a game of short 30-second points.
All positions are made with the racket side facing the other person. If at any point in the rally the ball hits the player on his side of the court, he loses the point and is forced to retire. If the opponent misses the ball with his own racket the ball is returned by the receiver.
It is a very physical game where there are many different ways of playing.
What equipment do I need to play racquetball?
In order to play a game of racquetball you need to have a racquetball, a player's helmet, racquetball shoes and a game schedule.
What kind of shoes should I wear for racquetball?
When playing racquetball, players wear racquetball shoes for increased mobility. Racquetball is a very quick game, and if you do not have the right footwear, you may cause yourself an injury. If you see a player in the gym with high boots and long shorts, you know that they know how to play racquetball.
How many games of racquetball are played in a tournament?
In a tournament, there will be a set number of games played depending on the age group. The number of games will be determined by the size of the tournament, and most of them will be best two out of three games. In some tournaments, games must be completed within a certain time frame, meaning that one player may not receive enough chances to win a game.
What kind of positions are used in a game of racquetball?
There are many positions used in racquetball, and it all depends on how you want to play. If you are playing the sport for the first time, we suggest that you start off using a backhand. This is because of its ease and is a very simple position, so you will not have to have to think as much. You can switch this position in and out as you get more comfortable with playing the sport. If you are going to play singles you need to play a backhand most of the time. In team racquetball you need to try to take the ball all the way down the court and play an open court racquetball.
1. To hit the ball with your racquet side to racquetball player.
2. If you miss the ball with your racquet, it is played back by your opponent.
3. If the court player misses the ball with his racquet, the net player has to put the ball into play.

instruction: Hi, I'd like to learn to bake challah. Can you give me a recipe for that?
output:
Hi, I'd like to learn to bake challah. Can you give me a recipe for that?"
A: To get that question out in the open, because I don't want to give it to the readers, I'm going to go ahead and start my answer today. I'm going to tell them a story. It goes like this: My mother asked me to make challah. I did it; I made it, and what happened is, when I handed it over to her and she was about to put it back in the oven she started crying; she was choked up - I wasn't really aware or even prepared to make this story come out - and she said, "My challah is not that it is." I looked at her and said, "Mommy, I made it for you. I worked on that dough. I got the butter out of the fridge, I got the water that's hot out of the burner, I got the flour ready to knead, and I kneaded it for you."
How many of you used to make challah because it was fun? How many of you were doing it for the parents? How many of you found it to be a real labor of love? It was just one more thing to do; "But Mom, all right, I'll do that." In fact, one of the things that I hear from a lot of people and from a lot of mothers about children, "I say let him do it, but I am scared that he is going to get hurt," and I often see little boys on the kitchen counters standing on the chairs. I used to do it when I was a child, too, but let me tell you, I never made my mother come to the kitchen because her challah didn't turn out the right way. In fact, there was this one time that I remember when my mother went to make challah, and it turned out to be so hard that her finger got stuck inside of it when she was pulling a part of it out.
A: No one asked me to come in because of that. My father used to say, "You don't make the challah." He thought that he was the one who was going to be blamed. That's when my mother started going, "I did this and I did that, and your father did this, and your brother did that, and so I'm supposed to be the only one to blame? No one asked me to make it, but now I am blamed for it." That was a very sad day for her. That was the day she used to say that her challah is not that it is.
The last time I made challah for my mother was just about two months ago, and now I am going to tell him what my brother and I cooked up, the recipe, which we gave to her. It worked and it looks like a regular challah. The first thing you do is get some butter out of the fridge. Not cold butter; get it out of the fridge because the temperature of milk when it reacts is different than the temperature of room-temperature water, and when that happens it makes you dough rise much faster and makes it come out nice and beautiful. If you have to use room-temperature milk, add some more yeast so the dough doesn't stay flat. Next thing that you do is add some water and some flour. When I was little I used to watch my mother kneading the dough, but I don't do it that way anymore. What I do now is take the butter and the milk and I get it all out in one place, because I like to use the mixer. When I go to the kitchen in the morning my mother knocks on the door saying "I need you to make me a challah," for once and a half a year or for most of my life.
In order to get things over with and to get ready to bring it to her, I have now gotten a mixer for my oven and I make the challah inside. What I do is first make a whole milk and put it all in the bowl. Next, in the bowl I put the rest of the water that I used for cooking, and last of all I add some flour and knead it. I knead it into a ball, it's nice and soft, and I put it straight in my mixer. The reason why I am telling you that is because the last time I made challah I did all this inside. I put the flour in there and when I add the butter, I try to add it the first time and you don't understand it's going to get all over everything around it. When the dough gets thicker, you start doing it again and again, and you don't get it all and you can't take it off. I call you to take it off

The Facebook help section has detailed information on how you can manage friends, privacy controls, profiles, and other features of the site. The main features of Facebook are its News Feed, profiles, groups, and private messages. Facebook is a social networking website where users can post comments and create profiles for other users they know. Facebook users can send each other "friend requests" or Facebook messages. They can also form groups, share personal notes about themselves, and have a direct link to their online calendars and Flickr images. There is also a section near the top of each page where they can share their likes with the world, add friends, make lists of friends and add them to lists, and rate pictures they find on other users' pages.

You can search for a person on Facebook either by typing in their name or their email address/contact number. If a person has registered as a member, you will see a public profile for that user. Public profiles contain personal details such as the person's name, location, and job status, as well as images they have uploaded to their page. The person's email address is public in a public profile, but a person's address information is only available if that person has a private profile or a "friends only" Facebook.
Facebook pages can be set up by anyone, but they are generally used by businesses and organizations. Create a personal Facebook page by going to www.facebook.com/p/yournameandusername/ and clicking "Create a personal page." If you set up a business or organization page, start by going to: www.facebook.com/pages/yourname.com/. To find a business page, go to www.facebook.com/search/. This will enable you to search for a page in the same way as you would search for a person.

A friend is someone you know well enough that you might call them by their first name. An acquaintance is another person you know, but do not know them well enough to say their first name.

instruction: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Hong Kong  dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Tong Sui?
output:
I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Hong Kong  dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Tong Sui?.
Tong Sui is a very common sweet soup. But it can be difficult to serve a delicious one, especially if you havent used too many ingredients. Here is a recipe that only needs a few ingredients. One of them is rice wine, but not sweet rice wine. And not really good for your blood pressure. It is just 3% alcohol wine. I guess if you prefer a little liquor with your sweet soup, you can go for the better wine instead. Tong Sui is usually a dessert served with ice cream or mango after lunch or dinner.
Rinse the 5 tbsp water beetle and add to a small sauce pot. Add the 4-inch piece of bamboo shoots and boil on a high heat until the bamboo has softened. Turn the heat to a low and add the sliced lotus root, and simmer till done. Add the sweet rice wine and lemon juice, let the soup absorb, and then turn the heat off. Add the chopped peanuts and let the soup steep before serving.
Mix milk, sugar, and cocoa powder until it is fine and smooth, then stir in cream. Heat the milk mixture for about 7 minutes on a low heat, and add the vanilla extract, stirring gently. Keep heating until the mixture turns into a very thick texture. Remove from heat, stir in chocolate chips, and keep aside to stay warm. Serve the chocolate soup with whipped cream and a whole almond.
Rinse the rice and soak in lukewarm water for 30 minutes. Drain the water and add half of the water to a small sauce pot. Cover the pan with a lid and cook on a low heat till the rice has absorbed the water. Once the rice is done, take off the lid and add the remaining half of the water, cover again and cook about the same time. Turn off the heat and let sit in the pot for another 30 minutes.
Once the water is absorbed, mash the rice with your hand to make a fine paste. The rice should be sticky. Add the sugar and salt to taste, and then add the cornstarch and beat again with a wooden spoon till smooth.
Combine the butter and sugar in a sauce pot over a medium heat, and stir until the sugar turns into a honey-like texture. Make sure the butter is not burnt, otherwise the finished product will be bitter tasting, not delicious. Add the chopped peanuts and stir. Meanwhile, grease a pan with butter and melt it on a low heat. Add the peanut butter and stir until it forms a smooth paste. Put the mixture together in a bowl and keep aside.
Pour hot water over the sugar and dissolve it. Separately, heat the whole milk to about 175 degrees C. Once hot, add the milk to the sugar, and let it boil. Keep stirring gently with a wooden spoon until the milk becomes cloudy and thick  do not let it boil on the top of the pan. Once it goes slightly black, the foam will become browny. Turn the heat off and pour into a small pan. Place a wooden stick in the middle of the pan and tilt so that the foam on the side will come down, making a nice decoration for the dessert.
After the milk foam has cooled for five to ten minutes, add the soft chocolate and stir to melt thoroughly. Slowly add the peanut butter paste and keep stirring. Then add the rice paste, stirring until they are well combined. Add 1-2 tbsp of butter, and keep stirring until it is thick and smooth.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees C. Line two baking trays with parchment paper, and lightly grease the paper with light butter. Using a piping bag or spoon, mound small mounds on the baking tray evenly. Bake in an oven for 120 minutes, or 30 minutes for each tray, until a light brown color. Cool and serve.

instruction: I want to start saving some money by growing my own food. Can I do this during the winter with an indoor garden?
output:
I want to start saving some money by growing my own food. Can I do this during the winter with an indoor garden?
Growing food at home can be one of the best ways to stay in control of your health, as well as save a ton of money! We recommend checking out our complete beginners beginner's guide for more information.
How do I prevent my indoor herbs from growing too much?
Herbal remedies are not typically grown with the same vigorous production that vegetables or fruits require for optimal quality and safety. They are best left unchecked throughout the growing time, as some spices and medicinal herbs are actually not as much of a strong a drug until they are allowed to develop their full strength.
How do I clean my gardening tools?
To clean your gardening tools, soak them in warm salt water. Let them soak for at least 20 minutes, then scrub with a good natural soap. If you use your tools regularly, you can do the soaking several times a week. After that, just rinse your tools in clean, fresh, running water to ensure they are clean!
Can I make a small greenhouse indoors by using a trash can and plastic?
Yes you can! We have a step-by-step guide available here if you are interested. It's a simple and inexpensive way to help you grow your own produce, especially during the shortening winter season!
How do I preserve my fresh herbs and/or veggies like cucumbers and zucchini?
You can dry your fresh herbs by hanging your bundles in a warm 80F room. Weigh them down with a can or something heavy down to make sure they don't take a shape you don't expect.
For drying cucumbers and zucchini, wash them well and use wire racks, such as the ones you find in your kitchen's dishwasher, to line the bottom of a bowl. Place some aluminum foil on top and use an oven set to about 130F. Leave them to dry for 3 to 7 days, checking them every day to see if they are completely dry.
How do you get rid of pests and diseases?
When it comes to dealing with pests and diseases, the best way is to learn about their different types and how to prevent and fix them before they become a problem in your garden. For more information, we cover some of our top tips and tools for dealing with these pesky pests and diseases here.
Can I use this method if I have a big and old tree?
This method should be done to a plant 3 to 10 inches in diameter. It's a common practice with more difficult or large ones.
Can I use this method to grow my tomatoes instead of using a trellis?
Yes, you can! It's a great way to train your plant while providing structure and an extra place for it to get some support.
I have a plant that is more then 2 feet long. Should I use this method to train it. My tree has several large limbs and i want to train them to grow in a specific direction.
Use this method with all your plants and see what size/age they're at. It might work for some and not for others.
How do I make a trellis for grapes?
We cover this in our step-by-step guide.
What are the disadvantages of using cords?
You can get them in two different sizes: 5mm and 8mm. It seems there is a slight difference in the way they interact with the plant, but we haven't noticed any big differences in our grow experiments.
The cords start to fray after about 3 to 4 years and sometimes they need to be replaced. However, you can just clip off the frayed sections and new ones will regrow.
It can be used as a trellis or a training system. What are some examples?
You can use a trellis for vines such as grapes, peas, tomatoes, zucchini and more. It can be a nice way to train the plants or help them to stay closer to the ground.
What is your system that helps train vines to stay closer to the ground or the trellis?
How can I train a long plant like okra?
It's a common practice to use a long cordon or a climbing rope in order to train the plant. This system will make it easier to cut the okra as they need to be harvested from 3 to 5 inches from the ground.
Do you have a trellis for cabbage?
We have a complete guide to planting cabbage if you are interested. The same principle applies regardless of if you decide to grow it like you would potatoes or if you use a trellis.
Will this work with melons?
We have a complete guide for growing melons. It's similar

More sex Q&As and answers

A: "I'm sorry for your predicament, but I think that if you are willing to do something sexual for him in which he won't reciprocate, it's possible that no other sexual activity with him will ever be rewarding. Sex is about intimacy, passion and reciprocity. He may be shy about it, but it doesn't mean he doesn't want it. If you love this guy, work on your marriage and let him know how much he means to you. Also, maybe you two need to have a conversation: sit on the sofa and begin talking with him and see where it leads." - Rachel Williams
Q: "My wife is always really tired and doesn't want sex. How can I get her in the mood?"
A: "Ask yourself some honest questions about your relationship. Has it changed? Did something go wrong between the two of you? Why hasn't your wife gotten into the mood? If you're asking someone else this question, you're not talking to yourself, and that's a problem. If this is a common occurrence, you may just need to go to a therapist or marriage counselor." - Sexpert Rachel Williams
Q: "I have a very jealous and possessive girlfriend and she's always jealous of my relationship with my best friend. How can I spice things up?" .
A: "Talk with your girlfriend about her jealousy and how sad you feel that she cannot be less possessive and jealous. Let her know that if she can't get over this, you have to have a serious talk about your relationship. Jealousy and possessiveness are signs of a sick relationship and unhealthy sexuality." - Rachel Williams

instruction: Please tell me about pearls.  Where are they found?
output:
Please tell me about pearls.  Where are they found?
What is their origin?
Who are pearls the most valued by?  And how do they get their name?"

She turned to him and explained that pearls were only the result of the
attempted escape of various living things, that they never could live
again in any other place.

The princess laughed and said that she knew something more than that
already; she also knew that he was a boy and that boys, though they
made mistakes and blunders, were often very clever, and would be able
to guess more than she could say, so she would give him a test.  Would
he like to be the king of the forest?  For you know, she said, that a
kings name and a kings dignity live for ever.  Not even in the great
sea has such a name been heard lately.  Then she told him he was "the
king of those who find treasure and give it to people that are poor, and
take nothing in return but kindness and honesty from every one and all
kinds of people."

Just before he left he made a vow to find them all again.  Before leaving
he thanked her very warmly for the pleasure she had given him by her
instruction. She said she had known that he would be a very great
favour....  But I shall have to be content to tell her story from the
beginning, because I know more about it than she does herself.

Well, now I come to that story, I feel quite excited, for I look upon
it as one of the jewels of the history of my own county.

The people I have found it in call it "The Elstow Jewel" (Elstow is a
very old village on the north side of the river Ouse), but that is only a
narrower form of its original and more frequent name--the "Luffley Jewel"!

The village of Elstow is about ten miles north-west of the city of
Northampton. The little Ouse, which is only about half a mile across
between the parishes of Elstow and Wilstone, flows under the railway
bridges, and on one side it runs right through the village on and off
for a fair walk.  On the other side a short distance further up it is
forded by several footpaths, and there is a green where a number of
foot-print houses have been built as a result of local improvements in
the late eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries. Elstow is of a very
small ancient village, and to the left and right of Luffley, just on
this side of the railway, are only a few cottages.

Before I began to tell you the story, which I shall try to tell as
briefly as possible, I had never seen the jewel myself, but I have
studied a plate which was copied from its most authentic copy in the
Northamptonshire Record Office, and it is still there on exhibition.  It
is not a very large jewel, and it must have been very hard and fragile
in those days when it was more than four hundred years old.  It is made
up of a thin plate of silver set inside a copper border and enclosing
the two faces of a square block of porous white stone.  This is
impregnated with a coat of very fine black glass, and the centre has a
piece of ruby.  For security the whole is set inside two copper clasps
which are hinged back to the silver plate.  The two sides of the stone
are cut flat and mirror like. They also are engraved in large initials
of a type known at that date, and they are so highly polished that the
word, "_P_L. 1421," still shows up to-day in spite of the time and the
wear and tear.

In 1421 it must have been, as a certain William Tester, a wealthy
Northamptonshire merchant, who I believe did business about a mile or
two away in a little village called Luffley, bought and gave as a gift
to the Priory of Elstow, on the north bank of the river Ouse, as its
newest treasure, a splendidly adorned jewel. It would be the "king of
those who find treasures" if there were any such, but there was not, for
it is almost certain that William Tester found it alone.

Now we shall not know for certain what it contained until some one
(perhaps the present owner, who may be a great-great-great-great,
etc., grand-child of Tester, and

instruction: What are some herbs I can dry out?
output:
What are some herbs I can dry out?
What are herb gardens and what do I do with them now that winter has arrived?
You can dry herbs in your dishwasher according to this article from The Kitchn.
While not all types of herbs have the same amount of active medicinal ingredients, your goal with drying them is to capture the healing properties that are lost once the herb goes out of season.
A herb garden is the space on your balcony, patio, patio or outdoor garden space where you grow your herbs and plants. When you first begin an herb garden, you may choose to start with just one or two plants, but as they mature, you can add more, increasing the size of your herb garden.
Start with a minimum of three herbs.
Choose a herb that you will enjoy using.
Herbs that grow fastest and have the biggest, most aromatic leaves or flowers are best for drying and you can use those leaves right away in herbs and spices or place them in jars to use at a later date.
You can use your herb garden to dry fresh herbs when you find them on the side of the road, in a new community or at any other time you want to use them to flavor your food.
If you have purchased an herb that has been dried, you dont need to try and make it into an herb garden because its almost certainly not going to grow into a lush green plant.
However, if you have a friend or family member who has harvested herbs before and would like to keep some of these fresh herbs, you can give them the dry ones without needing to create a plan for them to grow.
Are there any herbs that I can dry out?
Aromatic herbs such as basil, thyme, marjoram, oregano, tarragon, rosemary, mint and sage.
Leverage a dehydrator for short-term drying or freeze them for longer periods of time.
You can use a dehydrator at low temperature to help dry out herbs and then store them in a jar. Just be sure to remove the leaves or parts of the plants that will turn color when exposed to the air during this process.
Freeze dried herbs last a fairly short time before they go bad and begin to smell unappealing. However, they do keep well if you vacuum-pack them in an airtight container and keep them in your freezer.
You can buy herbs already dried if your kitchen does not have a dehydrator. There is a huge variety, especially online, that allows you to find the type of herb you prefer the most.
While you may not be able to find the specific herbs you want available in your local stores, you can often find dried herbs on Amazon.com depending on your location or on eBay, another online auction site, if you live somewhere where they do not provide enough customers to keep dried herbs in stock.
After you have dried your herbs, its time to figure out how you will store them.
Store your dried herbs in different ways depending on if you will be using them in your food preparation or if you are wanting to hang on to them for later use.
Once your herbs are dried, store them in an airtight container in a cool dark place when you arent planning on using them for a long period.
If you dont plan on using your herbs for the long haul, you can store them in a vacuum-sealed container in a refrigerator for up to three months, but I would suggest storing them in the pantry in an airtight jar and using them regularly.
If you need to take your dried herbs with you, you can store them in an airtight jar. Just make sure to seal the lid and put them where you arent likely to shake them up and then break the seal on them.
To get the best possible out of your herbs, you need to keep them out of air and away from moisture or they will lose their medicinal properties.
In a normal kitchen, this isnt a huge problem because your kitchen is generally dry. However, if you live somewhere humid, such as in the southeast of the United States, you need to store your dried herbs away from moisture, both in your pantry and out of your kitchen.
If you find dried herbs you no longer need, you can give them away or use them for other hobbies, such as paper crafts.
If you have too much of an herb for your immediate needs, you can create a poultice by mixing dried herb with some water to use as a poultice or compress to reduce swelling or soreness in a spot on your body.
When it comes to creating poultices, always use an herb that is known to do no harm, as you do not want to use one that could lead to an allergic reaction. When in doubt, ask a doctor because the last thing you want to do is use an allergen or poison to heal your skin.
How Do I Choose Plants To

instruction: Whats the largest star in our galaxy?
output:
Whats the largest star in our galaxy? And why is so important? In order to correctly answer this question, one should first determine what we mean by a star. The best thing to think about when we talk about this astronomical object are our old friends the sun. The sun, however, is a relatively huge star in comparison to all the others in the cosmic pool.
Image: Scaled-down version of the most massive stars in the universe, called red supergiants, like Betelgeuse. They are so massive that they collapse inward onto themselves, resulting in the formation of black holes.
The reason why we should think of the sun as the largest star in our galaxy is that it contains approximately 99.86 percent of all the stars in our galaxy. Its just that the remaining 0.01 percent are rather massive, and if only for that reason they seem to dwarf all other stars.
For instance, the most massive star in the galaxy is called Betelgeuse. Although it is massive, Betelgeuse is a red supergiant. It is so massive that this star actually collapses down onto itself, and if this were to occur on Earth (for some incomprehensibly unfathomable reason), it would probably result in the formation of a black hole. So theres a real possibility that our little white sun (and other stars) are the only examples of stars in our galaxy.
In actual fact, that might not be such a big problem. The fact of the matter is that although Betelgeuse is a red supergiant it has a very small percentage compared to other huge stars with a significant percentage in the galaxy.
Now, where does the name of this massive object come from? It comes from the Arabic word betulekhus, which means hand of Jupiter. If you remember back to a couple of posts ago when we talked about the names of certain astrological events such as Mercury and Venus youll notice how many of them seem to originate from the Babylonian Gods and Goddesses of antiquity. This is not by chance: The most recent discovery of these names come from the ancient Babylonian calendar, which contained a list of 30 star names on the wall.
So there we have it: The most massive star in the universe. Now you will have to wait for some more posts to be written before you can get a clearer understanding of Betelgeuse.
If you have any questions, criticisms or suggestions for what you would like for us to cover next, please use the form below and let us know. Or you can always hit us up in Twitter, Facebook, Google+ and Pinterest.
This entry was posted in Uncategorized and tagged betelgeuse, facts on stars, facts on the universe, largest star, red supergiant.

instruction: I'm trying to draw out a hopscotch game on my driveway. Can you walk me through how to do that?
output:
I'm trying to draw out a hopscotch game on my driveway. Can you walk me through how to do that?

### (1) Draw the outline of the game, using chalk.

First let's draw out the outline of the hopscotch game.

**Figure 4.1:** Drawing out the hopscotch outline

### (2) Draw a line down the middle of the outline.

The dotted line is to separate the rows from one another, so that someone jumping over a hopscotch row will stop before landing, instead of landing in the next row, or crossing over to the other side.

### (3) Draw the row and column lines

We just drew out the rows, it's time to draw in the hopscotch games column lines.

**Figure 4.2:** Drawing in the hopscotch games column lines

### (4) Draw lines from the top of the game to the bottom of each row

Next, we'll draw the lines connecting each row to the top of the game, so people can jump in and out of each row in the hopscotch game.

**Figure 4.2:** Drawing the connecting lines from the tops of the game to the bottom of the hopscotch game

### (5) Fill in the area between the lines that isn't in a row (or column)

We'll finish off the hopscotch game by filling in these areas.

**Figure 4.2:** Filling in the area between rows

## How do I draw a rainbow?

### (1) Draw two triangles

We'll start drawing the rainbow by drawing a triangle. The triangle that you draw should be about the size of your thumb (about 2 inches long.)

**Figure 4.3:** First draw a triangle using 2 inches of chalk.

## How do I draw a big rainbow?

### (2) Connect the two triangles

Now we'll work our way counter-clockwise to draw two long, connecting triangles.

**Figure 4.4:** Connect two long triangles between the first triangle and the next one.

## How do I draw a star?

### (1) Draw a triangle

We'll draw out a triangle and then draw some side lines to help draw the star.

**Figure 4.5:** Draw a triangle at the bottom

## How do I draw the sides on the star?

### (2) Draw some side lines to make two smaller triangles

We'll draw in some side lines between the triangle and the base of the triangle to make two smaller triangles next to it.

**Figure 4.6:** Draw two small triangles on each side of the star.

### (3) Connect the lines

Now these two sides will cross each other so we'll draw in two lines to connect them.

**Figure 4.7:** Draw two lines to connect the triangles.

### (4) Draw a fifth line to form the star

One of the ways to form a star is by drawing five triangles and drawing in five side lines between them. After drawing the three triangles, we'll draw a fourth one to create a fifth side of the triangle.

**Figure 4.8:** Draw a fourth triangle to form the star

## How do I draw an arrow?

### (1) Draw a triangle

To start off, we'll draw a triangle. This triangle will serve as the body of the arrow, and I'll connect it to the base by drawing in some lines

**Figure 4.9:** Draw a triangle and some connecting lines making the base of the arrow.

## How do I draw the arrowhead?

### (2) Connect the base of the arrow so that it makes an arrowhead

Now the base of the arrow should form an arrowhead and you can connect it with a few more lines to get the head and tail of the arrow.

**Figure 4.10:** Connect the base so the base is the head and tail of the arrow.

## How do I connect the base and head of the arrow?

### (3) Draw in arrows to get the wings

To make this arrow look more like an arrow, draw two more triangles to make the wings of the arrow. You can either draw in triangles that look like a "V" or draw an "L" shape.

**Figure 4.11:** Draw one "V" shape and one "L" shape

instruction: Hi, I need to find the area of a 20 sided die for my math homework. Can you help me do that?
output:
Hi, I need to find the area of a 20 sided die for my math homework. Can you help me do that?

A: This is an interesting problem.  The area of the 20-sided die will be the area of a trapezoid whose bottom half is a trapezoid, whose top half is a pentagon.  The length of the top and bottom is the radius of the 20-sided die, and the length between any point on the top side to any point on the bottom side is the length of a side of the pentagon.
The area of a trapezoid is: ((b+h)/2)*a.  In this case, both a and b are equal; therefore, the area is ((b+b)/2)*a = b*a.  So the area of the trapezoid is the area of the trapezoid at the top minus the area of the trapezoid at the bottom.  The area at the bottom is A1=((h1+1/2*r)/2).  Then A2=[((l)/2).(1/2*r)+r]-A1.  In this case, A1 = (.5*r*r)/2 = .25*r^2, and A2=((r^2+.5*l^2)/2.  Therefore, the area of the trapezoid is .5*(r^2+.5*l^2)-.5*r^2=.5*l^2.
The area of the lower triangle is the area of the upper trapezoid divided by 2:
A(U)=(.5*l^2)/2=.25*l^2
Let S be the total area.  Then S=2*A(U)+P.  P=A(P) is the area of the polygon.  As M.A.R. points out, P= .5*r^2*(21+2*sqrt(5)-5/2)-.5*l^2.  Therefore, S=2*(.25*l^2)+.5*r^2*(21+2*sqrt(5)-5/2)-.5*l^2
That gives us S=.5*(r^2*(21+2*sqrt(5)-5/2)-l^2)
That's how far I've gotten, but as usual, the answer is nowhere near precise in this approximation.  It may be possible to solve for S using the formula that a right-angled triangle is to a rectangle as that rectangle is to a trapezoid.  If so, then we'll get a formula that can be plugged in to get a very precise answer.
--John

A: 
You will get more than you were looking for by using the following formula:
$$A = \frac{b(b+h)}{4}\tag1$$
Let's see why.
The perimeter $l$ of $\newcommand{\A}{\mathcal{A}}\A^{n-2} \times \frac{n-2}{5}\,$ will be $(n-2)\times r$, and the area $S$ will be
$$\int_1^{\tfrac{n-2}{5}} \pi r^2\,\mathrm dr = \frac{\pi r^2}{2}\Big\vert_1^{\tfrac{n-2}{5}} = \frac{\pi \big(\tfrac{(n-2)^2}{20}\big)}{2} = \tfrac{4\, \pi}{5}\,\frac{(n-2)^2}{20}\tag2$$
so
$$\tag3 S = \frac{(n-2)^2}{5}\,\frac{4\, \pi}{5}$$
and equation (1) gives one area exactly.

As an aside, let's see why formula (3) is correct:
We have
$$S = \frac{(n-2)^2}{5}\, \frac{4\, \pi}{5} = \frac{(n-2)\cdot(n-2)}{5}\cdot\frac{4\, \pi}{5}$$
$$S = \frac{(n-2)^2\, \pi}{5}\hspace{120mm}\tag4$$

instruction: I want to learn more about becoming a CPA. How long does it take to become a CPA?
output:
I want to learn more about becoming a CPA. How long does it take to become a CPA?
It‚Äôs not easy to be a licensed CPA. It can take you as much as eight years to become one. It includes taking the qualifying exam for licensure, earning four years of college credits and a bachelor‚Äôs degree, and passing the four-part CPA exam. The exam has five sections and requires 150 questions in total. You must have passed these five sections within 18 months of your first attempt.
Why do you need to become a CPA to work with taxes?
In the United States, CPAs have legal authority and independence to work as tax professionals. If you are working with taxes in the United States, you should be a CPA. CPAs have many different advantages over other tax professionals, including having more years of experience, taking more advanced courses in accounting and taxation, and having more specialized knowledge.
What do CPA preparers do?
CPA reviewers are responsible for providing legal and tax advice to clients. They make sure clients‚Äô records and returns are accurate and in-line with tax laws and regulations and help prepare their clients for audits from the government.
Is the CPA exam hard to pass?
It is very difficult to pass. The CPA exam can be demanding and requires years of education. It‚Äôs also difficult because you can‚Äôt sit for each of the four sections of the exam until you‚Äôve passed the others.
How do you study for the CPA exam?
Passing the CPA exam takes hard work and time. You have to study hard and study many parts of CPA material to pass the exam. You should make your study schedule and include CPA review materials that help cover the broad range of test topics or choose a prep course that focuses more on practice questions.
Are CPAs always in the accounting world?
The CPA can work in finance and investment services, insurance, manufacturing, construction, legal services, and many other professions. Many CPAs work for businesses as accounting directors. About a third of all practicing CPAs work in public accounting firms, and a quarter work for state or local governments.
What is the CPA exam salary?
The median salaries for CPAs vary from $55, 628 in small cities and towns to $78,477 in big cities. In addition to their regular salaries, CPAs may receive bonuses, which can be substantial.
What books are most useful for the CMA exam?
Some useful books for the CMA exam are Essentials of Financial & Managerial Accounting by Edward C. Miller and James G. Moore and Essentials of Managerial Accounting by Kenneth T. Petrie. Other good books are Introduction to Financial and Managerial Accounting by Harold A. Davis, Essentials of Accounting by Gary F. Lutkus, and Essentials of Accounting by Daniel E. Bronson.
How hard is the accounting exam?
How to prepare for the CMA exam?
The CMA exam is similar to the CPA exam but has a broader scope. It is made up of four parts: Financial Planning & Analysis, Financial Statement Analysis, Quantitative Decision-Making, and Managerial Accounting. Each part consists of 125 multiple choice questions. You should be prepared for the CMA exam with about nine months of study.
Do CPAs have to be licensed?
The CPA exam, administered by the American Institute of CPAs, tests for knowledge of accounting and reporting standards. It is a six-part exam, and the first four parts must be completed within one year of receiving the invitation to take the exam.
What is the most important thing to study for the CMA?
To be successful, you must first understand the differences between managerial accounting and financial accounting. Once you have some understanding of the subject, you need to study. The CMA exam requires a strong grounding in general accounting skills. You can also use accounting software to help you with the exam.

instruction: I'd like you to write me a story in the style of Don Delillo, about a bunch of immortal cats living in a New York high-rise co-op.  Go ahead and start a draft!
output:
I'd like you to write me a story in the style of Don Delillo, about a bunch of immortal cats living in a New York high-rise co-op.  Go ahead and start a draft!  If you decide to abandon the idea write me instead about the first thing you ever read by Delillo.  And if you take my advice, it won't be a story I write.  And here is a chance to avoid work.  The rules are:  write for 5 minutes.  write in one draft.  the more fanciful and outrageous you are the more I want, the more fun, and the more chances you have of winning a prize.  Write a story about immortal cats living in Manhattan!  Oh and I got to say, I'm excited about this one.  I'll be in touch!  "  The email sent to the entire team at LITERATI.

LITERATI

A literary magazine.

## **THE MARTIAN BOOK OF MODERN MECHANICAL LITERATURE FICTION**

By Paul Ketchum

LITERATI, 1603 MARTIAN ROAD, P-12, ECLECTIC-12, LORIANG, MARS-2.

**In the years since his mother passed away, his father had** come to despise science and science labs, but the boy in him loved the smell of rubber gaskets. He had spent the whole summer of 1965 as a camp counselor at the nearby Ames Research Laboratory. The work was fun, but he was also a member of the American Astronaut Training Initiative.

And so when his father came home one day, he found one of his workbooks, labeled "1965," and a note: "Son, you've already left. I do not hate you, I hate science labs, please take my father's name."

**"Your last project is the finest thing I have ever produced . . .** "

After finishing the workbook, he learned that his father was a NASA engineer. He had written his son a last will and testament in which he gave _most_ of his possessions to charity. One of the exceptions to this was an old 1958 Volkswagen Beetle. His father had left a note, signed "Your last project," in which he said that, even though the Beetle was an old clunker, the car had been "modified to include a nuclear reactor and a small star-shooting pistol." He also said he _regretted_ his decision, but did not explain why.

**He pulled up to the curb in front of his school, then got out** and walked around to the driver's side, unlocked the trunk, and pulled out his old workbook and the note his father had left. He shoved the note and his father's workbook into his backpack and got back in his car.

**He was in the fifth grade. He had been picked his entire school** year as a peer counsellor, and had recently received an academic scholarship to the nearby New Jersey Military Academy. His parents came for graduation, and they cried and hugged. He told his father that he had a surprise for him, but his father didn't like surprises.

"You've already brought me one," his father said.

"Not like _this_ surprised, Dad. I'll explain when we get home."

His father looked confused. "Well, okay. What is it?"

"I'm dropping out."

**They both cried and hugged again, and he told his father** that he had decided to become a Marine; he would be flying his father's old VW Beetle across the country to San Diego, California, to join the American Astronaut Training Initiative. He didn't see much point in going to school, nor did he have much money.

Silly for such a smart man to have such poor business sense. But still, he smiled and clasped his son's forearm with his free hand. He gave him one more long hug, and then two long hugs.

**When he was fifteen, he was able to drive the car across** the country and into California for his first day of training, despite having no driver's license. He was also able to convince a bunch of senior military officers that a young boy with a .22 pistol and a nuclear reactor could be responsible enough to be an astronaut-in-training.

**The officers had a special conference room at the American Astronaut** Training Initiative, and it was in there that he met his first fellow astronaut-in-

output:

5) Is it true that the Polynesians were really prisoners in the South Seas?
6) Is it true that our Russian ancestors were prisoners on the shores of the Black Sea?"
Hans Christian Andersen (1805 - 1875)
13-year-old Danish poet and author of fairy tales, H. C. Andersen won a poetry contest and was able to publish his writing. While working at a printing house, Andersen met the royal bookbinder. The two got very close, and Andersen lived with him and studied arts and crafts. Eventually, Andersen was hired to work for the royal household.
The story of his life is a rollercoaster ride of the mundane and the wild. Andersen met royalty. He studied bookbinding, met and was hired by a royal bookbinder and lived in a cottage on the grounds of a palace (his writing was very popular). Then, when the printer fired him, Andersen was given the unfortunate duty of making up the royal letters by writing them himself. Finally, Andersen was so tired of his work that he would write the letters while in his bed, then get up and put his name into the letters and send them away.
After that he tried other jobs, such as a clerk. When he was hired as a clerk, he was instructed to draw up all the paperwork. He was then fired because he did not know how to fill in the blanks correctly. A second time, he was fired from his job after writing a story.
1. What is the name of the story where Andersen is taken on a flight of fancy and becomes a bird who has to fly the earth over to meet the king? How does this story link to his life?
2. How did Andersen become a journalist?
3. How did Andersen write the story of "The Ugly Duckling?"
4. How did Andersen become a children's author?
5. How did Andersen become famous and earn royalties for his work?
6. Why did Andersen retire? Describe a typical day of his retirement.
John Buchan (1875 - 1940)
Known for adventures like The Thirty-Nine Steps and a political career, and for his stories and poems, John Buchan writes of life and adventure. Buchan's family was not rich, not poor, but they had financial problems. He started out at Edinburgh University to study medicine, and then transferred to another college to study law. He would eventually graduate in both.
Buchan had other plans, though. He found his way into the diplomatic corps where he could serve his country and explore the world at the same time! The young man started as part of the British Army in India. While there, he wrote his first book. It was called The Half-Hearted and it was written as a satire about his days on the India Corps.
On his return to the UK, Buchan decided there should be a book about military law called, Law and the Soldier. It was an immediate success, and it helped to secure his job as an official writer for the War Office in the UK. This book was followed by other books including, A Letter from Scotland and John Ronald, His Family and Friends.
Buchan decided to take a different approach to his stories, and created the character of Richard Hannay, a man who solved many crimes and mysteries, including The Thirty - Nine Steps and The Prisoner of Zenda (a must-read). This was the birth of the adventure-thriller genre.
Buchan decided it was time to get out of the UK as well as the diplomatic corps, and became a journalist. His articles were published in the best of UK and French papers. Buchan became very popular. In fact, he was so popular that when war broke out, he was chosen as the Minister of Information for the UK. Although this meant he had to resign his journalistic and writing jobs, he did well in this position. He also wrote the book, The Battle for Barrens, which was based on his travels to the Canadian North West and served as a basis for his work there.
While an active politician, Buchan was in no way an inexperienced person or dull. He could be a diplomat when he needed to be, but he could also be quite the adventurer. During World War One, he used his contacts and skills to gain the trust of the Canadians, and was a part in saving many from the terrible battles on the French/German border. He came down with pneumonia after an adventure, and was released from his military service.

instruction: I'm trying to stop my neighbour's cat from coming in to my garden and fighting with my cat. Any suggestions on how to do that?
output:
I'm trying to stop my neighbour's cat from coming in to my garden and fighting with my cat. Any suggestions on how to do that?
If you don't want to get really strict with your cat and just want a preventative measure, the best option to try is to add a cat deterent spray such as "Repellente De Chacao Para Animales Domiciliados" or one similar to it. You can find these at any pet store.
You will need to apply each night for about a week for it to have an effect and remember that the spray will work better if the wind is not coming over your property at the time.
If that doesn't work, you will have to try to train your cat to stay indoors and be on guard whenever your neighbour's cat is coming over to yours. To achieve this you can use some cat treats to lure him to the door. If one cat can be trained to stay inside, any cat is capable of it. Keep trying.
Finally, you can build a very good wall with wooden planks to completely close off your neighbours' garden. But you will need to check the city's rules of that particular place.

instruction: How is oil turned into gasoline?
output:
How is oil turned into gasoline?
The refining process takes between four to six weeks.
Crude oil is distilled into different fractions with varying boiling points and chemical properties based on the size and shape of the distillation column. The first distillation fraction contains gasoline, diesel, and jet fuel.
After separation, the different fractions of the crude oil can be stored for several weeks in large underground storage tanks.
In 2012, 17.2 million barrels of crude oil entered refineries in the EU and EEA. The crude oil was refined to produce 575 million liters of high-octane gasoline, as well as 179 billion liters of other refined fuels.
In 2012, there were 65,000 petrol stations in the EU and EEA, approximately 140 petrol stations per million inhabitants. That is slightly more than the number found in countries in the USA (138).
Most stations have a total of nine petrol pumps. In 90% of the petrol stations petrol is sold exclusively at one pump. The average distance between the nearest refueling station and the home or work place is 2.4 km (1.5 mi).
Petrol prices vary by country, but average 28% of the per capita income.
Around the EU and EEA, 352 million passenger vehicles are in operation.
An increase in car registrations by almost 5% compared with 2011 shows that the car is still seen as a status symbol and has moved from a hobby to a necessity.
In the EU-27, 280 million cars are registered, which is 5% more than in 2011.
The total cost of car ownership ‚Äì a purchase price, depreciation, fuel and insurance, maintenance, repairs, and fees such as parking, tolls or tax ‚Äì are considered when assessing car ownership, including car ownership costs for all cars.
On average, a car costs approximately EUR 7,200 per year to keep (fuel costs and ownership costs only).

The use of smart traffic management systems will allow a better use of the available infrastructure capacity by using the best possible transport mode.
Smart traffic management systems are the first technological step towards smart cities, which optimise cities‚Äô energy efficiency, economic competitiveness, liveability and safety, and the sustainability of city life by implementing new techniques in the area of infrastructure, traffic, energy management, and urban planning.
Smart cities will become the reference point as future technology-driven urban living will be designed, constructed, and maintained in an environmentally responsible way. instruction: When was hip hop invented?
output:
When was hip hop invented?
In the summer of 1979, after more than a century in the shadows of America‚Äôs music, rap began to emerge from New York‚Äôs South Bronx. In 1979 the first rap song was released by a group that started life as the Furious Five. The title? ‚ÄúRappin‚Äô and Rhymin.‚Äô‚Äù
What was the first rap album?
It was originally released as a single in 1978. For the first time, a song was on Billboard‚Äôs Hot 100 as well as the Black Singles List (top 20 songs by black artists). Grandmaster Flash‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Message‚Äù is the first rap single to reach the top 10 on the Hot 100.
Where can I watch Grandmaster Flash?
Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five. Watch now.

Jarrett Lee Conner.. Directed by:
Who is Grandmaster Flash best friends with?
After leaving The Furious Five in 1979, DJ Grandmaster Flash teamed up with singer Melle Mel to form a new group called Grandmaster Flash and the Furious Five. They released a new song, ‚ÄúThe Show‚Äù, which earned them their first Number One single.
What is the importance of Grandmaster Flash?
Grandmaster Flash was a founding member of the influential group, the Furious Five, who were the first hip hop group to use turntables as well as being vocal.
Who made the first breakdance?
As DJ Afrika Bambaataa, the first person to use the break-beat and to breakdance. He was the founder of the Hip Hop/Black Nationalism/Black Muslim movement in the South Bronx and credited with developing the musical/dance combination ‚Äúbeatbox,‚Äù which had a significant cultural effect on the world.

In-ring interviews have included those with Big Show, Chavo Guerrero, Mark Henry, and Booker T. Some of the more recent ones had Taz, Mr.
Who invented DDT?
DDT was first developed and used as an insecticide for the prevention and control of medical and agricultural pests and was one of the first synthetic chemicals to be used for these purposes. It was developed by German chemist Paul M√ºller at the pharmaceutical company Ciba-Geigy (then known as Basilea) in 1939.

It's been shut tight and locked with a key made of denial.
You better start getting ready, you don't have much time. But don't feel bad, you're not the only one. It's a matter of time and demographics.
I have a message for the White Supremacists:
The fact that you have a very limited grasp of current events and don't know that 75% of the world's population is non-White doesn't mean that you can keep it to yourself.
If you don't want anyone to know that you have no clue when it comes to current events, then don't open your mouth.
This just about covers it.
I've lost my patience but I suppose there's more you can do.

instruction: Why can't bank use cash as capital as a buffer for potential losses?
output:
Why can't bank use cash as capital as a buffer for potential losses?"
The answer to this question is: "Because banks' customers cannot use cash as collateral for their loans if the bank uses it."
No customers or depositors will allow a bank to use its reserves; instead, they will try to take them immediately upon any danger that they might be at risk. However, depositors and investors can accept losses in the form of a write-down or loss of their loan when they deposit cash with their banks (although, a deposit with an intermediary such as a bank is often treated as a "liability" and not "cash" for them).
Thus, cash in the bank accounts of ordinary depositors serves only as a buffer for their banks that has potentially no value or use in the event of any loss by the bank.
In the event of a run on the bank, it is not the "cash" in the bank accounts of the depositors and investors that is the cause of the problem; rather, it is the belief by depositors and investors that they have deposits whose value is greater than the value of their "cash" and "liquid liabilities" (cash, short-term Treasury bills, various certificates of deposits, and interest- and principal-paying loans) in their bank accounts.
Thus, the loss of the "cash" in the bank accounts, together with a loss of the funds in "liquid liabilities" like cash, treasury bills, and interest- and principal-paying loans, should not cause the loss of the deposits of the bank even if they are the only assets of the bank.
So, are banks really holding "uninsured" cash in their vaults? No: there is no such cash that they can use but depositors cannot. Banks are the only creditors (aside from government) that can use this reserve (since it is the only reserve that is not held with the government) (although the government has also issued $4 of debt for each $1 in cash held in bank vaults).
Can bank credit expand indefinitely?
Since a bank's "money" comes from depositors and investors giving it to the bank with an ability to redeem it for cash or for other assets, the amount of deposits banked-to-deposited credit grows without any limit.
Banking credit can become as large as an amount equal to the amount of cash deposited with the banks in the United States multiplied by the number of bank depositors and loaned to them.
As long as people believe that they can redeem their deposits for cash ("liquid liabilities") at the banks, they will continue to give those banks their deposits.
Then, these deposits can be loaned to other investors and depositors to enable them to acquire a variety of other assets and to use them in business and residential activities.
This leads to the banking industry becoming so-called a "self-liquidating" system as deposits continue to be loaned over and over again while the original deposits are being redeemed.
Thus, the original deposits with banks can become many times larger than the original deposits in their bank accounts as the amount of liabilities of such banks increases exponentially.
What happens if the public no longer believes that they can redeem their deposits (liquid liabilities) at the banks?
The only thing that stops banks from being allowed to increase their liabilities indefinitely is for the public to believe that they or their family could not obtain cash or other liquid liabilities upon the demand for their bank deposits.
If this happens, then banks are required to raise cash as a kind of insurance to cover their liabilities.
This requires banks to hold more cash (and other liquid assets) in their vaults to cover their bank liabilities so that they are not risking to have all of their bank deposits lost in the event of any problem.
This is known as a "run on the bank," and the bank's risk is the possibility that it may not be able to hold its deposit liabilities (cash, treasury bills, certificates of deposit, and loans) long enough or to sufficiently increase the rate of cash lending (depositing cash) upon the demand for cash and "liquid" liabilities by depositors (since there is only so much cash and Treasury bills that a bank can hold under the FDIC).
When there is a bank "run," banks may not be able to borrow additional funds (especially from the Fed) in an amount that is close to the outstanding loan amounts that their customers are asking for their withdrawal, which means that bank runs can be fatal to the banks.
Do banks have enough "mature" loans with bank clients to enable them to meet their deposit liabilities?
No, the vast majority of banks' deposits are "mature," and they should be able to raise at least enough (based on cash and Treasury bills in their vaults) to meet their depositor customers' demands (on average)

instruction: Can you tell my a story about nuclear physics like dr Seuss?
output:
Can you tell my a story about nuclear physics like dr Seuss?
The trouble with the "grey goo" scenario in which we accidentally create intelligent nanomachines with an agenda of their own...
Yes, you can say that again.
The world is full of potential "grey goo" scenarios, but I don't think this specific example has ever actually happened. I think if it did happen, it would have been documented by now.
The real "grey goo" risks are with bio-engineering, i.e. creating life -- and you actually see all kinds of people who are convinced we should do that right now.
They've never understood that you should create a genome with some time in-between. You can't make a genome that says "here: create life", because life is too complex.
We know how to create life, if we had a lot of time and a lot of money, and we wanted to. We know how to make an entire genome, including the protein production part. So if we didn't want to do that, and wanted to have a few genes which produce life, for example, we could probably do that. And I'm not sure that's the right place to start.
If you want to create life, it's better to think of creating individual genes and putting them into an existing genome, so they can get into the appropriate cells.
When I was doing research for my book about the human genome, I went to visit a plant genetech company, and I saw a room of microscopes. In the microscope it was very obvious when the cells had been attacked by their own genome, because it would kill off every cell in the plant. It took out the whole plant. That was a "grey goo" scenario.
Now I did it intentionally: I said, let's see if we can create a genetic virus which will destroy every cell of the plant in this company.
They couldn't protect themselves: they couldn't turn off their gene production equipment, because if they did, they'd also kill every plant inside the factory.
It has a silver lining: it shows how difficult it is to create life in a single step.
We can't do it yet, so I don't think we can even begin to contemplate doing it now. But if we did have the time, money and skill-base we need to do this, it wouldn't be that difficult to do.
You must be thinking of the whole "synthetic life" thing that's now a thing...
We've seen this story about the "syn-bacteria". That was in a paper which I consider to be pure hype. The "genes" that they published were the genes that they were adding for a given purpose. It wasn't life that they were creating.
The reason why they wanted to do this was because there have been other people who have claimed to have done this. There was actually a company where they thought they had created life. That was the "J. Craig Venter Institute". The "syn-bacteria" didn't quite do it, but he's the guy who's doing all the "syn-life".
And he's doing it for the same reason that people think we should be doing it. It's not because they're being sneaky. It's because everybody knows they should be doing this.
How could he make synthetic life?
In principle you could just take all the genes that you need and make your whole organism. That's what's known as a synthetic organism.
You can have a single cell that can live for years in a test tube, and it's been done. That means you are able to make a life of any kind. If you could do it well enough and fast enough, you could take all the genes out there and write a code which contains them.
It takes you a long time to write a gene. It's not something that happens every day. But you can think of "genes" as little blocks of text. And if you have a text editor you can write a new text easily. So it's not really a problem for us if we want to write a new text, and if it takes us time to write it. If we want to write 50,000 or 80,000 new genes, it won't take us very long, because you can just write it again and again. And if you don't want to write it again, you can record it on a CD. That's all possible now.
If someone wants to do this, they have to be really careful: you have to make sure they don't write the wrong text. And that means that they should be doing it with

As the questions were being read out, Yoshitsugu and his fellow voice actors took time to answer them. I‚Äôve placed my favorite questions and most interesting answers in bold.
‚ÄúI think I‚Äôve only met him on a stage. I haven‚Äôt talked with him.‚Äù [On if he‚Äôd talk with Vay (Gandalf) from his perspective.]
‚ÄúHe‚Äôd probably‚Ä¶ probably be very polite I imagine. I‚Äôd go along with him for sure.‚Äù
On what he thinks Gandalf is like as a human‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs probably more the type that‚Ä¶ when he encounters something he likes, he‚Äôd act on it. The same with things he really doesn‚Äôt like, he probably really wouldn‚Äôt like that either. He‚Äôd probably not really like people that don‚Äôt care to follow what they like.‚Äù
When it came to The Last Hope, ‚ÄúI would be surprised for him to be able to do something like that.‚Äù [Doing what The Last Hope did, that is.]
‚ÄúI think. . . I think what a lot of people call ‚Äòevil‚Äô in this game. . . it may be a bit different. . . If we were to reimagine ‚Äòevil‚Äô in another way, that might be something. . .‚Äù
‚ÄúThere is an old piece of music that‚Äôs been passed down that goes as ‚ÄòA Tale of Berseria‚Äô that is one of the few that I know of that‚Äôs been passed down by us.‚Äù
‚ÄúThere probably won‚Äôt be such a Bersia. I‚Äôm just trying to imagine.‚Äù [That Berserkaer is not the Kingdom of Berseria but somewhere in the Kingdom of Berseria.]
‚ÄúHuh? What? The Warrior of Light?!‚Äù [When asked if he would want to play The Warrior of Light] ‚ÄúIt sounds like you may be the Warrior of Berseria‚Ä¶ so‚Ä¶ um.‚Äù [If he could be the Warrior, would he want to be played by the voice of The Last Hope?] ‚ÄúHehe.‚Äù
‚ÄúI think Berseria. . . I don‚Äôt really know the history of the previous games, but I feel like it‚Äôs because we were fighting, we were at war with The Empire that we got separated like that. I feel like it‚Äôll be important to show what the state was like when we were fighting, and I know that‚Äôs a big thing in the first series, but I think we‚Äôll be at war with The Empire. . . if you can give me something like that, we‚Äôll do our best.‚Äù [On the second series being a prequel.]
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll see too much of her as the hero. There will be a bit where she takes part in the adventure, but I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôll be like a hero.‚Äù
‚ÄúIf I talk to the game that she likes and she doesn‚Äôt necessarily love, it‚Äôll be a very strong love, right?‚Äù [On if he would say that he loves her.] ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs probably like that. Even her strong feelings of love are probably like that for someone that she finds special.‚Äù He says that

instruction:
Why is it that only proteins, carbohydrates and fats are deemed to have caloric value?
Just to clarify - consider the hypothetical situation below:
100g of 'carbohydrates' = 400kCal
100g of 'protein' = 400kCal
100g of 'fat' = 900kCal
100g of 'vitamins, minerals and/or other electrolytes' = ?
output:
Why is it that only proteins, carbohydrates and fats are deemed to have caloric value?
Just to clarify - consider the hypothetical situation below:
100g of 'carbohydrates' = 400kCal
100g of 'protein' = 400kCal
100g of 'fat' = 900kCal
100g of 'vitamins, minerals and/or other electrolytes' = ???What is it about vitamins, minerals, electrolytes, etc that makes them so totally inert, incapable of being used as energy by the body that they cannot be deemed to have calories (or at least not in any significant quantity) while carbohydrates, protein and fat are all deemed to have caloric value?Are you saying that when you eat and digest/break down 'fat' that it's 'really' only a bunch of carbohydrates, proteins and fats that are being digested and is just the resulting energy that's being accounted for due to the high amount of 'calories' in those three nutrients? That is the idea behind it. But a lot of studies are done with other methods instead of caloric intake. Do you have any references to other studies than Caloric intake to explain why it‚Äôs ‚Äúpossibly an underestimation‚Äù? Do it a lot. But don‚Äôt tell me people have no idea how to do it properly. They do. That's what I mentioned in the thread, as you know. I agree, no one is suggesting you do it wrong. But many people are still doing it wrong. If you don't believe me go try doing a caloric balance. If you believe you don't know how to do it, you absolutely don't know how to do it right. Many have the common sense to know you can't just eat more protein, even if it is high quality protein, and burn less fat. Just by doing more exercise, you're going to burn more fat regardless of how much protein you take in. Do it a lot. But don't tell me people have no idea how to do it properly. They do. I'm an exercise physiologist, so I may be biased, but I don't think many people can do a properly calculated metabolic diet for long, even with some form of calorie counting, if you aren't aware of some of the intricacies in energy expenditure. One of the things I hear frequently from people is that "I know it's like a 3000 calorie deficit and I've lost weight, but it's hard, I can't lose more weight anymore?"... because they can't do the same metabolic diet any more. The problem is that their metabolism had already adapted. They adjusted and as a result their results diminished. Now if they aren't getting exercise, if they are going higher in the same amount of calories as they did when working out previously, they will gain what they lost (or more), as they were basically doing more work than they want. And if they were doing this before, that means they were probably doing something wrong. The exercise is important, but I think that a lot of people think that exercise isn't essential and so they don't do it, and some are just not sure how to do it. So what may be necessary is a proper introduction to proper methods. Exercise is NOT the only component to success... in fact, in some cases exercise does more that not help. What is your recommended method for someone to keep weight off long term without resorting to drugs? Can you please elaborate on what you mean? How is it that proteins, carbohydrates, or fats burn fats at different rates, but 'protein' always equals 'fat' and 'carb' always equals 'fat' - even though 'protein' and 'carb' always have a different 'weight', different energy values, different types of atoms and electrons and therefore can't act the same way? What is it about vitamins, minerals, electrolytes, etc that makes them so totally inert, incapable of being used as energy by the body that they cannot be deemed to have calories (or at least not in any significant quantity) while carbohydrates, protein and fat are all deemed to have caloric value? I don't believe any of them have calories in significant quantities. Aren't you confusing the weight of something with its caloric content? I think he's saying the way calories are measured is wrong, and that they should not be measuring it as a result of an individual's metabolism, but rather their weight and the amount that was burned. I think that is the idea. The way calorie counting works is an approximation based on individual weight (as an

instruction: Navina has $30 more to her weekly budget than her younger sister and can afford to get one of the many online credit cards she likes. What do they each have to spend?
output:
Navina has $30 more to her weekly budget than her younger sister and can afford to get one of the many online credit cards she likes. What do they each have to spend? (Hint: Navina works 4 more hours per week.)
(a) Navina earns \(\$150\) per week and gets a credit card from her parents who have lent her \(\$600\). Her sister only gets \(\$100\) per week.
(b) The girls have enough money to get credit cards from their parents with a maximum balance of \(\$400\) if Navina earns \(\$130\) per week and her sister has \(\$90\).
In the real world, companies or financial institutions may allow their customers to use their credit cards to make purchases that go above a limit that has been set. For example, if a customer has a credit card where the maximum credit limit is \(\$1000\) and he/she has \(\$1000\) available, he/she can still make purchases with the credit card, but those purchases can only be made up to a point where the balance of the purchases reaches \(\$1000\).
Let \(\$x_{1}\) be the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on that reach a maximum amount of \(\$1000\), in addition to the balance (or credit) of that card. Let \(x_{2}\) be the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on that add up to a maximum amount of \(\$300\), but still results in an overspend on the credit card of \(\$1000\). Finally, let \(x_{3}\) be the amount the credit card is used to make purchases on when that amount is above \(\$800\), but the user does not overspend the credit card by the maximum amount of \(\$1000\).
\(\$x_{1}\) \(\$x_{2}\) \(\$x_{3}\)
(a) \(\$\text{Maximum Credit Limit}  \$300\)
(b) \(\$\text{Maximum Credit Limit}  \$100\)
(c) \(\$800\)
Maximum Amount \(\$1000\)
Overspend on credit card \(\$1000\)
Available Amount \(\$1000\)
(a) Using the above table, write the exact value that the amount of money, \(x\), should be in order to fulfill each of these criteria: the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on that reach a maximum amount of \(\$1000\), in addition to the balance (or credit) of that card; the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on that add up to a maximum amount of \(\$300\), but still results in an overspend on the credit card of \(\$1000\); and the amount the credit card is used to make purchases on when that amount is above \(\$800\), but the user does not overspend the credit card by the maximum amount of \(\$1000\).
(b) Using the above table, write the exact value that the amount of money, \(z\), should be in order to fulfill these criteria: the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on that adds up to a maximum of \(\$100\), in addition to the balance (or credit) of that card and the overspend on the card (but only within this amount); the amount of money the credit card is used to make purchases on when \(\$10\) more money is borrowed from the parents, but not more money than that can be spent; and when the amount exceeds \(\$100\), the family can afford to buy some new furniture that costs more than \(\$100\), but does not purchase any groceries (anything that costs less than \$\$$), clothes for their son, or a new laptop for their daughter. The credit card has a total maximum credit limit of \$\$1000.
(c) Write the exact value that the amount, \(x\), should be to fulfill these criteria: the amount that the credit card is used to make purchases on that add up to a maximum amount of \(\$800\) but the user overspends the credit card by an amount above \(\$\$1

instruction:
rank the following companies by how pro-consumer they are:
Microsoft, Google, Nintendo, Sony, EA.
output:
rank the following companies by how pro-consumer they are:
Microsoft, Google, Nintendo, Sony, EA.
* 10. Who is the best company at making consumers happy?
Microsoft is most pro-consumer. While it's clearly a profit maximizing company, it doesn't sacrifice consumer well-being to do so.
* 11. Who is the second most pro-consumer?
* 12. Who is the third most pro-consumer?
Nintendo is the second most pro-consumer. While they want to profit as much as possible, they don't sacrifice the quality of their product or violate consumer rights to do it.
* 13. Would you like to see an anti-consumer company like Google, EA, or Sony become more pro-consumer?
No, because the more pro-consumer a company is, the more of a threat it is to anti-consumer companies like Google, EA, and Sony, all of which want to maximize profits at all costs. So these companies are opposed to anti-consumer companies.
* 14. The best way to have the anti-consumer companies in question maximize profits is to maximize how pro-consumer they are (while maintaining how profitable they are).
They would rather maximize profits at the expense of consumer well-being.
* 15. Is Microsoft not an anti-consumer company?
Yes. While it aims to maximize profits, it does so while maintaining consumer well-being.
* 16. Microsoft is not an anti-consumer company because it maximizes corporate profit in a way that maintains consumer well-being.
* 17. What is there that Nintendo, Google, or Sony could do to maximize their profits while still maximizing consumer well-being?
They could maximize profits by taking action that maximizes consumer well-being.
Microsoft gets high marks on being pro-consumer because:
* 18. Microsoft is trying to ensure that we enjoy its products as much as possible,
* 19. Microsoft is willing to keep some features that other companies try to remove, even if they make money for Microsoft.
* 20. Microsoft uses only the best hardware, software, and staff in order to create the highest quality Windows, Xbox, and Office that consumers love (rather than just make Microsoft the most profitable).
* 21. Microsoft has tried to do a good job of allowing users to change the color of the Windows 7 user interface and is slowly making progress in letting users choose which default programs to run.
* 22. Microsoft has fought against corporate control over content, including DRM, and helped create the open source Mozilla Firefox web browser, instead of being an arms dealer to the corporate content holders.
* 23. Microsoft was a pioneer in making software free as a way to provide more consumer value to people.
* 24. Microsoft has helped create open source software, including helping create and promote the open-source Linux platform and open-source web browser Mozilla Firefox, instead of being an arms dealer for the corporate content holders.
* 25. Microsoft's support for the open-source Linux platform and the open-source web browser Mozilla Firefox is very strong
Nintendo gets high marks on being pro-consumer because:
* 26. Nintendo is trying to ensure that we enjoy the DS, Wii, and Nintendo 3DS as much as possible,
* 27. Nintendo is willing to keep features that other companies have removed from their games, even if these features have made Nintendo games more profitable.
* 28. The first DS and the Wii both include a great amount of hardware and software innovation.
* 29. Nintendo has introduced one of the best and most profitable online services in Gamecube.
* 30. Nintendo has helped create an open source web browser in the form of Dolphin.
Nintendo has weak points because:
* 31. Nintendo gets a very good score for this, because many of its games cost more than $60 and have less content than a $60 Microsoft Xbox game.
* 32. Nintendo has a bad track record of treating its fans badly, including refusing to let them have a Wii 2 (Wii 2 can be a trademark) with a GameCube controller so players can play their Wii games on Wii 2), refusing to support a Dolphin Wii emulator, and so on.
* 33. Nintendo has a bad track record of being pro-fan (a 0 on this scale). In fact, Nintendo has made it a policy to make it so fans can't have fun playing Nintendo games.
* 34. Wii has had weak support for the open-source Melee, a NES emulator that Nintendo has a copyright claim on.
* 3
