instruction: I‚Äôm planning to visit Okinawa Japan from April 7th to April 10th. Do you have any recommendation on what to do while I‚Äôm there?
output:
I‚Äôm planning to visit Okinawa Japan from April 7th to April 10th. Do you have any recommendation on what to do while I‚Äôm there? We know Odaiba is a must but if there are more things to see in the western side of the island we‚Äôre up for it!
Hi, how long you‚Äôre planning on staying in Okinawa? I‚Äôd start with Okinawa City. There‚Äôs a few good things I can recommend that‚Äôs not too far off the beaten path. On the beach there the Okinawa-chan Museum, the Ocean Fun Park, and Shuri and Kunimaru Castle Ruins to name a few. Inside the city, the Okinawa Peace Memorial Park, the Peace Memorial Hall, and The Okinawa Open-Air Museum are all in one place along the ocean and should draw you in. Then, head over to Okinawa City Station and take the train to Naha. There‚Äôs a lot there. My favorite are the Kokuu-ji Zen Temple, Tsuboya Paintmaking Village, and the Okinawa Prefectural Museum Art Gallery, just to name a few. Then, head back to Okinawa City via train and you‚Äôre in Okinawa City again.
In Naha, for the other side of the island, there‚Äôs Yaeyama Choshi Ferry Port, Iriomote, Taketomi, Ishigaki, Kiten, and Yonaguni. You are going to have to go to Ishigaki and then the ferry out to Yonaguni. There‚Äôs a few small places in Ishigaki but you really need to explore Yonaguni.
Yonaguni is amazing. It‚Äôs the island in the shape of a giant wave, and I guess a lot of the stuff here are rock formations that look like they‚Äôre underwater. I‚Äôve never been here but I‚Äôve heard stories of it being the place to go for photographers. Just make sure you have an itinerary for your return to Okinawa, as it‚Äôs going to get late back.
Yonaguni and Ishigaki Island are my favorite places ‚Äì though not necessarily for tourism. There really isn‚Äôt much to see at these two places ‚Äì but they‚Äôve each got their unique charms.
We‚Äôre not exactly sure why though, we have stayed at 11 and 3 star rated hotels in Naha and found them all to be very clean and spacious. I do agree that there are some that are better than others. I‚Äôm pretty sure if we can find you a hotel you can go to bed that night and if not, try to do an exchange ‚Äì even if it‚Äôs the next day if you‚Äôre not happy. The other thing you may have to think about is to book a hotel close to airport as you don‚Äôt want to waste any time getting to the hotel on your second day there ‚Äì it‚Äôs always so much quicker to be staying on the same end of the island you will be flying to and then you can really make the most out of it.
If you‚Äôre thinking about buying an island to do that, then maybe head over to these three islands.
I definitely recommend looking into Yonaguni and Ishigaki ‚Äì they take hours or a day to get to Okinawa, but I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth it especially since it‚Äôll be sunset when you arrive back at the airport ‚Äì for us.
Hey guys! I‚Äôm planning to visit kyushu (tokyo area) in may. Any advice/suggestion?
What is the best area to stay in? Thanks for the advice! I‚Äôm going solo and planning to do a train tour. I hope I get some nice weather during the time I‚Äôm there.
It‚Äôs hard to say what would be the best area. You‚Äôre in the middle of some of the most beautiful places.
But if I were you I‚Äôd try to stay near a city that‚Äôs not on the coast. It makes it a lot easier to get around on the train and see the whole area.
For someone who wants to be close to nature, you‚Äôre better off with the more mountainous areas near Hakone and Nagano. Those are a good day trip from Tokyo.
Are you a photography enthusiast? If so, stay just south of Nagano around Omachi or Matsumoto, and make sure you spend some time in Nikko ‚Äì we went last year and loved it.

instruction: define a new language that contains words that are with numbers and letters such as 'IL9op'
output:
define a new language that contains words that are with numbers and letters such as 'IL9op'
and not just with numbers (like with 123)
it contains letter and numbers all together.
How can i do this with python?
i am using Python 2.5.1

A: You could do this in a simple way like this:
string = "IL9op"
def check_string(string, n):
    string2 = string + string
    while (string2.count('IL') >=n):
        string2 = string2.replace('IL','')
        string2 = string2.replace('OP','')
        if (len(string2)==0):
            return False
        return True

If you want to be really fancy, you need a library that supports a regex and then you can code it this way:
import re
string = "IL9op"
if re.search(r'(?i:IL)+(?:op)',""+ string):
    print 'Yes it is there'
else:
    print 'Not in there'

if you are not familiar with the regex language, you can look up this site

A: You could try the following.
>>> from re import sub,compile
>>> s = compile('(?i)([A-Za-z][a-zA-z0-9]*)([ )]?)'
>>> s.sub('', 'IL9op')
'Il9o'

instruction: How to improve instance segmentation AP metrics with human knowledge
output:
How to improve instance segmentation AP metrics with human knowledge

In this post, we explain how to boost the AP (AveragePrecision) metric in instance segmentation. We'll show you how to incorporate knowledge of the type of objects present within your scene along with object-level semantics into the detection model to improve detection performance. We'll do this by adding image-level class labels to the training process. First, let's cover a brief introduction to instance segmentation, and then we'll go into specific details for training an instance segmentation model.

### The basics

Instance segmentation is the task of detecting objects and then separating out the foreground and background pixels associated with those objects. Object detection is similar, but the goal there is just to assign object category labels to regions of the image that a specific object belongs to. For instance segmentation, which is the topic of this post, a single object has more than one label: one for the whole object, and another for each pixel inside it. The first task that an instance segmentation model must do is tell, which object the detected region of interest belongs to. To achieve this, it's necessary for a model to be able to distinguish which pixels belong inside an object with a specific label and those that don't.

For these reasons, instance segmentation models use fully convolutional networks (FCNs). The second task for the model is to classify each detected region of interest into an object class. Once the model is trained on a certain dataset, the output is a heatmap for each object in the image. This is useful because it's a useful source of human knowledge. Given a certain image, for example, the model may not know that a man is a person. However, in practice people can easily understand that in the image below, the person on the right is the man.

For model training, the image- and object-level labels of the data are used alongside the ground truth segmentation maps. Image-level classes are binary and represent whether a given image contains an object or not. Each object can have many instance-level classes. Thus, a dataset may include 10 object classes and 100 instance-level classes. When training in the following section, each instance-level class corresponds to a feature map in the model, and all the object-level classes are used to label all the examples in the dataset.

In this post, we'll discuss two approaches:

  * The first one adds only object level labels to the training process
  * The second one uses object-level labels AND instance-level labels

Training with object-level only labels requires a much smaller dataset because it doesn't require as much human knowledge as the second approach. But both approaches can be used to detect novel objects that aren't in the training set. The first one is much less effective at detecting new objects in the data set because it relies on the object level labels alone. The second approach is great at detecting new objects because it uses image- and object-level labels to do so.

In this article you'll learn about the following topics:

  * Object mask prediction
  * Using bounding boxes to segment object masks
  * Adding image class and instance-level class masks to the training process

Now, let's dive into the details.

### Object mask prediction

The first thing you should know about instance segmentation models is that they are completely incapable of predicting the type of object that are in an image. For example, imagine a trained instance segmentation model is tested on an image with a person and bicycle. It would not be able to know that a bicycle is an object. The same is true when you have two different objects that look very similar. For example, an instance segmentation model wouldn't be able to tell that a bicycle is actually a trike. Because of this ability, instance segmentation models are really useful in situations where a lot of objects are very similar to one another. For example, for medical use-cases, it is important to predict the region of an image and not just the type of object in it.

This is why instance segmentation models don't rely on semantic information. Semantic information is the ability for a model to understand the meaning/category of an object-in the example below, the person class is the important one to understand. These models use a method called _mask prediction,_ wherein they create a segmentation map for each object in the image, which can be seen below.

A mask prediction map contains one contiguous 2D set of pixels per bounding box for each object. Notice that there are 100 pixels overall and 14 classes. Each of them denotes a feature map. Some example maps for different object classes are shown below:

A contiguous set of pixels

instruction: Expand on the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking
output:
Expand on the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking: Why do some of your respondents say they have had inconsistent/contradictory thinking? Why are they the ‚Äúmost‚Äù ideologically polarized? (And the rest are a little ideologically polarized, for that matter).
We see the most consistency and ideological thinking and the least in those in the conservative +20% bracket because conservatives have the most to worry about in this era of left-wing anti-family bias. In fact, those who feel that their beliefs are most ‚Äúincompatible‚Äù with those of social liberals are those who feel most threatened by the modern ideology. They are most likely to see the world as a war between ‚Äúthem‚Äù and ‚Äúus.‚Äù Those with less polarized views, those with similar views to social liberals, have fewer ideological views. Of course, the data also confirm the ‚Äúculture wars‚Äù theory of social conservatism which is quite strong.
I could go further into individual issues like abortion, marriage, gun ownership, etc. but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm adding very much.
We can see if the correlation and coherence holds even out by the group:
And the pattern holds with both the self-described conservative and self-described social liberal (or liberal-socialist in our terms) groups (see how strong the correlation is in Figure 2 of the linked report).
It is also possible to examine the influence on these individuals of their social media and media and information environments.
And we see a correlation in Figure 6 of this report that is strong on both the left and the right; that conservatives who use more media have more partisan thinking; that the same is true for social liberals.
So the issue is not primarily ‚Äúthe media‚Äù (which I believe is true because the Left is not only anti-conservative but also anti-media. They want to turn both into mouthpieces for their own political ideas). The problem is, as our poll makes clear, a strong correlation between media consumption or, as we also see, social media usage and ideological thinking, and the strong cultural and political divides in this society that exist, particularly on the conservative side. This is not an academic finding.
It is not as if we didn‚Äôt have warning of both these phenomena already. The question is only now how to act on that warning. There are some steps that can be taken:
I have discussed for years now what I believe are useful first steps, as outlined here.
It was not too long ago that many conservatives believed it was the job of conservative foundations to do better when it came to understanding and addressing the impact of media and information on the public sphere. It is likely that now that a majority of American are conservative that the conservative media landscape will undergo a similar change with the right-wing media environment. To what end is unknown. But it would be in everyone‚Äôs best interests for conservatives to work on the conservative side.
The Right‚Äôs media, information and media environment must also change to better serve conservatives. I outlined some of the specific things that could be done here. But to do this, we have got to do a ‚Äúhard reboot‚Äù of the Conservative media, information and media environment.
We, at the WPA, have published a number of reports over the years on the American Conservative Media landscape and on the state of the conservative debate in American life. Here are some:
The American Conservative movement: How to bring them back
Why the American Conservative Movement needs a rebirth, A proposal.
The Rise of the American Conservative Movement: The Reagan Era
The American Conservative Movement: 1978 through 1981
The American conservative movement in 1980, A preliminary analysis
Conservatives in the news media: A preliminary analysis, 1979
I could, but would rather not, go back and rehash these old reports. Instead, I will say that all of them are relevant today. But the American Conservative Media landscape must be reborn. The American Conservative Debate needs a rebirth.
Conservatives think for themselves. We need a new conservative media, information and media environment that will serve them. It is time to do so.
Tags: American Conservative Movement, conservatism, conservative ideology, conservative media, conservative media environment, Conservative Policy Forum, conservative theory, conservatives, Inconsistent thinking, ideological consistency, ideological polarization, ideology, left-wing bias, left-wing media, media environment, self-censorship, social conservative, WPA

instruction: Why do people give Reddit Gold to admins?
output:
Why do people give Reddit Gold to admins?)

The issue we ran into here is that if someone thinks you're lying, they're not going to just think "I'd like to vote down this answer." Instead, they're going to think "I would vote down this answer but there is no way this is real." The way we decided to deal with this is a form of "honest deception," or at least a clear attempt to avoid the worst-case scenario.
However, in the case of this thread, this seems to have been unnecessary.
For the record, the point of gold is to let people vote for questions and answers they think are good, without the need for more stringent moderation (or at the very least, a moderation process involving votes that is not visible on an individual's summary page). So while we might be glad to have you vote for questions or accept answers, the gold flagging system does not offer a way to express these particular opinions. It does not exist only for the point to express opinions as to which questions should be deleted.


So to sum this up:


*

*An answer of "This person has the reputation of a gold badge holder" is by definition false.

*Therefore it is not possible to have an answer of the form "You should use this gold badge to mark answers as fake".

*Therefore, the question is impossible to answer without being rude or dishonest.

*The question should either be deleted or edited.

Nassim Nicholas Taleb‚Äôs website
Taleb‚Äôs work
‚ÄúYou can be extremely rich but your own beliefs may cause you to be extremely poor.‚Äù
‚Äî Nassim
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt need certainty, because it is not a possibility.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs easy to think that everything you see in life is some form of cause and effect, but I think the world works in the opposite way ‚Äì everything is caused by contingency, by contingencies and not by a cause.‚Äù
‚ÄúA central bank is the most anti-fragile institution there is.‚Äù
‚ÄúUncertainty is an important element in progress and innovation. And when you eliminate, you basically disempower your people.‚Äù
‚ÄúIf you want to get ahead, you‚Äôre going to have to look around the corner.‚Äù
Nassim has co-written a book, ‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù, about uncertainty and randomness
Nassim‚Äôs work and ‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù are about how much you can learn about what we can and cannot predict about the future through our experience of the world and of history, and how we need to change the way we think about the way the world is designed or the world of finance.
Nassim‚Äôs work and ‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù are about why you can‚Äôt necessarily extrapolate from the present, because you can make a mistake in that process.
Nassim‚Äôs work and ‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù are about how we can profit from uncertainty, because that‚Äôs actually easier to do than when things are more stable and predictable.
Nassim looks at the fact that we‚Äôre not taught to look around this corner and think that there‚Äôs another round of the Black Swans, and how we can profit from that.
What is Nassim‚Äôs view of Brexit?
Nassim‚Äôs work and ‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù are about how we need to understand how the world is structured and what it‚Äôs made of ‚Äì because we don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs made of.
Nassim has a view, but it‚Äôs not as simple as the way the media portrays it.
We talked about:
‚ÄúThe Black Swan‚Äù (By Nassim Nicholas Taleb)
The Wisdom of Crowds (By James Surowiecki)
How to Make People Like You in 90 Seconds or Less in Business (By Robert Cialdini)
The Hard Thing About Hard Things (By Ben Horowitz)
The Obstacle Is The Way (By Ryan Holiday)

instruction: Tell me something I don‚Äôt know
output: Tell me something I don‚Äôt know: the name of my dog! But I‚Äôm a good man, really. I don‚Äôt know how, because I‚Äôm not rich (though God knows, I work for it), but I like to help people. I like to do small things for my friends. I help whenever they need help, you know: give them rides when they don‚Äôt have cars, invite them over for dinner, send them notes of sympathy when someone‚Äôs sick or dies, invite them to my parties, call them when they‚Äôre on vacation or out of town. I go to church; I volunteer in my kids‚Äô schools. I‚Äôm a good guy.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat was your job?‚Äù the cop asked, changing the subject. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm 55. What else can I do? I drive a school bus. It‚Äôs good money. I make a lot more than most people. And I‚Äôm not a high schooler.‚Äù He laughed at that last one. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be here till I die, probably.‚Äù He grinned and stared at me to see what reaction he would get, not just to the last comment but to the whole confession. I have no intention of getting close to this guy. ‚ÄúTell me something more. Why did you get so angry at her? You didn‚Äôt think she was making enough noise?‚Äù He shook his head, looking down. ‚ÄúI was just pissed, I guess.‚Äù He scratched the top of his arm. I watched him carefully, thinking about what to do next. My gut said that although this guy was lying to me, he wasn‚Äôt lying because he wanted to lie. He was lying in order to protect someone or to protect himself. That‚Äôs my gut. ‚ÄúWho would you be protecting?‚Äù I asked, watching the kid‚Äôs face, waiting for the lie to show up. Nothing. His face remained perfectly neutral. Then we had a pause, where he did not speak. Again, I don‚Äôt know if he was holding back a response or if he was thinking, but I had an idea. ‚ÄúWho do you think killed her?‚Äù I asked. He looked surprised, a second‚Äôs hesitation. Then he responded, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy do you think someone killed her?‚Äù Now he frowned, looking away, as if he thought he would be betraying a confidence to answer that question. I said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not saying it‚Äôs the same person who killed her. I‚Äôm asking about the circumstances of her death. How could someone kill her for all that money?‚Äù ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know, man.‚Äù ‚ÄúThink about it for a second.‚Äù His expression told me that he really didn‚Äôt want to. I let him take his time. I put the bottle on his desk. I sat still, not saying anything. He looked like he could wait forever, so I waited too. He sat still, looking down. He was holding a pen inside his left hand, in the middle of his fingers, just above where his thumb would be. His elbows and wrists were on the desk. ‚ÄúOkay,‚Äù he said after about four minutes, with a little annoyance. ‚ÄúWho would kill her over her money?‚Äù ‚ÄúMaybe they were people who owed her money?‚Äù I asked. ‚ÄúAnd they thought that she was going to pay them and they couldn‚Äôt afford to wait.‚Äù ‚ÄúMaybe.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt push. The cop had opened a can of worms and was now trying to deal with someone he knew. That didn‚Äôt mean he trusted him, but he was trying. I was trying at the same time. ‚ÄúDoes your friend tell you things?‚Äù ‚ÄúWho?‚Äù ‚ÄúThe guy who was the last one to see the lady alive.‚Äù The cop sighed. ‚ÄúOkay. One thing I know for sure. She didn‚Äôt have one single friend she confided in. Nobody.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs sad, isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù ‚ÄúOf course it‚Äôs sad. But what are you saying?‚Äù ‚ÄúHe lied to me just now. I know that‚Äôs not true. If she were a lonely person, he‚Äôd know that.‚Äù ‚ÄúHe said he was the last person to see her.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat he is, but he‚Äôs not the one who killed her.‚Äù He looked down the hall past my shoulder. ‚ÄúI might get in trouble if I talk about this.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù He sighed, shrugging. He seemed to be giving up already. He said, ‚ÄúMaybe I‚Äôm a pawn in something, maybe that‚Äôs true.‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been working for the woman for two months. I helped her move some furniture. She wasn‚Äôt happy. Then she paid

antennas that transmit an equal amount of energy in the horizontal direction are called quasi-omni antennas. An omni antenna (omnidirectional) is one of the most versatile antennas because it can receive signals from any direction. However, because it transmits equally in all directions, they are not particularly efficient and may require more than two antennas to transmit and receive a signal.

Antennas are also made of different metals that are used for conducting a specific frequency. For example, antennas are often made of aluminum and copper, depending on the frequency of the signal that is being transmitted, the two metals have different conductivity qualities. A metal such as aluminum conducts an electrical signal better than another than copper, for example. Aluminum conducts electromagnetic signals better than copper due to its metal structure and its smaller surface area per unit volume. Copper conducts less heat than aluminum, but more electromagnetic energy. Aluminum was used because its surface area is larger than copper, which means that it transmits more electromagnetic energy in the same frequency.

The second type of antenna is the half-wave dipole. This type of antenna is used for sending and receiving very high frequencies, but it cannot send or receive signals that are very strong, because its conductivity is not comparable to the conductivity of aluminum or copper. Most radio and television antenna used for television and radio transmission are half-wave dipole antenna. The second reason why you might use a half-wave dipole antenna is the ease of construction of this antenna.

Half-wave dipole antennas are used in many different types of applications. Most cars, boats, and airplanes are equipped with a half-wave dipole antenna, as it is easy to understand that there is a need for an antenna while one is traveling through the air or driving around in a vehicle. As you can see, it is important to have a half-wave dipole antenna because that antenna can be placed in a particular place and can still work with a specific frequency since it operates on radio waves. For example, if you wish to broadcast a signal to another person, you should use a half-wave dipole antenna to send or receive a signal from another device. These antennas do not require a large space in either of the two devices, and can be attached to any device.

A third type of antenna is the quarter-wave dipole antenna. The purpose of this antenna is for transmitting high electromagnetic energy. Because this type of antenna is used for transmitting and receiving a high-frequency electromagnetic signal, it can work with a large number of devices. Quarter-wave dipole antennas can be found in most consumer electronic products. You can find a half-wave dipole antenna in your television, radio, computer, phone, and mobile devices.

An antenna can be made of different materials that emit electromagnetic signals. For example, quarter-wave dipole antennas can be made of metal or plastic. Although plastic antennas are less durable than metal antennas, it is still important to make sure that the plastic antenna is made of a certain type of plastic. For example, if you are using plastic antennas, it is important to see if the antenna is made of a high-density plastic to make sure that your device is not damaged when the signal is transmitted or received.

A fourth type of an antenna is a Yagi-Uda antenna. This antenna is known for its ability to capture electromagnetic signals from a longer distance than other kinds of antennas. It is important to note that Yagi-Uda antennas are not compatible with all devices that use different frequencies because it is designed only to transmit signals in a very specific frequency. It is important when shopping for an antenna to make sure that the specific type of device that the Yagi-Uda antenna is compatible with. A Yagi-Uda antenna is most commonly used when you are trying to receive signals from a device that is not your own. Because of this, you should always purchase a product from the manufacturer. For example, if you are trying to receive signals from another person's phone, you can purchase a Yagi-Uda antenna from the manufacturer of that phone.

In the modern world, there are many kinds of antenna that are used for different sorts of purposes. For example, there are antennas that can be used for making emergency calls, antennas that are designed to work with specific frequencies, and antennas that can be used to connect two devices. With these antennas, if one device is damaged while its other device is not, the antenna should be used to connect the two devices.

So, I am reading this story for children that makes me feel sad for the country: ‚ÄúIf we ever run out of oil, maybe we should let a man like you get it.‚Äù [i‚Äôm not getting into this on an oil discussion, just noting his comment.] ‚ÄúIs that what it‚Äôs like in your country?‚Äù ‚ÄúYou may see it. We don‚Äôt let you come here except as immigrants.‚Äù [The man‚Äôs daughter is on the receiving end of an insult.] And then he asks his daughter a question about the man. She gets a lesson about the right path to travel from ‚ÄúMr.‚Äù and then she tells her parents what she has learned. You can google the story, or even read it here. When I read the story, I found it compelling, but also painful, and sad for the country I love:
We were raised in an America with a belief system that many of us still find hard to believe. When two strangers met, they gave each other a hello handshake and a bit more. Black or white, they lived the same story. They told their children that they had the same right to speak, study, work and play as all the other children. When we went to church, we sang the same hymns in the same songs.
The message was a very clear one: You do not belong to your religion, you do not belong to your country, you do not belong to your race, and you are not confined to your gender when you say that you hold fast to the belief that ‚Äúall men were created equal.‚Äù
One of the stories I have heard here involves ‚Äúthe black minister‚Äù visiting a white congregation and having his voice amplified through a microphone. The effect was not good on his voice and he was, in a sense, made to sound foolish.
A pastor whose experience resembled it also offered, ‚ÄúI was invited into the pulpit of a church that didn‚Äôt much care for me. They sent me to the back of the church. And they amplified my voice ‚Äì so they could hear, that way.‚Äù
The story is in an article by Richard Cohen in the Washington Post:
[T]he Civil Rights leaders were not simply men and women who had risen up to be citizens but were also people who had become more than that. They were leaders who had been educated, who had been given the tools to lead not just an entire race but an entire nation. And as Richard Rorty, who taught philosophy at the University of Virginia, told us in Race and Love, ‚Äúthe world will either be one civilization or several. The choice is ours.‚Äù That is a quote made earlier in this essay: ‚ÄúThat is a quote made earlier in this essay:‚Äù a reference to Rorty‚Äôs observation that some things could not be explained because they were too complex or too small to perceive in a way that made sense.
He was writing about love, but at the time, he was writing about segregation and the Civil Rights era. And he was reminding us of the choice before us then and now: Is the world one civilization or several?
There is nothing small or complex or too small to perceive about that question.
You can read the whole article here.
But at last you had come, in spite of your fear of flying. For you knew, he knew, that what came of your love was more important than all the flying in the world.
‚ÄúYou need to be brave. You need to be strong. You can save this man if you are brave and strong,‚Äù he says. One day she just came to the door with a sack of potatoes and began to cook. So I said, ‚ÄòOh Mama, what did you do that for?‚Äù [He asked the daughter, ‚ÄòWhy did you do that?‚Äô The daughter said, ‚ÄúIt seemed like the right thing to do.‚Äù]
It is a message of hope. And of bravery and love:
It must have been a very moving experience that was for all of them, especially him but them as well.‚Äù [‚ÄúEspecially him‚Äù is John Lewis, but it is evident that ‚Äúus‚Äù is also John Lewis and his wife, and is very much a part of the story.]
So I thank you, President Obama, for reminding us that we do not have to take anything but what we see for the truth of these times, and that the truth of these times is that there are people of all colors and all nationalities that want these times to be better. I know that we are not always right in what we say or do, but we are people with very good intentions and good hearts from all sides. And I thank you for that and may God Bless you for it. And for the courage and the hope that you have given to all

instruction: twenty names of famous horses and who they belonged to
output:
twenty names of famous horses and who they belonged to.
Then read aloud all of the following names (and try to remember what each means.)
Giant, the steed of William T. Sherman, the Union Army leader throughout the Civil War.
Misty, the thoroughbred stallion owned by Henry Ford. Misty gave Henry a reputation as a successful horseman.
Molly Pitcher, who helped fight in the American Revolution. Molly used her husband's gun to help kill a British soldier with her own hands.
Blue, who was the horse of the President's horse-white horse- who had the job of escorting the British soldiers after the war was won at Yorktown.
Caliente, the racehorse. He had a long streak of bad luck winning a race.
The great racehorse, Man o' War. He won all of his races handily. His great race was the match race against Sir Barton in the 1919 Preakness Stakes.
Arrogance, the horse that had a bad career as a racehorse. He did not show much speed and was an ugly horse. Arrogance had been a terrible racehorse but a nice sire and had lots of sons who became great racehorses.
The War Horse-the horse that rode for George Washington in the Revolutionary war. The War Horse is said to have started the American horse.
The first great thoroughbred racehorse, Eclipse. He was called the "Thoroughbred king" in his day. He won all seventeen races he ever ran.
Gimlet, a horse who lived on the farm of Samuel Clemens (Mark Twain). Twain always felt he knew more than Gimlet when it came to knowing about animals.

The Flying Dutchman, that famous racehorse who kept winning even when the track crew took two miles of his track away. He kept winning even being hampered by the track crew.
A horse called "the Iron Horse" whose long bones proved to be stronger than the steel ones used today.
Rex-that famous horse that ran the 110 meter hurdle-the first horse so-called "turf animal."
A horse that started the Kentucky Derby, the great race horse of the 19th century and the first to run in the Derby.
The great racehorse who was not supposed to win the Derby. It was said that, "He'll never make it over those fences."
Citation, the great racehorse who in 1948 became the first horse to be named Horse of the Year.
Flamingo, the first thoroughbred that had a sire that was not a thoroughbred. The father of Flamingo was the American Hack Racehorse, The Flying Dutchman.
The horse that helped bring the U.S. to the first race that was held in England. The race called the "Newmarket Stakes" was the biggest race held in 1894.
The racehorse who, in 1973, took up a post on a railroad as the symbol of the American railroad workers.
The horse who pulled the first American submarine.
The first horse that drew its owner's name during a lottery. For those that couldn't read, the horse's owner spelled out his last name.
The horse that helped discover gold in San Francisco.
Tote, the horse who brought in the first U.S. telephone. He also was on the first American postcard service.
The great French racehorse who was later put up for adoption as a circus animal.

A horse who was a famous war horse for the British. He brought home the first Canadian flags to be paraded in England.
A black horse named after a French war. The horse was a famous war horse for France.
A horse that won the first gold medal in the early equestrian Olympics.
A horse which helped start the California Gold Rush.
The first horse to be sold for a huge sum of money.

No one rode in a chariot or a carriage.

instruction: In this math problem, we are asked to figure out the percentage of total profits that are made in each quarter. They are 90% in the first quarter, 92% in the second quarter, 81% in the third quarter and 88% in the fourth quarter. What is the total profit percent over a period of time, based upon these quarters?
100% x 14/25 = 56%, so 67.14% of the profits are made in each quarter. The solution represents all three quarters that have been given and only half of the profits.

P = S/L+S/L = 0.05

P1=1/5X, P2=2/5X, P3=1/2X.

Tuesday. 1/3 - 2/3 = 1/6. The solution will be at 2/3.

It takes 20 minutes for the first machine to work, 30 minutes for the second, and 25 minutes for the third. In order to get the line to reach this production goal within one hour, what is the average number of units that each of the machines must make?

A company is given 250 units of work each week. The average speed that this company completes this work is 2 per day. Within what days will they complete one-half of their work?
7 days. 1/2 - (1/20) = 0.75. After the seventh day, one-half of the works has been done.

With its current assembly line equipment, the company has the capacity to produce: 230 per hour, 60 per hour, and 200 per hour. With this current situation, how many hours must the assembly line work to reach their goals?

Their hard drive space has a value of 512, 1024, and 2048. Each of these three machines can run five different applications. What is their total memory space in mb when one application is running on each of the three machines?
1 GB = 1,024 Mb . 5 x 1 GB = 5 GB. The solution is 5 GB.

instruction: which second messenger molecule acts on the endoplasmic reticulum to release calcium ions
output:
which second messenger molecule acts on the endoplasmic reticulum to release calcium ions [@b0015]. As calcium is important in neurotransmitter release, increased levels of it could lead to overstimulated release of neurotransmitters by the neurons, eventually causing them to die [@b0015]. The high levels of cholesterol in the brain may also increase the chances of a stroke if it is disrupted with no blood supply to the vital areas of the brain [@b0070].
A high cholesterol level is also thought to be associated with an increase in the blood pressure [@b0015]. The high level of cholesterol in HDL and LDL is thought to be an indication of the dysfunction of the endothelium due to an overuse of the receptors on the surface of the endothelial cells [@b0060]. Endothelial cells are the cells lining the inside of blood vessels that maintain the integrity of the blood vessels. When these receptors are overused, the endothelial cells begin to deteriorate [@b0060]. With an increasing number of injured and dead endothelial cells, the blood vessels constrict, causing the blood pressure to rise [@b0015]. This can cause a heart attack.
5. Conclusion {#s0035}
=============
Cholesterol is very important for the structure and function of the human body but there is an increase in the amount of cholesterol in the body that is considered unhealthy in a very large portion of the human population. There has been an increase in the levels of cholesterol as well as a decrease in LDL and HDL causing many concerns for the health of the human body. However, high levels of cholesterol in the human body have been associated with several disease processes, including cancer and metabolic syndrome. These diseases are thought to have an association with cholesterol and may require future research on the association between the level of cholesterol and various disease processes.
Humana Press Inc.

instruction: How can anti-deressants make people think or act suicidally? Suicidal thoughts or actions' are a side effect of every single anti-depressant I've seen. Is the medicine controlling your mind or something?
output:
How can anti-deressants make people think or act suicidally? Suicidal thoughts or actions' are a side effect of every single anti-depressant I've seen. Is the medicine controlling your mind or something? I think, but I'm no scientist. You don't want me doing a study either. I wouldn't have a clue how to start one, or what kind of methodology would be involved. I am, by the by, a poet. I write words and put them in order, and if people read them they like them. The scientific method is not really my medium.
BUT I believe every word I've written about this. It's not the case of "one of my relatives tried this and then she did that, I believe it happened," then I must believe it. It's not some story out of my imagination. It's based on all the information that's been made available by various government and professional reports, interviews, newspaper stories, and more. My family doesn't have experience with other antidepressants, but this one is different. And it's obvious why it's different.
It's different because if you can poison the soil, you can poison the fish, and if you can poison the fish, you can poison the fish eater that eats the fish, and if you can poison that person, you can poison the antidepressant's target, the person who feels the depression they want to treat.
Now we're at the stage where we are able to prove it not only to the families who have seen it with their own eyes and tried to deal with it privately, but to the government, and to scientists. And if you believe the government does not have an agenda of its own to pursue otherworldly and unearthly means of destroying the planet and humanity's future on it, then maybe you ought to read how we got to where we are today. We lost our planet, remember? Some people do remember.
We just passed that 500,000 mark. Thanks for joining me in my thoughts for the last few minutes. I hope you enjoyed them, and I know I took a little bit of time out of your busy day.
I don't feel as if I have a right to do this to anyone. And I'm afraid that if I don't do it, it's no one's fault but my own. And if I do do it, I have one good reason, maybe two: because I am responsible for my own actions and because, as a poet, I care about words and I care about their effect on people, on humanity, and on its future.
I just hope, by giving voice to this warning, that I can help people understand that this is no joke. It seems to me that when people say "It's no big deal" or "It's such a little thing," they don't realize what they're saying, they don't realize what they're not taking seriously. To people who are living it firsthand, it's not a joke, and it's not a little thing. It's something that affects the whole of life on this planet. And, even through our bodies' and minds' resistance to this form of poisoning, it's taking over and changing us.
If you've listened to this far, I would like to hear from you. How has this affected you?

instruction: Draft a ministerial speech outlining the top five benefits that innovation brings to the Australian economy
output:
Draft a ministerial speech outlining the top five benefits that innovation brings to the Australian economy. Use as many relevant examples as you can.
It should begin with a key message about the economic and national security benefits of innovation and end in a key call to action.
The answer should be presented as a single document with a well-structured introduction and ending. You are only required to present what are called the Main Points. That is the structure, the layout, the font, the format and the typography are all up to you. Just remember to maintain the page length.
In some jurisdictions the answer can be up to 15 pages long. You don‚Äôt have to worry about that in Australia. You have 4 pages to play with. In your preparation, don‚Äôt worry about making it look lovely, just make sure it‚Äôs all there.
What are the key messages?
You would expect the answer to have six to eight key messages.
So which topics to choose?
The first is the economic impact and the second is the national/security security impact.
The best place to start is with the recent Innovation and Science Australia review. The Government has committed to the recommendations in this report.
So, you could start by talking about the fact that the review was commissioned because of the need for ‚Äúrapid and fundamental change‚Äù, ‚Äúsustained structural change‚Äù or because we need ‚Äúto seize the opportunities emerging from new technologies‚Äù.
We need to talk about the economy and how innovation can help lift it? You could talk about creating 5,000 new export companies over the next 10 years, as the Prime Minister‚Äôs office has announced.
You need to be able to include things like the fact that the average age of your audience is 31, with only 20% aged over 50 or 60. You need to have facts and figures from the review in your briefing to the Minister, to ensure you cover this important demographic.
You need to know that two of the six points of the ISA‚Äôs Innovation Strategy are on ‚Äúinnovation support for the workforce and ‚Äúthe innovation pipeline‚Äù.
You need to know that one of the eight points of ISA‚Äôs strategy is to deliver ‚Äúincreased funding and support for education‚Äù.
So you could also talk about the fact that 8 million Australians do not have a degree. Most of them would like to work with STEM.
The other thing to remember is that although we all have cellphones, that doesn‚Äôt make us all digital natives. Just 28% of Australians have internet access at home or work. Even just the 12% who have ‚Äúfast broadband‚Äù access at home would like to work with STEM.
We can‚Äôt talk about innovation without mention of the future of work.
The government wants to ‚Äúensure Australia‚Äôs labour force is prepared for the future‚Äù.
In this case, they want to see job shifts to more innovative and creative sectors, such as science and technology, research and design, education, and the arts and media.
You should know, Australia has the sixth most female-dominated workforce in the world, with 49.9% of women participating in the workforce. You could also know that only 18% of tech positions in 2017 were filled by women.
So while you might want to talk about how much we value diversity, this will mean that you will have to make sure you cover the under-representation of both men and women.
You also need to talk about how the ‚Äúglobal economic slowdown, rising real wages, and the low Australian dollar‚Äù has contributed to job loses in other sectors, so it‚Äôs important to ‚Äúmove away from an over-dependency on sectors such as mining, manufacturing and agriculture‚Äù and develop more emerging growth sectors.
If we can‚Äôt do it here, who can?
Of course, you need to know the impact of innovation in other countries and to talk about their successes.
You should know that the USA is ahead of us in many sectors that could be enhanced by innovation. Our competitor countries also seem to be more supportive and have larger research, development and innovation budgets than we do.
It is great that in the Australian Government we have a leader who values innovation and wants new ways to grow our economy.
It is also good that they want technology to be a part of creating a fairer Australia, to help people with disabilities and in remote areas, to create smarter cities and smarter ways of doing things, and to ensure we are one of the most innovative countries in the world.

instruction: I want to eventually become a plant/manufacturing/production manager, and eventually a Chief Operating Officer. What sort of experience and post-graduate education path would you recommend? Please provide non-obvious and atypical career paths leading to such positions, on top of the classic ones.
output:
I want to eventually become a plant/manufacturing/production manager, and eventually a Chief Operating Officer. What sort of experience and post-graduate education path would you recommend? Please provide non-obvious and atypical career paths leading to such positions, on top of the classic ones.
How about someone with an engineering degree that started off in operations in a plant and then became a leader in plant management, manufacturing improvement and then became a director in a manufacturing organization over many years before becoming a VP business unit leader? Did you have a particular role in mind when you asked this question? I‚Äôm not able to generalize a good answer without more specifics.
Hi David. What was your position when you worked in the manufacturing plant and what education did you have?
Hi Mike, I haven‚Äôt figured much out, yet. I‚Äôm about to graduate from college, but am not sure what I want to pursue. I do know I love math and data analysis and may want to do that in an operational capacity. I have a strong background in business classes with no experience in manufacturing. This is the reason I looked for answers. Thank you so much for your help.
What do you enjoy doing? Most people in this situation try to take advantage of their academic strengths. They‚Äôll seek out the most advanced degree they can get, and then they‚Äôll try to find a job where they can use the skills and knowledge they‚Äôve developed. But the reality is that most companies aren‚Äôt looking for that type of person. They just want a worker who is willing to do what they tell them to do, even if it‚Äôs very repetitive. Most will want someone with good time management, good communication skills and the willingness to learn the details of whatever they‚Äôre doing. Of course, there is no shortage of advice about getting a career in the world of data. It‚Äôs one of the hottest jobs. And lots of people have gone back to college to get a degree in data analysis. But there‚Äôs no guarantee that getting that degree is going to help. If you need more advice on career possibilities, you should talk to some people you work with. Talk to them about what they work on and ask them what they most enjoy. Maybe they‚Äôll give you some ideas. My advice: try to get an internship or an entry level job in whatever you decide to go after, and then work as hard as you can to get promoted.
If you want to work in that area, then you‚Äôll need to learn programming and a little statistics. You‚Äôll need those skills in some jobs, and even in other jobs, you may discover that you‚Äôre doing some programming or statistical analysis just to support what you‚Äôre doing. And it never hurts to learn some more general skills, like how to work in teams and how to develop and manage a project.
Thank you for your reply. I am not aware of my skills and what I like/dislike doing since I just starting a job where I am using mostly accounting. What do I need to do in order to get that job? Are my skill sets irrelevant or something I need to supplement?
There are lots of ways to get started. I was in exactly the same boat 20 years ago. I majored in history and had no idea what I wanted to do when I decided to go back to school after I graduated. I didn‚Äôt have any experience in accounting so I decided to study accounting, and I went back to school for another 2 years so I could get my CPA license. When I graduated, I figured I‚Äôd get a job where I could start to make some money. But I didn‚Äôt want to get a job that was just a way to earn a living. I wanted to do something that I enjoyed. I had no idea what that was, though. But I also figured that I‚Äôd get some experience and that would help me figure out what I wanted to do. So I got my first job offer from one of my professors. He was looking for somebody to take care of some accounting stuff for his student business. I told him I was willing to work for him, but I needed money for rent. He took me out to lunch, discussed some of the stuff he was doing and also told me to go on a couple of interviews from his list of companies. They had openings that week, and I took them all. I got 4 offers from 4 different companies and in each one they wanted to pay me the same. And I thought, ‚ÄúWhoa, that‚Äôs a lot of money.‚Äù So I took the job and I‚Äôve been doing this for 20 years now. I started out working in a very small accounting practice and there really wasn‚Äôt much for me to do. But I was learning a lot. I learned how to be good at what I do now and by the time I was in college, I was good at it.

instruction: Write a story about Anakin Skywalker encountering a Jedi who speaks and acts like a 1920s British aristocrat
output:
Write a story about Anakin Skywalker encountering a Jedi who speaks and acts like a 1920s British aristocrat
An example would be this. It was, at best, a rough description of Anakin‚Äôs thoughts at the time. I also used all my favorite words and tried to use as few common ones as I could.
Anakin Skywalker stood on the banks of a river, a light breeze blowing through his hair. The air was fresh and crisp, and his face felt tight from days of uninterrupted sleep. He took in a long deep sniff, reveling in the sweet scent of the rain-soaked earth and dew-sodden grass.
He glanced around at the surrounding fields. They were nearly bare because of the weather. All that stood between Anakin‚Äôs feet and an endless wall of brown mud was a single, narrow path to the west. He was at home. The farm from which he had run away six months ago.
And there on the farm-house‚Äôs veranda, was the only person he had ever trusted to run away from it. Amidala. Her hair gleamed gold in the bright sunlight, and she smiled shyly as she raised her hands in greeting.
‚ÄúDarth Anakin!‚Äù she exclaimed, bounding down the veranda‚Äôs steps and walking toward him as quickly as her corseted legs allowed. ‚ÄúI heard your name called out as clear as day. I just wondered if it was you. I have been hoping you‚Äôd come at last.‚Äù
Anakin smiled back as he took her hands in his and shook them firmly. He then turned his head to look back at the farm in the distance.
‚ÄúYou came home, my dear?‚Äù he said, with a soft and wistful expression.
‚ÄúI missed the smell of my family‚Äôs cooking,‚Äù she said, squeezing his hands tighter, and looking up at him with a playful glint in her eyes. ‚ÄúAnd I had gotten so bored running down this dark old castle, it made me feel so claustrophobic, I couldn‚Äôt wait to get out. I realized I should have come home with you sooner.‚Äù
‚ÄúThen why wait so long?‚Äù Anakin replied warmly, returning her smile with one of his own as he looked at her with wonder.
‚ÄúI ‚Ä¶‚Äù she paused, a hint of hesitation taking control of her voice. ‚ÄúYou were busy,‚Äù she finally continued. Her demeanor then changed as she put her hands on her hips and scowled at him playfully. ‚ÄúBut tell me, why haven‚Äôt you brought me dinner?‚Äù
Anakin frowned, as if puzzled he hadn‚Äôt. ‚ÄúI did. It‚Äôs cold out, remember?‚Äù he said, pulling his hands away from her and turning in to the house to find a warm pot. As he walked, he began to wonder about his friend‚Äôs sudden burst of affection.
It was true they had been good friends, but this was more than that. She was behaving with a certain familiarity- something to be expected between two lovers rather than two close friends. Anakin had always viewed her with affection, but a friendship, a place for the two of them was enough. She had never given him more.
As he walked on, Anakin‚Äôs frown only deepened as his thoughts grew dark. While he was happy to see Amidala again, he found it difficult to shake the feeling of unease she had given him. He had never fully stopped thinking about her since the day he had helped her escape a fire. She had begged for help, and he had been glad to give it. Yet, it was never the same after that.
She had been a constant reminder to him ever since of what he did not have. What he had given up. He could still see Obi-Wan and Yoda glaring at him across the room, and though he had long since moved on from whatever it was they had done to him the day of the fire, it never felt enough.
This was not what he wanted. At all.
‚ÄúHey,‚Äù Amidala interrupted to his dark thoughts. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt look at me like you just remembered what you did to me and didn‚Äôt take into account how my feelings would be. Did you actually forget? Or you just got tired of me crying on your shoulder? Or maybe you don‚Äôt want to acknowledge my feelings after betraying us in front of your Master.‚Äù
Anakin paused, his head slowly turning toward her. He stared at her with an expression of shocked surprise, almost as if he couldn‚Äôt believe the same voice he remembered hearing so many times was calling him out to her.
His face began to redden and his eyes glinted angrily behind his golden, droopy eyelids. Then with

instruction: cost of fuel for a 14 mile journey in a car with 48mpg, fuel costs 625 pence per gallon and there is heavy traffic for half the journey
output:
cost of fuel for a 14 mile journey in a car with 48mpg, fuel costs 625 pence per gallon and there is heavy traffic for half the journey time. This results in an equivalent travel cost of approx ¬£0.80 per mile, as shown in the figure below.
The figure below shows the number of journeys made by different groups of respondents over the last four weeks. If we were to use the method seen above, and calculate the equivalent cost per mile, then based on the data it can be said that the highest paid workers, earning between ¬£12,000 and ¬£15,000 per annum, spend the most money in fuel on travel.
Based on these findings, you may think that high earners drive a lot more than people who are paid a small amount, but in fact this is not necessarily the case. The next graph shows the weekly distance for cars and the results are very different to the original figures reported above.
Car mileage in the last four weeks
Interestingly the graph shows that the highest earners actually drive the least car mileage when you consider the fact that they travel the most in total.
Car miles per day based on hourly cost of petrol
The graph shown below takes into account the time and money spent travelling on a daily basis to work. The x axis shows a full days travel in miles i.e. 16.
The first thing you may notice about this graph is the relatively similar time spent travelling in all the groups. The second thing you will notice is that the high earners have the lowest travel costs, with less than the average cost. However, the high earners travel less than the other groups, who travel over twice as much as them.
Using this information, if you are a high earner and you find yourself in a car, where the cost of an hour driving is equal to or below the cost of an hour sitting on the bus, then it would be sensible to stick to the bus to save money. This way you will also be doing your bit to help the environment as buses emit around half the pollutants as cars per unit time.

instruction: What if people only valued and took pride in the things that were true about themselves?
output:
What if people only valued and took pride in the things that were true about themselves?
What if we all felt the most beautiful we had ever felt, knowing that all of us are as equally valued and loved.
What if we all became fearless, free and self-loving enough to stop trying to find ourselves, and just BE ourselves?
What if we became brave enough to start claiming, accepting, and valuing the things that we believe make us our true selves?
What if people only valued the things they have that are important to them and only kept the things they truly love in their lives?
What if each of us found what the world was made for each of us and started living the life that was created exactly for us?
What if we all took care of and nurtured ourselves like we would a child?
What if we decided not to take anyone and anything too seriously anymore?
What if we started believing that everything starts and ends in love, and all of our most important decisions start with love?
What if we understood that as each of us is in the best shape and the best place for each of us to be in in that moment, that we are really the first one needing to be loved?
What if we started to see ourselves as already amazing?
What if we loved others as we love ourselves?
What if we all found our own personal meaning in life?
What if people felt so safe that they would only take on things and make commitments where they knew they had permission to be lazy, slow, sloppy, and to goof off occasionally and not care about the exact outcome?

instruction: Explain me the Finite Elemente Method
output:
Explain me the Finite Elemente Method in a little bit detail in respect to finite elements.
I am a little bit new to this.
Can anybody give me some references for it?

A: There are two classes of element. 
a)The finite element element class. The boundary of those elements is called the nodal set.
b)The element class (the finite element being just a special case). Elements can be triangles, tetrahedra, hexahedra or whatever. There is no nodal set.
In the reference book "Finite Volume Methods and Applications" by F.P. Brebbia&G.J. Dyer one can see, how the method is explained.

A: You might start with the textbook "Finite Elements for the solution of partial differential equations" by Brebbia, Dyer, and Levecq, published by the A.R. Press company. 
To get started, you definitely don't need an in-depth mathematical knowledge, but you should be familiar with differential geometry, and know a little something about multivariate calculus. 

A: I think that you are getting confused when you start looking at finite volume methodology. The finite volume method (FVM) is used in problems where conservation laws are satisfied (e.g. flows) and the discrete method is the EDP method (finite difference). You can get lots of information in the Numerical Recipes book, a standard for anyone in applied mathematics doing work in numerical computations. Chapter 6 on "Computational integration and differentiation" should give you a good overview of Finite Difference. As to your question about the FE method you are using the EDP method to discretize and then you can solve the problem by making the discrete problem into a finite volume problem and you are using the method of lines. If you still want to consider more you can read a technical reference that will help in understanding. Here are some papers that I recommend.
An Introduction to the Finite Volume Method with a Variable Coefficient Advective
Scheme in an Elliptic Equation
The finite element method for convection-diffusion problems
The Finite Element Method for the Poisson Equation

instruction: Introduce the ‚Äùfinancial markets and institutions‚Äú by Frederic S. Mishkin
output:
Introduce the ‚Äùfinancial markets and institutions‚Äú by Frederic S. Mishkin that you learnt about reading the book.
2. What are the main features of each of these classes of firms
1. A typical firm offers goods and services that vary in quality, and faces competition from firms in the same industry.
2. A typical financial firm is usually very large, and provides its customers with a limited range of financial services. Typical examples are banks, broker-dealers, insurance companies, investment banks, mutual funds, and rating agencies.
a) Banking
1) Banking is the process of accepting deposits and making loans.
2) The deposit-lending process is typically arranged through the use of bank accounts. Bank accounts are like a bookkeeping ledger. The bank provides a record book that keeps track of the bank‚Äôs holdings plus other information, such as amounts of deposits made and loans extended. The customers have their own deposit and loan accounts.
3) Financial intermediation can be described as the process by which a bank converts monetary and other assets into financial services.
b) Broker-Dealers
1) Broker-dealers are financial services firms that typically specialize in making securities transactions for their customers.
2) These securities include stocks, bonds, exchange traded funds, and futures.
3) Brokerage firms do not offer investment advice to their clients. Instead, they earn a fee for making securities transactions for customers.
c) Insurance Companies
1) Insurance (or insurance and annuities) is the process of making economic transfers between people. The primary purpose of insurance is to protect firms or people from losses stemming from uncertain events.
2) Insurance companies may be either mutuals or for-profit.
d) Investment Banks
1) Investment banking activities include underwriting: they help firms go public, and help firms buy back stock or offer debt securities in the financial markets.
2) They also advise firms on mergers and acquisitions, and on their financing.
e) Mutual Funds
1) Mutual funds are groups of investors who pool their funds together to invest in various assets.
.2. Mutual funds make money by charging fees and receiving transaction revenues.
f) Rating agencies
1) Ratings agencies are private companies that classify the financial obligations of companies according to their relative probability of default. Default is the ability of a company to pay its creditors.
2) When a company is default-rated AAA, investors can expect that the company will meet its obligations. Similarly, ratings of AA, A, BBB, BB, and B are grades that indicate the relative probability of default.
3) Companies pay the rating agencies a fee for their services.
3. Define a financial crisis and its symptoms
1. Financial crises occur when a financial system is so disrupted that the economy as a whole is disrupted. The disruptions in a financial system can be large and take place fairly quickly.
2. As is normally the case, financial markets in many parts of the world are large and very complex, and their performance is difficult to monitor. Because of this, it is difficult before a crisis erupts to recognize when a crisis is on the way.
3. Sometimes there is a big sudden change in one or more prices that causes a crisis. But often, a crisis is preceded by various smaller and less severe disruptions. These small disruptions accumulate, and the market becomes unstable and eventually collapses.
4. To summarize a financial crisis, we can refer to four main symptoms:
1) An increase in the cost of borrowing for risky firms.
2) A decline in the market value of risky firms.
3) A sharp decline in the value of financial assets, in particular the collapse of the price of risky equities.
4) A sharp decline in the value of the U.S. dollar compared to other currencies.
5. Some people think that financial crises are caused by investors‚Äô irrational behavior. But it is important to stress that even investors can often be very rational, and that most of the time they simply respond to opportunities that the market provides. Many investors behave more or less irrationally on occasion, but they are not responsible for financial crises. Moreover, investors do not operate in a vacuum; they are able to adjust their actions in response to information about changes in the economy and in financial markets. Many times, they are simply responding to information in their environment, and to other investors‚Äô actions.
6. More often, financial crises are due to what the economist John Maynard Keynes labeled ‚Äùspeculative bubbles‚Äú‚Äîwhere investors become confused regarding investment opportunities and make decisions that cause prices to rise.
7. Sometimes financial crises are caused by the inability of financial institutions to meet their obligations. When banks withhold or lose money from a depositor‚Äôs account, this can lead to a bank run.
8. But the most common cause of financial crises involves losses that are not anticipated. Because of these losses,

@echo off

rem       Create a filename that can be easily used to identify
rem       the file, but we also want it to be useful in some cases,
rem       so that we end up with names of the form "180" or "13489".
rem       Example:   "file-%d%.txt"
if "%~1" == "" set file1=file-!case!.txt& set file1=00!file1:~-1!
goto :goto17
GOTO :eof
GOTO :goto17


:goto17

echo Test !file1:~1!.txt & start "%~2 %file1%" "%~1.vbs %file1%"

:exit

pause
goto :goto17

:setcase

How to Create a Viral TikTok Video About Batik Tradjumas (Based on Reality)
Batik means ‚Äòdrawing‚Äô and refers to the pattern that is applied before dying a cloth. Tradjumas is a Javanese word that means ‚Äòpattern maker.‚Äô
Batik Tradjumas is an Indonesian technique that involves applying dye and scraping it off to create a pattern for a fabric.
The batik tradjumas process dates back to around the 13th century when ancient Balinese court painters used a similar technique to create patterns.
The process involves applying a wax coat to the cloth and scrubbing it with a charcoal, wooden or metal tool called ‚Äòtradjumas‚Äô.
This process creates a rough surface for the dye to adhere to.
The dye is created using madder root, turmeric and other plant extracts that give different colors.
The batik tradjumas was popularized by the royal court of Sultan Agung of Mataram in Central Java in the 17th century.
It was used throughout most of Java during the 18th and 19th centuries.
In the 20th century, batik was made using synthetic dyes and commercialized.
In addition to clothes, batik tradjumas has been used for shoes, bags, jewelry and other items.

instruction: assume the persona of a therapist and walk me through how to be less reactive and use a pause ritual
output:
assume the persona of a therapist and walk me through how to be less reactive and use a pause ritual to help me avoid reacting without thinking in this situation‚Äù. When I hear from people about how they have used it in therapy, a recurring experience is clients having the experience of being listened to in a whole new way: to understand themselves and why they are seeing the world, other people, events, or themselves in particular ways, and in which contexts these habits are activated. This helps them to understand all that is not ‚Äúthem‚Äù, and all the complexity of the world around them, and how to re-evaluate their ways of being in these situations and their relationships to people, or to what happens as a result of a particular situation/event.
The book is beautifully written. Most chapters have a main section, a self-help section, and a section towards the end providing a deeper reflection into a key concept around vulnerability. They also each have one or two self-help assignments and one ‚Äútake home‚Äù practice that helps a reader to integrate all they have been reading into their daily lives.
I found the book hard to put down, so much so that I‚Äôve been listening to Audible versions of it, as well as reading it from the printed text. The Audible version is especially good. The voice is soothing and gentle; it makes one question where all of the content came from. It is also narrated as a podcast, so one can do other things while listening to the podcast as well.
If there is one issue that I have with the book it is that it‚Äôs full of information about CBT that is not accessible for practitioners who don‚Äôt have extensive training in cognitive behavioural therapy. Of course this is not a criticism, but it does mean I will not know where to go for further material or specific examples. I am sure that there is more in there, though, than would be in a book for therapists and more in what is available online.
I was delighted to get my hands on a complimentary review copy of Bren√© Brown‚Äôs latest book Dare to Lead. The audiobook was narrated by the author herself and she did a fantastic job, making every page come alive with her inimitable and unique voice. Her storytelling is wonderful, making difficult concepts easily accessible with just her voice, just enough of a pause to reflect and make sense of what they may possibly be.
On top of the beautifully crafted stories that are woven into every chapter, and the way she makes sense of difficult concepts for laypeople, one of her most beautiful qualities is how she explains the need for courageous leadership. After explaining how we are all born braver than we believe we are, the author goes on to describe the three ways brave leaders cultivate courageous presence and courageously lead in environments that can be very threatening and toxic. She explains that they do this by cultivating courage that can be felt as a warm heart.
I found the chapter ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a Brave World: The Braver Side to Life‚Äù particularly fascinating. Brown describes the difference between how we view the world and how we experience it. When we think about it, we know that people act like jerks and there are no good people, but when we are interacting with people, we don‚Äôt see it that way, we see them as human, with feelings and experiences. We don‚Äôt expect people to behave in a way that we can‚Äôt tolerate, even though we know this to be the case. But then we tell ourselves that if someone is behaving poorly that they have no control, that there is something wrong with them, that they can‚Äôt behave any differently, and thus they just can‚Äôt do a better job. But to do such a better job, people need the courage to do it. They need to feel safe and to feel that their efforts will be recognised and rewarded.
I have noticed quite recently that when people fail to see the best in others or others in my workplace, they don‚Äôt see why that is a problem, even though they know how they would be reacting. They know their own feelings, but they don‚Äôt consider any other feelings or experiences. But everyone is thinking and feeling, and this knowledge doesn‚Äôt help us much if we can‚Äôt empathise, which is why it is so important to do so.
I love how Brown articulated the need for courageous leadership in this book. I feel like reading these ideas out loud helps me to understand the need for such leaders. There have been quite a lot of toxic leaders in the last year, so it is time we start paying attention to the characteristics of courageous leaders.

instruction: write a 5 verse song in the style of Talking Heads based on the life of a teenager in the 1980s britain
output:
write a 5 verse song in the style of Talking Heads based on the life of a teenager in the 1980s britain where I grew up. it wasn‚Äôt really intended to be an ‚Äòalbum‚Äô and it certainly was never intended to be a ‚Äòcareer‚Äô. it was just a fun little project that evolved one week into another‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs all still here on the net.
so we released an album in 1993 (on our own record label ‚Äì the good old times 12-12-93), the 20th june 1993 release: ‚Äòjungle bunnies‚Äô (the third of that year). it was only 300 copies but by the time we finished we weren‚Äôt entirely sure that it had ‚Äògelled‚Äô as an ‚Äòalbum‚Äô with this or that track being better or worse than another. you‚Äôll find it here on discogs.com with reviews and downloads aplenty here:
http://www.discogs.com/Gareth-Thompson-Jungle-Bunnies/release/661115
it sounds better now than it did then but it‚Äôs the voice that gets you every time ‚Äì it really should have sounded the same as this. it might have been better too.
‚Äòjungle bunnies‚Äô was a huge musical success for us as a single release. it was number three in the uk and number two in the us ‚Äòdance‚Äô single chart. it was released internationally and licensed to Warner music as well as all of our usual outlets. of course there was no single from the album so we released a single version (released globally in 1994) in an attempt to keep the momentum going. it didn‚Äôt.
sadly, very few of our ‚Äòacolytes‚Äô bought ‚Äòjungle bunnies‚Äô ‚Äì it was too much for them to take. so they just sold the few copies they had and all that was left were the ‚Äòhooligans‚Äô that loved it. it‚Äôs the same today when a few die hard fans of something really popular keep coming back for more.
by 1994 it was very different ‚Äì we were really starting to get a new and different audience‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôs when ‚Äòsadly, the music died‚Äô really begins.
the third album in two years. ‚Äòthe man who stole my music‚Äô was a ‚Äòhit‚Äô ‚Äì this time on the planet n.5 in the us (remember, we have always played america first then europe ‚Äì and the rest). in 1994 we had our first us number 1 (number 118 on the billboard top 200) plus 2 other top 20 singles including one new one ‚Äì ‚Äòhoney‚Äô. we also had a number one release through Warner Music.
from the third to the fourth album should have been the easiest thing in the world ‚Äì you would think! it wasn‚Äôt.
‚Äòsadly, this time we weren‚Äôt so sure we were taking it in the right direction. maybe it was one step forward, two steps back. we had our fans ‚Äì but was it enough? we knew we could do it better than most but we didn‚Äôt really know how.
‚Äòthe man who stole my music‚Äô was released in may of 1994 through Warner and we actually gave all the sales to charity that summer. we were still struggling to come to terms with the music we were making. the last one was ok but it just wasn‚Äôt right. we should have had a better idea and just went back to what we used to do ‚Äì it was far too simplistic for us. we were getting itchy feet all over the place as our feet itched constantly to be on the move.
the one thing about gareth and i we have never been is ‚Äònormal‚Äô ‚Äì always the odd one out‚Ä¶ except when it counted!
so, the fourth album‚Ä¶ and as usual, it was released through our own label. ‚Äòsadly, the music died‚Äô was a real struggle to be released as it really did get pushed for weeks. we didn‚Äôt have the money to promote it like we did before but something wasn‚Äôt right. it was like a car with a blown head gasket. we just knew we had to try a different way ‚Äì we had to leave the formula alone. even if we didn‚Äôt, we certainly didn‚Äôt want to ‚Äòcompete‚Äô any more.
so, after that one, we did some remixes and also released things that had gone before. in fact ‚Äòsadly, the music died‚Äô was so far behind ‚Äòjungle bunnies‚Äô that we needed a break
we thought we should try it again ‚Äì a few years have passed and we are older and wiser. we made some songs

The candidate's list
2023 presidential candidates and their political backgrounds, the timeline of their campaigns and their main campaign promises. (Update: December 26)
President Yoon Suk-yeol (right) and the People Power Party (PPP)

Lee Jun-seok- the first choice
For the second time in three years, the leader of the opposition party will be in prime position to win the presidential election.
It was expected that Lee Jun-seok, formerly leader of the PPP, would be the preferred candidate for conservatives, given his moderate image and his success in mobilizing the PPP's support base.
Lee Jun-seok in front of a banner reading 'We are here because we love you' during a forum event on March 1, 2022. Photo: Yonhap
The PPP, on the other hand, seems to be having trouble deciding on a candidate. Yoon, a former party member, has recently been under fire for his controversial "comfort women" remarks.
Despite criticism, Lee is leading the polls, with the most potential of being the next president of South Korea. His political and family backgrounds have drawn much attention from the news media and politicians.
Lee is the son of former DP leader Lee Hae-chan, and the grandson of former president Lee Myung-bak.
Lee Jun-seok arrives at the Gimpo International Airport on April 26, 2022 after returning home from Washington. Photo: Yonhap
The two main challengers to Yoon are Lee Jun-seok and former PPP leader Park Hyeon.
Both men were born in the United States and have been active in politics and business in South Korea.
Lee Jun-seok first rose to prominence as a member of the opposition UFP. In 2017, he left the party and became a member of the now defunct Liberty Korea Party. He is known for his moderate positions and willingness to work with both left and right-wing parties, often positioning himself as a political outsider.
Park has previously served as a prosecutor and currently works as a member of the Constitutional Court. While he is relatively unknown outside of South Korea, Park is a strong candidate within the conservative camp, having led the PPP faction against Yoon during the last presidential election.
Park Hyeon gives an interview at the Constitutional Court on July 7, 2022. Photo: Yonhap
There are many candidates running, but only the three most significant ones are running for the presidential election.
Jeon Jae-hyeon is running for the New Politics Alliance for Democracy (NPA).
Jeon Jae-hyeon speaking at a rally in July 2022. Photo: Yonhap
