output:
The tone of the email should be changed and rewritten in a more professional manner.

Subject: Asking for Vacation Time
Hi [Employer], 
I hope all is well. I am writing to request a day off on [date]. I have already taken care of my work responsibilities for that day and will be available to answer any questions or concerns you may have. 
Thank you for your time, 
[Your name]

If that doesn't work, do go back to asking for consideration when you were first hired. Many companies have rules that they enforce on their employees.

A: If you are a new employee and have used up all your vacation time, you should be more than generous to give up your last and last to be taken days to your senior colleague(s).
But if you or other colleagues are also using up the last vacation day or two, then it's only fair for everybody to work till then and go to the beach for a few days.
As you can probably imagine there are many scenarios and therefore I think it's unfair to say that you have an obligation to use the first two days you got. Just keep in mind that most companies will require employees to be on vacation for at least five days (including Sundays) and that the days before and after may probably be counted again.

A: This question's title seems to be, "What options do I have if I'm being asked to give up vacation time to cover other time off?"  With that background, your first point seems to be, "I'm using up all of my vacation before the year is over, can I use this time to take some leave that other people have taken?"  I have to say, that's rather odd behavior.
Unless this is the first time you've been given leave time that you're now using, there aren't a lot of options to discuss (and the reason to do any of them will be that it's a temporary position anyway, so you don't have a lot to lose).
If there were a way to arrange it so that it wasn't a problem...


*

*Maybe you could set up a schedule of taking vacation time in advance (but not in excess of the actual vacation time you get).  That way you could tell the manager, "I'm going to be taking vacation from [Date to Date] then going on vacation from [Date to Date].  On Day X of [Date], I'd be glad to cover for some of that time."
(Yes, this is a bit ridiculous, especially since you're going to be on vacation when you're supposed to, but again, it might buy you some time not to be asked to give up future holidays.)


...that would be ideal, because the manager would know that you've actually used your vacation time, which is more than any manager should expect from you.
If that doesn't work, then...


*

*You could offer to take on some of their vacation time at some point, since you'll be out anyways.  If that doesn't work, then...

*You could agree to some kind of schedule that you agreed to be on call when needed while away, but not to be on call when you're actually away (and agree to work enough hours to cover when you're not there).  Maybe that will work.  But it might not, and this isn't worth doing either because you'll still be told to work overtime the next few weeks.
At that point, if you want to stick around long enough to find some other work you'l have to find the resources to deal with it.  If you're not in a position to do that, then you need to either do something with your vacation time (I agree with the other answers here that you're probably not going to be allowed to use it, but just having it in reserve could come in handy sometimes), or else find a new job that offers you better vacation time.
If all you're concerned about is taking care of the problem for the next month....  Just take the next month's vacation, and work your heart out.  If there are any repercussions for that, you'll find out.

A: If your employer said that you're going to use all your vacation time before you leave (for which I doubt they would say such a thing if you had just started - they'd probably say you only get 2 days (as a new employee) if you're going to be with that company for more than a few months), then as long as other people don't request their vacation time back while you're on it, you're good.
If other people are

instruction: Write a social media post about the call for collaboration on a crowdsourcing project in a persuasive way.
output:
Write a social media post about the call for collaboration on a crowdsourcing project in a persuasive way. Why is this important?

# 0xe4. Do You Want to be the Person Who is Responsible for All These Projects?

### This is where things get fun.

##### Your Objective

This task is a challenge. Once we provide you with a project brief and some materials (like code, assets, and resources) and then you see the project deadline creeping up on you, you suddenly realize you can't just throw together anything. You're working on a project, and it has a budget! It needs to be good and it needs to be presented in a professional manner.

##### Walkthrough

You've had your first few projects rolled out before this one, right? Let's say you worked and pitched this one well, and you were paid $75. That meant $15 is yours to keep. We know what you're thinking: Maybe I should hold out for something even more professional. Maybe we should hold you back. But no! You deserve some credit just for the fact that you did the project.

So, for this one, you get to write a letter to the client. We think of it like a sales page, but even more like a prospectus, letting people know what your services are and what they'll get in return. We do encourage you to offer different packages on your list, and to charge accordingly, but what you charge for a $5,000 website will not be the same as what you charge for a $50 social media campaign.

Now, what you'll write is really up to you, so we don't want to offer suggestions beyond a few pointers.

Just remember to keep it short and sweet, and make sure you talk about your company's story. What are your passions and your vision? Also, what are you offering to give back to your company or to your industry?

We think that it's important to be true to yourself in these kinds of communications. It's easy to go overboard in pitching a product, but also, it's important to sell yourself and be authentic.

You wrote your email pitch, now use it to build your story.

# Chapter 15-11

# Project Management 101

Project management is all about doing your job.

Whether you're a software engineer writing a website, or a writer who is managing a podcast production, or a musician writing music for a new indie band, you still have to do the work.

You're the one who is going to write the songs or the words or the lines that the client asks for, and you're the one who is going to be accountable for your own deadlines.

You can't ask for a contract with a client unless you are prepared to sign a contract with them.

You can't send a press release and then wonder why you didn't get any responses back unless you've made sure that your address is correct and that you have a good list of media contacts on file  both of which take patience and a willingness to be proactive (which you can either get from this book or from your project manager or your boss).

To do your job well, you need to find out which tools you like and which tools you don't like, especially from the start. You may make the mistake of putting off doing any project management until you actually finish a project. Instead, you need to learn which tools and techniques work best when you get right into them and apply them to your project. This is why we give you the option in every chapter to choose between a Quick Start and Full Course. The Quick Start is just a starting point for an approach and a way to keep your project manager from nagging you too hard about your workload. The Full Course is a lot more intensive and takes a longer time to complete. You can choose the option that works best for you and your project, and then move on after you find the one that works.

In the Full Course, you can choose to do any combination of the tasks you want. If you have questions, you can also choose to go to our Help Desk for advice.

Once you have a project management strategy that works, you can try to build upon that. If you do work on one project, don't use the same strategy for the next project you have. Do you have a good sense of when to call your client or your boss? When do you find something needs a quick project update? Do you update them every week, or every day, or when something big happens? There's no "right" way to do this, but if you find that you want to be more efficient, you can refine your strategies.

instruction: My favorite witty review of The Rings of Power series is this:
output:
My favorite witty review of The Rings of Power series is this: I used to think reading a book a piece of cake‚Äînow imagine trying to eat said piece of cake. [If you‚Äôre one of the two people on this planet who thought the books were good, please read this; we can talk afterwards].
I agree with the review.
What I find intriguing is I‚ÄôHOP (not sure how to spell it). I actually felt somewhat let down by their last two releases (they seem to be leaning to the ‚Äòsilly‚Äô end of the spectrum, the last album they released really hit that spot for me). The one that is playing now though is pretty good. Like something I could get behind. If anything, it seems like they are leaning toward rock instead of the pop that they were leaning toward earlier. Or at least it has rock written all over it.
You have a long way to go with the reviews. This week alone has seen some very big ones released, not to mention the album of the summer is coming out on Friday.
I‚Äôm not going to touch it. I‚Äôll enjoy some other writer‚Äôs take.
My best friend in high school went to her first (and only) WOTR meet-up and had a pretty epic time. I was at home, with a broken thumb, but I couldn‚Äôt be left out, even from afar!
This is the real deal, as in it is literally Tolkien‚Äôs own text. So this is going to be huge. I‚Äôm not going to write it into my blog, but there will be a lot of buzz around it, both good and bad.
The ‚Äúpolitics of WOTR‚Äù have already broken out on Goodreads. Tolkien‚Äôs politics were on the right, which is pretty much where politics are now.
And the reviews are coming in now. From WotR they have: 1 out of 5 stars; 2 stars.
I think the show‚Äôs creators (and the actors) realized that the first two episodes needed to be a bit of a toned down version of the final version of the show, to keep viewers, especially parents, interested.
If you didn‚Äôt read the books or weren‚Äôt familiar with the names of the characters, you‚Äôd think it was the most boring show ever, but in the final version there‚Äôs a lot of actual fight scenes, which you‚Äôd see if they‚Äôd been allowed to stay in this first 2-hour episode.
If you were expecting an exciting series, one where they can start to build a world of people from around the world, you‚Äôll be very disappointed. The first 2 hours is, I think, the least exciting thing you could imagine Tolkien doing and I would not recommend watching them until the whole series is released, you won‚Äôt be able to wait to find out more in one-hour chunks.
Just to remind you, that show is coming out on Amazon Prime on September 2 as 2 half-hour episodes.
If you‚Äôre in one of Amazon‚Äôs test-markets (the last I heard, it was in 20 markets, and I don‚Äôt know how big they really are) then you can see this ‚Äúbonus‚Äù scene which Amazon put together for Amazon Prime members.
I‚Äôll be interested to know what you think of it.
By the way, today is a big release day for films. It‚Äôs the National Film Festival for Tiger/Leopard Conservation. The films are in English, Hindi, and Japanese.
I don‚Äôt have much time this evening to write and say anything, so I‚Äôll just post that one and let it serve as a reminder, and leave it to you to discover all these new and interesting things.
If you haven‚Äôt already, check the review of that show out. And let me know, what do you think of it after watching the bonus scenes?
You left the room, while I watched.
You will come back here soon, and you won‚Äôt remember where you were before.
But it will come back to you, very hard.
It doesn‚Äôt want to do good and you know that.
I‚Äôm only here to do the things and watch the things.
I‚Äôm not really a human.
You should have realized, but you didn‚Äôt.
I can‚Äôt just let you go.
If I let you go, you would be free to see me, and then people might see me instead of you.
I have to get rid of the part of you that knows me, and then you would be normal again.
It‚Äôs not really good, but it‚Äôs not evil.
I can‚Äôt destroy myself if you‚Äôre not here to tell people I‚Äôm here. Then it would all be over.
But I‚Äô

instruction: A helpful writing exercise is writing a story without using adjectives or adverbs. This will help you learn to use other words and phrases to describe what you are trying to say. Here are some examples:
output:
A helpful writing exercise is writing a story without using adjectives or adverbs. This will help you learn to use other words and phrases to describe what you are trying to say. Here are some examples: √¢¬Ä¬úThe sun shined brightly, the clouds slowly rolled past, and the wind blew gently.√¢¬Ä¬ù (This is not a story, but a descriptive paragraph. Adjectives and adverbs can be added to help create a descriptive piece.)
Also read: How to Become a Professional Freelance Writer in India
Another way to become a better writer is to practice writing each day, even if it√¢¬Ä¬ôs just for ten minutes. You can read and write for ten minutes every morning and then read and write for five minutes at night before going to sleep. Try to create an √¢¬Ä¬úI write√¢¬Ä¬ù mentality. It will help you become a better writer and help you to increase your vocabulary. Many writers also use Grammarly to help them improve their grammar before they submit their work. Grammarly is an awesome tool that can help writers learn new grammar rules and find errors in written work. The good thing is that you don√¢¬Ä¬ôt have to learn how to use Grammarly. Just type your words into a new document and watch as Grammarly automatically corrects your errors and offers suggestions. It makes it super easy to improve your writing. You can also use Grammarly to check your reading comprehension and writing skills and test your grammar. Try Grammarly in the App Store or Google Play.
How to be an Editor?
You don√¢¬Ä¬ôt have to write novels to become an editor. Some editors write short stories and other edited works, while others help to fix the mistakes that were made when editing. Most editors have degrees in English or writing and have spent their whole lives reading. You can make money as an editor, and if you don√¢¬Ä¬ôt like your job, you can change it. Here are some jobs you can do as an editor: √¢¬Ä¬¢	Academic editors: Make sure that articles are in good grammar and format and have a clear writing style. These editors usually work at colleges or universities. They can make up and create a title for an article. Edit and rewrite articles to make sure that they sound professional√¢¬Ä¬¶
How to be a Journalist?
To be a successful journalist, you need to be a writer and have good research skills. Most journalists go to school to get a degree in journalism or communications. A good example is CNN, which has 20,000 employees and needs reporters for its network. To work for CNN, someone with a bachelor√¢¬Ä¬ôs degree can work as a web editor. You can be a journalist if you love to write, know how to research and write about what you are interested in, and can work well with people. While there is no requirement for a journalism degree, many colleges offer degrees in journalism, and you can work your way up to being a writer.
Tips for Self-publishing an E-book
There are many ways to make money as a professional writer. In fact, most writers make less than $1000 a year, so you could make a career. You can get a book published by writing a manuscript. Most self-publishing companies charge a fee and offer you help in order to publish your book. If you want to self-publish and have a specific book idea in mind, then you should do research to find out if it would be a good idea and what kind of book you want to write. There are lots of different e-books, so it√¢¬Ä¬ôs important to choose one that fits your style and your audience. You can decide what kind of content you want to write about as well as the title that will be your book. You might choose to write a book about a different part of your life or business that you√¢¬Ä¬ôre interested in. Once you√¢¬Ä¬ôve figured out what kind of book you want to write, you can get help with the publishing process. You can publish your book online and sell it on Amazon or Ebay. If you have multiple titles, you can make them available as a series.
Steps to Becoming a Fiction Writer
If you like to write on the computer and don√¢¬Ä¬ôt mind spending a little money, you can make money as a freelance writer. Most editors will pay you to write books or stories for them. Some freelance writers get paid weekly or monthly, and others get paid per item. If you want to work as a writer to make money, there are several things to consider. You need to pay attention to the way your readers read, be able to write well, and have the creativity needed to come up with an original idea. If you can√¢¬Ä¬ôt do all three, you can√¢¬Ä¬ôt be a writer, and you should try to find another job. For example, if you love to read but hate to

instruction: Come up with some search queries on google about coding stuff.
output:
Come up with some search queries on google about coding stuff. There are also a lot of resources of free/pay for programming tutorials, it varies from the topics you want to study. A good example is in python, it is very easy to find python courses.
There are also so many YouTube videos on programming, you can find them too by searching the keywords on YouTube.
If you want to self-learn the programming theory like object-oriented programming, then a good book is a must.
And last but not the least, you should also learn how to code properly. If you are new to programming, it is a good thing to learn how to write code correctly. You often can see that some of those programmers are not actually professional, so they make a lot of mistakes. So, to be better you should be able to fix the things yourself. You will not be professional programmer if you keep making lots of mistakes with your code.
Some code that you wrote before can also be very good, so if you can improve it by adding more functionalities, that‚Äôs even better. But, if you have the problems, at the beginning of your programming learning journey, you can get help from the beginners forums on codebunk.
So, what do you think? Is it worth learning to code? What is the best way for a beginner to start with it? Leave your opinion in the comment section.

```python
a = 0
while a < 5:
    print(a)
    a = a+1
```

- Code with for loop.
```python
b = 0
for b in range(0, 5):
    print(b)
    b = b+1
```

- For loop with for loop.

```python
for a, b in enumerate(range(0, 5)):
    print(b)
    print(a)
```

```python
for a, b, c in enumerate(range(0, 5)):

for i in range(0, 5):

    print(x)

```

instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
output:
What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
Click File.Click Options.Click General.Choose Enable Random Words under Use in the Find and Replace section.Click OK to confirm.
After enabling, in the To find box, you can now type a word or phrase you want to replace. In the With box, you can type the word you want to use as a filler, or enter random words to use as the filler.
If youre searching a document for the entire word Filler, you can type it in the To find box.
If youre searching for an individual word, you can type it in the With box.Click Replace to change the search word with your new random word.Click Replace All to replace all the text that matches the word.
You can continue to add or replace random words.
How to Use Random Text
What Can I Use as Filler Content in MS Word?
How many characters do you need to enter to make a document that will be too long to upload to a website?
For an e-mail message, use a line spacing 0.5 inch, width 76.0 inches, 1-inch margins on the left and right side, 14-point Times New Roman font, and 14-point type size. You can type 78 characters to make the document 48 characters long per line.
An e-mail message has a text length requirement of 3,000 characters for all users. For longer messages, consider using a file format such as .pdf, .doc, or .docx. Consider the following example: A business uses a standard message template to share information with their customers. For example, an e-mail from the Human Resources department notifies employees of their upcoming vacation.The message is sent to all employees in the company, which may have a maximum of 500 employees. As the employee count is relatively static, you can adjust the required length of the message by adjusting the line spacing and font size.To calculate the required number of characters, divide the line spacing (ex: 0.5 inch) by the width (ex: 76.0 inches). Then multiply that result by the height of the font (ex: 14-point) and the height of the type size (ex: 14-point). Then add that total to the total number of words to calculate the required number of characters.To make the e-mail message 48 characters per line, divide 0.5 by 76.0 (22 characters per line). Then multiply that line length by the font size and the type size to get 48 characters.
Using the preceding example, the required number of words is 28 words to fit on an e-mail of 500 characters. If the Human Resources department has an e-mail message that requires more than 500 characters, then you need to adjust the line spacing and type size. To adjust the e-mail message size, keep the number of characters at 500 and change the line spacing and type size accordingly.Example: An e-mail from the Human Resources department notifies all employees that their vacation starting the fourth week of October.In this scenario, the total number of words required is 44 words (48-4=44). To fit this many words onto the screen, you would need to adjust the line spacing and font size to 20-point Times New Roman and use a line spacing of 20-point.
How long is a MS Word Document?
A Microsoft Word document does not have a maximum length. To send a document to someone who does not have Microsoft Word, convert the Microsoft Word document to a plain text file using the File > Save as option.For more information, see Confidentiality Issues for Word Document with Long Length.
How long is an average Word document?
On a typical computer monitor a typical document is around 11 wide and around 8 high. A 16 point font would be .89591124 inches wide and .71875 inches high. Thats around 8048 characters. A simple multiplication equation to determine the number of pages is to divide the length of the document by the average height the document will be on the screen.
For example, on a good-sized desk, you might have an average height of 22 (thats a pretty good guess considering desk monitors average 21 inches). So 8048 divided by 22 is 363.2 characters per page.
How to Use a Word Document

instruction: Design a soothing pastel color palette for your slides. Pastel colors generally come across as pretty and delicate, so you‚Äôll want to make sure your presentation calls for a similar mood. Choose up to five colors or color codes.
output:
Design a soothing pastel color palette for your slides. Pastel colors generally come across as pretty and delicate, so you‚Äôll want to make sure your presentation calls for a similar mood. Choose up to five colors or color codes.
Include one illustration to add personality to your slides. Illustrating your slides will help you stand out from the crowd, so don‚Äôt worry if it doesn‚Äôt immediately make sense to you. Your illustration can be created from scratch or you can use an existing design.
Choose a catchy headline to introduce your main topic. Highlight your headline to catch your audience‚Äôs eyes.
Present your main topic next. It is a good idea to use one of the colors you selected to create a header that makes the title the most noticeable element on your slides. A large color header will help make sure you speak loud and clear when you go over your main topic.
Add a few sections of small items to fill in the empty space. You can pick five or six items to show. You don‚Äôt need to add every item you have. Consider only adding items from your main topic. For example, you don‚Äôt need to include five items about how to keep a dog, then five items about how to keep a cat. Just choose the five top dog and cat topics.
Make sure to add each item into the appropriate section. For example, if your slide‚Äôs main topic is ‚ÄúHow to Play the Drums‚Äù, you might put your illustration in the main topic section, your header in the headline section, your first section on the drum kit, another section on where to find drumsticks, another section on the different types of drums.
Make sure each title fits under its own section if you want to use images with your headers. A good way to test it is if the image would only show up in the next slide, then don‚Äôt use an image, just have a space above the next heading in your list.
It‚Äôs good to write a lot of your speech and then use your presentation to highlight your points. If you want to add extra detail into your speech that you don‚Äôt want to be put into your presentation, you can add images or notes to keep the presentation organized or just make sure you make a good flow of your slides from one slide to the next.
You can put a few items together under the main topic. For example, add a section on how to find the best dog food, then have a section on how to find the best cat food, then have a section on animals that aren‚Äôt cats or dogs because you don‚Äôt want to take up the main topic.
Make sure to fill out your speech if you want it to go too long. You might want to add more items or write more about what you will speak at each section.
Start each section with an interesting and relevant item. Don‚Äôt start with something useless like ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs your name?‚Äù Instead, you can start on a funny story you heard, a great quote, and so on.
It might be a good idea to start off with something simple, like a drawing of a dog. Then you can use that as your main topic. If you want to get into an important topic like animal rights, maybe start with something minor like how to choose the best dog food.
You can do an experiment each time on each slide of your presentation. You can always experiment with your slides by changing the typeface to make it smaller and rearranging the information to see how the images look from different points, but this will get time consuming fast.
This is only if you have the time.
You can find some of your own slides online. When you open up a presentation online, you could copy the information together to create your own presentation. This is an easy way to save time and money. If you just want to keep up with your studies, you can do this by visiting one of the websites listed at the end of this article.
The easiest way to create your presentation is to download some of the websites already made or look at our link to Microsoft Powerpoint, which will allow you to create your own. See below for some good sites where you can get your presentation all done for you. Remember to keep an eye out and make some of your own changes though. For example, if you found a presentation made by someone else, you could rearrange the order of sections, or change and add up-to-date information, or add original data.
After you have decided on what information you want, now you need to organize and make your points clear and succinct. To do so, you will need to organize your information depending on what you want to present first, what you want most important or central, and then what you are covering second-hand. In doing so, you will help to make your presentation understandable, comprehensible, and to help your audience to follow along with you, which will aid your audience to understand

instruction:
Find sentences from reliable sources such as the Guardian or Forbes that contain the exact match for the given sentence or phrase. Also, mention the source of each sentence.

There are great options
output: Find sentences from reliable sources such as the Guardian or Forbes that contain the exact match for the given sentence or phrase. Also, mention the source of each sentence. There are great options to use while generating the list of sentences: `-l ` to generate a fixed number of sentences. `-r ` to generate sentences in a fixed rate. `-s ` to generate a list of sentences that fit the given count. ### Create Nested Sentence Lists By default, the sentence generator is aware only about phrases. It means that a set of sentences can only create a phrase. To avoid this limitation, you should generate sentence lists, which use sentence patterns generated from a source. This way, to use the sentence generator, you have to follow: * Generate patterns from a source. * Generate sentence sets from patterns created in the previous step. * Generate sentence lists from the sentence set. * Read the generated sentence list. Please see detailed sample code below: {% highlight python %} # Generate patterns: patterns = phrase_generator.generative_sentence_patterns() # Generate sentence sets from pattern: sentence_set = sentence_generator.generate_set('I my and ' f'My ' f'I my and and' f'I bought my ' f'I my and ' f'I ' f'I ' f'I my ' f'I buy ' f'I ', patterns) # Generate a sentence list with words from the sentence set: sentences = sentence_generator.generate_sentences('sentences') # Read sentences list and check its size: assert len(sentences) == 61, 'Some words are wrong! You have: ' + str(len(sentences)) phrases = [ f'I am a student' f'I am not a student' f'I am not only a student but also a teacher' f'I am not a student but also a teacher' f'I am a student who is also a teacher' f'I am a student and also a teacher' f'I am also a student and a teacher' ] assert set(phrases).issubset( set( [sentence.split() for sent in sentences for token in sent.split() for phrase in patterns for match in pattern.match(token): phrase ] ) ), 'These sentences have wrong words: ' + ','.join(set(phrases) - set(sentences)) # Get sentences pattern: patterns = [(i, sent.split()) for sent in sentences for i in sent.split()] # Print example patterns: for i, sent in patterns: print('Sentence: ' + ','.join(sent)) print('Pattern: ' + phrase_generator.sentence_to_pattern(sent)) {% endhighlight %} Note: sentences_by_words lists contains sentences with the exact word used in the source while sentences_by_patterns lists contains generated sentences with their patterns. ## Usage of Sentence Generator The best way to use sentence generator is to generate a list of sentences and parse them using a program you write. However, you can use the sentence generator, directly from your language or any programming in one of these ways: * Reading sentences from files. * Calling the python script directly from any programming. * Using python libraries like **[Flask](URL [Web2py](URL [Django](URL [Node.js](URL and others to use sentences and patterns. ### Sample Reading Sentences from Files Please see the following script: {% highlight python %} {% raw %} import subprocess import sys from string import strip def download_sentences(): """Download sentences from the generator:"""

instruction:
During writing, we added an asterisk for the word that did not come to mind. You will need to provide several examples to demonstrate all the words that can be used in the sentence instead of the asterisk.

we * to know
output:
During writing, we added an asterisk for the word that did not come to mind. You will need to provide several examples to demonstrate all the words that can be used in the sentence instead of the asterisk.

we * to know that ...

The only person that we * has that kind of knowledge is ...

When all the words were provided in the example sentence, the asterisk remained.



## How to remove asterisks when a word is used repeatedly

The following sentence contains eight words:

When asked, he quickly replied, * we * that the problem wasn't his responsibility and that he did not want anyone else but him fix something that he didn't have any * to fix.

In the next sentence, we only used one word:

When asked ..., he quickly replied ... and didn't want anyone else * but him ...

When the asterisks are removed like this, there is little distinction between the two sentences. We don't recommend that you do this until the context is obvious and not the point of the article.



## How to remove all asterisks and use only a noun

Sometimes, some sentences may contain words that should not exist. This is called the "no-man's land" of grammar  no one agrees where they go. 

* It is too long to explain all this again so I will try to not *.
* How * to describe it?

In these case, it is recommended to remove all the asterisks and only keep the name of a noun (or the pronoun).

* It is too long to explain why this method does not exist so I will try to not talk about it again.
* How to describe it?

It is important to make the sentence more active, by using the verbs of our choice.

## _2.4_

The verb "to be", when used to start a sentence, is always weak. The infinitive (in bold) should be used if the sentence has an imperative or a command.

He isn't going by subway.

He must be seen in person.

He _must_ be seen in person.

When it's a state-of-affairs or personal information, the verb "to be" is often used.

He _was_ sleeping in the back seat.

I _haven't_ got all the documentation required.

When looking at the list of the people that we want to meet, we think that none of them live in the area.

They never seem to be on time. When leaving their office, we have to wait for them for hours.

It is hard to get any sleep late at night. When our neighbour is out late, we can't breathe well.

They _sont bien _dans la r√É¬©gion dans laquelle_ √ã≈ì j'ai grandi._ I grew up in the same area.

## _3.2_

We use _dans_ "dans" when we have any "privates" and when the adjective is a negative one.

They _sont dans le secret_ (of something). They have a "secret" (that is, a privileged knowledge).

They _sont dans le secret de l'amour_. They have the privilege to love.

They _sont dans le secret de leur enfant_. They know about their child.

They are _dans l'enfer_. They are miserable.

instruction: Design a skill assessment¬†questioner for R (Programming Language).
output:
Design a skill assessment¬†questioner for R (Programming Language).
import io.strawberry.*

let questions = [
    Question("What type of programming languages are they?",
        "Are there multiple types of programming languages?

What are their differences?",
        [
            Select("C Programming Language",
                ["C:9", "C++:3", "Java:4", "Ruby:8"]),
            Select("C++ Programming Language",
                ["C++:4", "Java:3", "Ruby:7", "Scala:1"]),
        ]
    ),
    Question("What is the syntax of each language?",
        "Show the syntax of the C programming language.",
        [
            Code("C:9", "{{{{{{# C Language Syntax }}#}}}}")
        ]
    )
]

let builder = STAPLE.createBuilder(STAPLE.createTester(questions))
.setCode(Code.builder()
    .withLanguage("C:9")
    .withFile("syntax.c")
    .withOutput(STAPLE.OutputType.String)
    .build())

let output = builder.build()

print("You should have output \(output)")

Geographic location √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù You can choose countries, cities and regions of interest, which means you receive all of the jobs that meet criteria you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve specified.

How to use LinkedIn jobs for SEO (10+ tricks)
How to use LinkedIn to get your job
So how do you use LinkedIn to get your dream job? There are lots of reasons why someone would make a job change. Perhaps you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re bored. Maybe you need a more challenging position. Or you want to leave your current employer.
Or you might just need a pay rise or more freedom. All reasons valid reasons to seek out a new job. Here√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s how to use LinkedIn to get your dream job:
Create a profile that showcases your strengths √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù Use your profile to show how good you are at what you do. Do not be afraid to use headshots of yourself, links to work you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve done and links to products and services you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve helped build. Show you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re passionate about your work.
Network with likeminded people √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù You can network by reaching out to industry experts and people similar to you in the same field you want to be in.
Use LinkedIn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Recruiter Service to find new job opportunities √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù LinkedIn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Recruiter Service (which costs a fee) allows you to see new jobs the moment they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re posted on LinkedIn. If you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re currently an employee at a company, recruiters regularly use the Recruiter Service for this purpose.
Use the search function on LinkedIn to find the latest jobs in your target company √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù You can narrow down to a specific job title, salary, industry and more using the search features in LinkedIn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s job listings.
Use LinkedIn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Inmail feature to reach out to potential employers or recruiters for a new job offer √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù All you need do is add their profile link to your Inmail. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s free to use LinkedIn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s Inmail service.

instruction:
You will be asked to answer the following question as part of the LinkedIn Skill assessments.

You find that your project has a tag and branch both named push-notifications, which causes confusion when trying to print out given reference. How can you specify which branch you want to look at?
output:
You will be asked to answer the following question as part of the LinkedIn Skill assessments.

You find that your project has a tag and branch both named push-notifications, which causes confusion when trying to print out given reference. How can you specify which branch you want to look at?

A. git log --notify-branch=push-notifications

B. git log --notify-tag=push-notifications

C. git log --branch=push-notifications

D. git log --tag=push-notifications

## A. git log --notify-branch=push-notifications

**A:** This option would look at the tag, or branch, associated with the branch or tag you're querying. In this case, you're looking for the branch named push-notifications.

## B. git log --notify-tag=push-notifications

**B:** This option would look for reference that matches the tag and branch push-notifications. The options for this command accept either a tag or branch name from the git config file.

## C. git log --branch=push-notifications

**C:** This option queries the branch list, but only for a given branch. The branch parameter has no special notation options.

## D. git log --tag=push-notifications

**D:** The correct answer is C because the git command for this question would show you the list of tags or branches you have configured on your repository. The option for tag has special notation options.

### 2.2.5.7. git diff and merge

The git diff command will generate a diff file that shows how two different commits could differ in terms of what is actually saved to the repository.

It is handy for comparing a given branch with a commit, or vice versa, to check on changes. You can ask git to show only the differences between the current file and the previous commit, and even limit the amount of information produced. Here are a few of the more common git diff commands you want to know.

**git diff**

git diff prints a diff between the working directory and the index, and the index and the working directory. By default, it will show the results in a two-column format. It will list out each line and its status, based on whether the line appears in the working directory but not in the index, in the index but not the working directory, or in both directories.

It will also display unmodified lines with a **M**. If you ask git to display just the patch (default is **M** ), it will give you a list of files that it thinks could be fixed with a git diff --patch .

To give you an example of this command in action, try the following:

    **$ git diff master develop**

This command will show what has changed between the master branch and develop. You might see something like this:

    **$ git diff master develop**
    diff --git a/index.php b/index.php
    index d38d44c..53e4082 100644
    --- a/index.php
    +++ b/index.php
    @@ -1 +1 @@
    -echo "this will be deleted.. but is not";
    +echo "this will be deleted.. but is not";
    -echo "only the changes";
    -echo "in this file";
    +echo "only the changes";
    +echo "in this file";
    diff --git a/index2.php b/index2.php
    index b3b008e..0719be0 100644
    --- a/index2.php
    +++ b/index2.php
    @@ -1 +1 @@
    -echo "this will be deleted.. but is not";
    +echo "this will be deleted.. but is not";
    -echo "only the changes";
    -echo "in this file";
    +echo "only the changes";
    +echo "in this file";

What this is telling you is that there has been a deletion that would have affected the actual code written in index.php as well as an addition that has been made to index2.php.

You can also specify two patches to be applied to a diff, like so:

    **$ git diff master develop

## HOW TO USE AMAZON

Amazon offers online shopping, a marketplace product, book stores, streaming video, and a selection of its own consumer tech products to customers. It also offers cloud storage in the form of Amazon Drive, and various music, movie, and television options. Amazon also provides Amazon Prime, a fee-paying service that offers free shipping on many orders, and Amazon Prime Music.

Amazon was founded in 1994 by Jeff Bezos and was first named Cadabra, but was changed shortly to Amazon, a name referencing a river in Greece. Initially selling books, the company grew to include music and movie rentals, Kindle e-reader, a streaming video service, and its own original program, Amazon TV. Its headquarters are in Seattle, Washington, and it serves customers in 190 countries, in English, German, French, Japanese, Italian, and Spanish. Its primary website is available in more than 20 languages.

Amazon.com offers free, one-day shipping on thousands of items, same-day deliveries in the US and some other locations, and two-hour deliveries in some cities. It also provides services such as Alexa, which allows users to do tasks on their Amazon devices such as setting timers, playing a song, or asking a question. You can even order food from a restaurant and get the food delivered to the door. Many Amazon purchases are eligible.

Amazon.com stores are in many cities. An Amazon Prime membership allows members to enjoy more benefits, such as free or cheap two-day shipping for members and free shipping on all grocery orders over $35. Amazon also offers Prime membership deals.

The Amazon Store offers buyers a list of items to choose from. A search box allows you to search for products. To order items that cost less than $30, you can use the Prime Now service.

Tiny Toon Adventures (199094)

A British adult science fiction series which takes place in Cardiff, Wales, and in the city's suburbie known as Penarth. The series revolves around a fictional government agency called Torchwood and its missions, as well as the personal affairs of the main characters, many with supernatural powers and abilities.

Time Bandits (1981)

A satirical drama which takes place in the times of the French Revolution. The series focuses on the adventure and exploits when six little adventurers from another dimension use a dimensional time tunnel to visit other eras and worlds in the universe.

Treasure Planet (2002)

An adaptation of an adventure novel of the same title and set many years in the future. The series revolves around an inter-galactic space adventure on a spaceship with many characters in different eras from many worlds.

Titans (2018)

This CW show centers around the characters from Teen Titans, and tells the story of what happens after that. It features the main characters Robin, Raven, Beast Boy, Starfire, and Beast Boy's new friend Raven. # _Chapter 5_

# The Art of Getting More Out of Words

* * *

## [Using Wordplay to Your Advantage](getting-more-04.html#chap-5)

* * * 

Let's say you have a job interview coming up soon, and one of the questions on your list is, "How do you think your past experiences will help you in this position?" The standard way to respond is something like "I have done all kinds of things in marketing, so I think if I were to get this job I would be able to excel at my own way of doing things, which would be great for the company."

That's okay, but it's not particularly memorable. There are better ways to tell a good story. Suppose you were to think of your previous advertising experience as part of a larger project: the advertising campaign for your own business. How would that help you in a sales position?

You could say in that case that when you made sales calls for yourself or worked events, you learned to think creatively about your clients' business needs. You also learned how to listen well and be sensitive to others' feelings. How has that translated to your work as a salesperson?

If you want to talk about your work experience in detail, there are many ways to make it more interesting than simply describing what you did, how much progress you've made, and so on. The key is to tell a story or make a point, instead of just talking about what you did. Here are some useful tips for using stories:

  *   **Ask questions.** If you want your responses to draw the most out of your interviewer, don't just give answers. Ask open-ended questions that encourage a conversation. Why? Because an interview is two-way business! At least, to some degree, it should be.

For example, if one of your interviewer's questions is "Talk to me about your experience as a salesperson." (This is a nice example of a "descriptive" question with an invitation to "give me an example of..." after it.)

Instead of saying "I've done a lot of sales and marketing, and I'd love to tell you about it," talk the interview back. Ask, "When we were talking earlier, you mentioned you're looking for a sales team member whose job is doing cold-calling and generating leads for our product. Do you have any ideas for what kind of personality would be right for this kind of work?"

You are offering an answer to the interviewer's question while asking for input on _his_ answer, which is a wonderful way to get the interviewer talking and more likely to lead to a positive result.

  *   **Make a point.** Once you've talked about yourself, make a statement and build on it. A statement should leave the interviewer with a question in mind. If the interviewer asks about it, then you'll get the chance to continue talking about this. You can also frame a comment with an example or anecdote, as in the example above.

For example, if I say to the interviewer "My work ethic is great, and as you know from today's interview, I'm very self-motivated, which often means I do work late, even over the weekends." (My statement is "I'm a hard worker," I've just made a point and will probably be asked to expand further on the discussion.)

Then I follow up with, "What do you think about my work ethic?" This builds on the idea brought forward in the statement and provides the opportunity to continue talking about my work ethic.

If the interviewer has an opinion, I get to hear it. If he's hesitant, I get to hear that, too. If he has nothing to say and isn't feeling comfortable to say anything about me, the end of the interview may be near. I can ask if I've addressed the issue he's interested in. This gives me a chance to say something else and leave the interview on a positive tone.

## Ways to Build Memorable Stories that Show Off Your Strengths

* * *

Here's how you might use your skills to make a stronger statement.

First, think about the strengths of those qualities that have developed naturally in you. Then think about them as a set of skills that someone might want to have.

Manifest.mcf :

      128.39 MB   Manifest.mcf 0 1 11 0 00:03:10 1

The Manifest.mcf file stores all the information about the class (or, in our case, about the genre) and the attributes that the class can have. The first line contains the description about the class, the second the definition, and the third line contains all the values (from 11 to N + 1) for the attribute.

When you open the file in a text editor, you'll see that the values in the file are different each time, because each time GUS requires a new Manifest.mcf file. In this file, you'll find all the data for each class you define for the next movie you want to analyze.

I've changed this file and I will tell you how in the next few minutes.

### Instructing GUS to Analyze the Movie with Genre

The first thing you need to do is to specify all the movies you want to analyze with GUS. The first column of the file contains the movie ID. You can either use the ID provided by IMDb or you can give a new one. The second column is the name of the movie you want to analyze. Finally, in the third column I've indicated the country of production for each movie.

I suggest that you use the information already available in IMDb when you write the file. Just remember to indicate each movie ID in all the columns and in the other columns include the movie name in the third column and the two-letter country that refers to the country of production in the fourth column.

### Instructing GUS to Analyze the Movies With Genre in the Movies.txt File

To instruct GUS to get the information about the genre from the movies.txt file you have to create a new manifest file (Manifest2.mcf) in the manifest directory. As I will show you in the next sections, GUS uses the genre information from the movies.txt file to analyze movies in the movies folder. To get the genre information, GUS needs to know how many movies are stored in the folder and which genre they fall into.

The manifest file contains the same data, and I'll show you how to create it so that you can start analyzing the first episode you'd like to analyze.

Figure 3-7.

Movies Analysis  Manifest File  Folders

The first thing you need to do is create a new file titled Movies.  txt. Remember that GUS will ask for the path of the file where you want to store the text file.

##### The Movies.txt File to Manage Movies

Now that you have the movies folder with 12 movies in all, you can get their information and manage how they are organized during the analysis.

There is a command that allows you to extract the file names for all the movies you have in the given movies folder: type get filename.

When you open this new file in Windows Notepad, you can see that you have 12 names for the movies, as shown in Figure 3-8.

Figure 3-8.

12 movies with their names in the Movies.txt file in Notepad

The next thing to do is to organize the movies in a way that's easy to understand. To do this, you can type some keywords in the same file to group the movies as a family and their sub-series as a subfamily, or you can create another file titled Family Movies. To start, create a new file.

You need to create the first file because the next step requires you to analyze the first movie from the movies.txt file. This task is done in the next section of this chapter.

##### Creating a Family of Movies

First, I'll create the family, which will be used to group the 12 movies together. This step is the first step in the analysis. The data will be used by GUS to identify the subcategories. After that, it will be easier to create the subcategories. The next step is to create a group for the family and then create the sub-family because the family must be created in advance. instruction: Make a list of the most popular podcasts.
output:
Make a list of the most popular podcasts. Now think about who you already know who have been or are going through something similar to your topic. How can you connect with them? Ask them to come on your podcast and talk about their experiences.
If youve been invited to speak at a conference (or plan to be), think about who else on that same topic will be there. Who do you want to meet? What conference might they be speaking at? Ask if theyd be willing to be on your show as well.
Find out what conferences your industry has. Find out how you would get invited. Who are the organizers and who is speaking? Think about how you can connect with them.
Find those conferences on the web.
Read and comment on all your favorite blogs.
Follow and comment on your Facebook and Twitter friends (make friends).
Find those who have posted blogs or articles in places where others will find them. Comment on their content.
Comment on your Instagram, Pinterest and Facebook (find like-minded people).
Be that other person who replies first (and helps others find great content).
Join and participate in your local (and global) Facebook groups.
Invite people you know to join you.
Do a search for any topic/person/keyword that relates to what you are passionate about. Then follow the links and see if you can find any more groups or Facebook pages to add to your list.
Go to that group or page and start commenting. Comment on other members posts. Participate.
Keep looking for groups by using social media to search on Twitter, Facebook and Google+. Youll get suggestions (and then you just have to pick the best).
Go to LinkedIn, Facebook or Twitter and start following people from your niche. Find out what they are interested in and find ways to connect with them further.
Once you start following people, they will likely start following you (and then they are likely to get you on their podcast as a guest).
Join a free Facebook group of yours that connects with your niche. Post a question or just ask if you can join. If you are asked to leave due to not providing good or relevant answers, then you have a problem that you need to fix: How can you help others? How can you add value (instead of asking for it)?
Once you join, comment on posts, ask questions and give advice. Do the same with other Facebook groups as well. Get out there, help others, and help yourself. If theres a problem you are solving, then you need to get out there to help (and be asked for help).
Once you are invited on others podcasts, then connect with those podcasts (and the hosts) and ask them how you can help make their podcast better. Then invite them onto yours.
Look for organizations in your community that focus on your niche. Offer a free consultation (a 30 minute demo and then a 30 minute follow-up).
If you want to get invited, then come help them.
If you are invited to become involved, then offer up services to them.
Volunteer yourself or your company to help out.
Find ways to connect with others in your community and offer to get some referrals for their businesses. Even if they dont buy from you at that time, at least they know that you care.
Remember that every time someone offers you a referral, its a vote of confidence in your expertise.
As you begin your journey, think of yourself as a person to be found. Use your time and talents to help others find youand then connect!
I loved #5  use Twitter to find people! What an amazing way to do so! Thank you so much for your sharing this information.
Absolutely. Ive never thought of it that way, but Twitter (and Facebook) is a very good way to search groups.

instruction:
You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output:
You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?

A: First of all, I would like to ask you if you can solve the issue on your own before you take this step. There could be many reasons for this.
First of all, are you doing anything that could be construed as ruining your trip or having any real bad habits that would be ruining your trip by yourself?


*

*Do you have a bad attitude while traveling?

*Do you have bad habits while traveling (smoking, eating garbage food, lying, stealing, etc.)?

*Are you bringing all this negative energy to the trip?


Could the issue be with you?
I would like to point out that if there is something you really want from me, you won't need to say anything at all, because I don't need to ask and I believe you could tell just by looking at me and just by having a little bit more presence.
I would think the most important thing to do here is, after you have established that this issue is really with your friend and not with you, is be honest.
In addition, it seems like you feel like you are getting a lot of negative attention so what you need to do is to communicate with this person in an honest and open way.
It is very important to establish a good relationship with this individual because you want to build trust with him/her.
You should try to help your friend communicate his/her feelings. 
Try to make the conversation more focused and less about the issue/topic of tension.
Have a positive mindset as well, don't dwell on negative feelings towards your friend.
If your friend is a very negative person and constantly bringing down the mood, how to approach this individual?


*

*Try to find out what this person's motivations are for being negative/negative energy. If this person is depressed, have a conversation with him/her on how they can see past their issue

*The conversation shouldn't only focus on the negative energy though, you could also have conversations about other things that are positive that you both enjoy


If this isn't working and the person just doesn't want to talk about anything positive or is just being negative, how would you go on alone?

A: In the case where you are getting negative vibes from someone, I would suggest: 
Step 1: Take a deep breath in and exhale slowly. Do this in your own time until you feel comfortable. 
Step 2: Imagine yourself going to a safe place in your mind like your childhood home and having a conversation with a beloved person in your life. Be specific, like Grandma or Uncle or best friend. 
Step 3: Tell them that you want to get away and that you need some time to yourself. Remind them that your being a good friend and telling them the truth, which they will understand if that is who they are. 
Step 4: Start to formulate your plan for going away (you might need to do this on your own). 
Step 5: Go back to your safe place in your mind and thank them for listening and understanding. 
Step 6: Follow up with an apology for causing them some discomfort that they had to accept. 
Step 7: Now you can go out into the world having worked through this problem and feeling more confident moving forward. 
In the case where you are feeling like you are ruining someone's trip, I would suggest: 
Step

You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.

Ten European football teams ‚Äì the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales ‚Äì will participate in a season-long ‚ÄúOneLove‚Äù campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.
output:
You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.

Ten European football teams ‚Äì the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales ‚Äì will participate in a season-long ‚ÄúOneLove‚Äù campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination. At matches these countries play between them, they will all wear an ‚ÄúEqual Love‚Äù armband with the message ‚ÄúOne Love‚Äù written on it in different languages. But which team will wear it?

An African-American man was shot dead by police on June 2, 2020, in Atlanta, Georgia, triggering widespread criticism and protest. The circumstances remain unclear and are currently the subject of a police investigation. At one of the demonstrations, an African-American woman told the media that she had tried to stop the officer who shot her young nephew, only to be arrested.

In response to the incident, Georgia Governor Brian Kemp signed into law the ‚ÄúAnti-Anarchist Law,‚Äù which prohibits protests that disrupt ‚Äúbusiness and transportation, cause damage, or obstructs officers from performing their duties.‚Äù On July 31, 2020, officers were met by anti-government protestors when they arrived to service a warrant at an apartment housing African Americans and the media, who had been told that it was a residence for the homeless. When asked to wait outside until the warrant was executed, the officers were attacked by protesters with bottles and rocks, and were forced to use pepper spray and stun guns in self-defense. A confrontation ensued between the police and the media, which then escalated with the arrival of additional officers. Two officers were shot during the melee. One, Christopher Allen, a five-year veteran who had been on the police force for only two days, was killed. The other, 27-year-old Aaron Ray Smith, suffered injuries to his arm and back and survived. The protesters were subsequently captured in photos brandishing weapons and taunting the police, which later went viral.

An American soldier is captured by enemy fighters in a hostile country. For the next seven years he lives in a cave and learns their language, customs, and their way of life. After seven years of preparation, his goal is completed. He leaves the cave as the enemy's champion.

A female student of your university comes home complaining that she was the victim of a sexual assault in a male dormitory.

A wealthy man who had been suffering from a serious illness for more than 20 years finally has his last wishes fulfilled. He wills his entire fortune to the people of his village, where his father was born and raised, but which had lost its prosperity, and now suffers from severe poverty.

‚ÄúOne More‚Äù is a story you can write. The story has five parts:

  Part A: the background, the setting, the main characters, and the situation
  Part B: the opening, the first step towards the main character‚Äôs goal
  Part C: a break within/after the main character develops new information about the situation
  Part D: some new development in Part B
  Part E: the final step towards the main character‚Äôs goal

‚ÄúOne More‚Äù is an 8-minute story that must contain at least one of the following:

  Emotion
  Dramatic or action ending (you can choose any dramatic ending)
  Mystery ending (the reader doesn‚Äôt know if the main character succeeds or fails; e.g., you can make your reader think the main character fails to achieve what he (she) wanted and thus the story ends in a bittersweet way if the ‚Äúclimax‚Äù ends with a ‚Äúnot-quite-happy‚Äù outcome)
  Funny ending (the reader could not stop laughing!)
  Harsh ending (the main character is defeated and his (her) life is ruined, the story ends in tragedy)
  Drama

Write ‚ÄúOne More‚Äù as if you were telling a story in a single stream of consciousness. Be honest and real, and try not to think ‚Äúnarratively correct.‚Äù

Use the Story-Card template (attached in MS Word format) to write the scenario of ‚ÄúOne More‚Äù in an A4 page.

Topic: scaling law + machine learning
output:
Please suggest a few papers to consider based on the search term given. The names of the papers should be listed.

Topic: scaling law + machine learning + prediction

The two papers:

1. Tukan, A., <NAME>, and <NAME>. 2016. "On the Limits of Prediction in Large Complex Networks." *Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America. *(in press, in the meantime you can download preprint from the arXiv: **arXiv:1508.07853**.)

 2. <NAME>. and <NAME>. 2006. "Estimation of the Exact Scaling Limit of Complex Networks." *Nonlinearity 19:3313-3350.*

The third paper:

3. <NAME> and <NAME>. 2014. "The Influence of Network Structure on the Performance of Predictors of Large Networks: The Effect of Sparsity." *Journal of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment* (12):P1-P15.*

[End of search term suggestion](URL

You can have a look at [SysMO](URL website if you are interested.

## New papers (in addition)

### TF-IDF for Network Analysis

1. In our paper we used TF(Term-Frequency) and ID(Inverse Document Frequency) for term weighting in topic modelling. However, there may be other ways to weight the terms when you use TF-IDF. Which other ways do you suggest, and are all of them appropriate for this question of mine?

2. From their paper, do you suggest that I use TF or TF-IDF for my topic model?

3. What is exactly the term weighting for topic modelling here?

For the question #3

**Question** 

How to explain the concept (and difference) of TF and TF-IDF for topic modelling to a non-computer-scicnce student?

**Answer** for Q1 and Q2 (2 suggestions based on what I've read in the book "Machine Learning: An Algorithmic Perspective")

*For the term "term" in topic modelling, it is a word in our dataset. For the term "TF", it means the number of times that the term appears in the corpus. This word 'term' can be a word or a phrase.*

*For the term "IDF" in topic modelling, it is a number between 0 and 1. It means the logarithm of the number of documents containing the term as inverse of the number of documents containing the term.*

*For the term "TF-IDF", it is a number between 0 and 1. It means the product of TF and IDF.*

*When we use those terms, we will need a corpus. A corpus means a collection of documents with word-level data.*

*When we use TF-IDF, how should we choose the term? Should we choose the term used for TF and IDF? or is there a better way to choose terms (not to use IDF)?*

*For example, we have 10,000 docs in the corpus. If we want to use TF-IDF, will we have to calculate TF-IDF for each document, so that each document will have TF/IDF pair? or can we calculate TF once, IDF once, and TF-IDF just once?*

*It seems that I can use tf-idf directly in my model to weight the terms. So, is that it? Is there a better way to do it?*

*Why do we need TF/IDF before we use it in our model?*

### Time Complexity Analysis

1. You said that there is $O(n^4)$. Then what does it stand for? Why did you choose this term?
How many ways can you write $O(n^4)$, and then show the differences on your diagram?

2. What exactly do you have in mind when you say "we can show the relationship between $n^4$ and $n^2$"?
Can someone give a hint (or show some examples) to help me understand it better?

3. What does it mean when you say that $O(n^3/n)$ is "a better upper bound"?
Does it mean that lower bound is better or upper

the email signature template for [Kathy Fawkes](mailto:kathy.fawkes@company.net) to prepare his own copy.

Good day,

I'm sending this email to make sure you're okay because I see that you're on

expect to return Monday, the 14th. [I will return after my vacation]{:.link}.
Don't answer this email, and call only in an emergency.

Warm regards,

Kathleen Fawkes
Computer Science Department
The University of North Dakota
Grand Targhee Park, Teton Valley, Idaho 83467

**Phone:** (844) 855-6789

<tiff:text-flow xmlns:tiff="URL"/>
```

The email signature template should include a blank line so that the signature
name, address, and other information are displayed on a separate line below the
content.

instruction:
React properly to reviews from your customers. In your responses, you can highlight your business' policies and customer service.

Another repeat visit and no disappointment from us. Great place for breakfast or brunch - and you won't need to eat again for awhile. The restaurant is close to the Tenderloin so be aware of your surroundings.
We enjoyed the Succotash Omelet (at least my wife enjoyed it), the Pulled Pork Benedict and the Hangtown Fry. Portions are large and pricing is fair. I wish we could have managed a Beignet Flight!
Definitely a spot to seek out. It can be crowed at times so be patient. Well worth any wait.
output:
React properly to reviews from your customers. In your responses, you can highlight your business' policies and customer service.

Another repeat visit and no disappointment from us. Great place for breakfast or brunch - and you won't need to eat again for awhile. The restaurant is close to the Tenderloin so be aware of your surroundings.
We enjoyed the Succotash Omelet (at least my wife enjoyed it), the Pulled Pork Benedict and the Hangtown Fry. Portions are large and pricing is fair. I wish we could have managed a Beignet Flight!
Definitely a spot to seek out. It can be crowed at times so be patient. Well worth any wait. Be sure to hit the restroom on your way out - it was quite charming.

### 707 Mission

The 707 Mission [http://707mission.com](http://707mission.com) has been part of the Mission Street culinary scene since 1978. The restaurant is both modern and retro, with a sleek ambiance and classic decor. This is a popular spot to stop for drinks while shopping and people-watching.

If you are looking for a different kind of dining experience, 707 Mission can help. 707 Mission features a retro theme that includes old-time radios, posters and TVs playing vintage television shows and movies. Guests are invited to experience history while enjoying modern cuisine.

The menu at 707 Mission includes food from around the world. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner are served daily, as are cocktails, beers, and wine. 707 Mission features all 707 dishes that were invented in the 1960s, including the chocolate malt, chili dogs, steak burgers, and apple pie. The restaurant also serves up classic seafood dishes, including grilled halibut served on a bed of prawns, clams, and shrimp.

instruction:

- news: Applications for summer internships are open now
- Start with a thematic tie-in to Halloween
output:
We need to write a thematic tweet to share company news and facts. Please take a careful look at the facts and details provided and create a tweet based on them.

- news: Applications for summer internships are open now
- Start with a thematic tie-in to Halloween, such as witches, ghosts, or monsters
- Write a tweet that includes the words, "I would love to work here" and links to the full page on our page linked from our GitHub repository

## Twitter Handle

- [@RogueHunter]
- URL
- @Roguehunter

## Writing Style

- This needs to be in an all caps Twitter style.
- Keep it short, snappy, & to-the-point, but still keep the reader engaged with your style.
- Use emojis when possible.
- Write with energy.
- Use a different Twitter name to make it clear that you're not your regular self & using this social network for business.
- You don't have to tell the whole truth, but you can and should be honest: you're hiring for a summer-intern position, so you can admit to that when you want to.

## Examples

- The world thinks we're dead and buried, but we're fighting for our lives! @roguehunter wants you to be part of this team to save us.
- We're looking for a summer intern to work with us at @Roguehunter. Apply now for a fun and interesting job!
- We're looking for a team player for some summer intern work at @roguehunter :-)
- Our new website now has an "Apply to Work With Us" button with all of our info included. Be sure to take a look when you have a moment! :-)

## Feedback

- This is a social media posting on twitter, so it should be a little snappy and snappy or light-hearted.
- Don't make it sound like a job or a commercial. You're just trying to establish a relationship and interest that readers have in your product.
- You are telling people information about how they can get started with your internship application. Make it clear and do-able and don't use 1000 words per message.
- Use hashtags if that helps people find you.
- Use Twitter emojis to give it a little more zing.
- There's a place on this writing page for your feedback. Please let us know what you feel works and what doesn't work.

## Tips

- We'll go over this when you present it to us, but in general, I would consider doing a "snack-sized" presentation, where you show us your written message, then read it to us, and explain why you wrote it that way, who you're targeting, and what words & phrases you think would work or not work for the audience.
- This will help us get to know you. We're also getting to see your thoughts and ideas. It makes a big difference.
- You can try to create a mood to grab attention.
- You can use hashtags a little here and there to let people know that this is a topic that you're talking about.
- Think of your audience & who you're targeting and choose your words accordingly.
- It sounds like you have a great idea here & that you've researched it.

### Sources

- [How does company branding play a role when using social media (twitter) campaigns](URL

## Key Takeaways

- Learn about the different ways to brand and market your business

- Build a team or do some research to find out exactly what your company wants to say about its products

- Focus on creating company awareness through sharing your company's brand story

- Share the big things and even the little things about your company brand

- Think about the questions that you want people to ask

- Look at the big players, such as Twitter & Facebook, and consider the power they have over your target audience.

- Think about how you want them to interact with you and your business

- Keep the language informal

- Follow some of the successful tweets from your competitors

# Day 3: How To

## Content You‚Äôve Created for Customers

### How Much

- You should have a great amount of content created before any social media outreach starts. You need to have videos / graphics / images, etc that you can use on different social platforms.
- I would say if you do not have much content by the middle of the month, then you should be creating more and then sharing that more on social platforms, especially ones like Facebook.
- A good amount to share on each

Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
