Daily tasks in the pharmacy
output:
Write a to-do list based on the given information.

Daily tasks in the pharmacy should be organized prior to the first day of work. Since there are several tasks to do, you can use the order of priority to decide which tasks are necessary first.

First, you should write down your working hours and your day off.

Example: Tasks
-------------
Write two or three to-do items based on the information you have about the tasks you have to finish.

Write your list as a table:

Task | Required | Priority | Result | Date | Deadline | Assigned to
------|----------|----------|--------|------|-----------|------------

### Example

In the example below, it is clearly stated which tasks are on the highest priority.

The first task is to take a pharmacy exam at 8 a.m.
Second task is to get ready for the exam.
Third task is to get the most important medical equipment for the pharmacy and bring it with you.
Fourth task is to clean the whole pharmacy and leave a message on the door about the current opening time.
Fifth task is to buy medication for the pharmacy and arrange it on the shelves.

Last task is to do a final check of pharmacy and leave the pharmacy for the day.

```
Writing a to-do list based on the following information.
Name: John

Vacation days: 4 days

Tasks
A. Arrange shelves

F. Make a note to keep the medications in cold storage

Tasks in order of priority should be:
A  B  C  D  F

To-do lists should be written in the table form.
```
#### Example 2
```

6. Make a note to keep the medications in cold storage

Tasks in order of priority will be:
5  3  A  2  1  4
Priority 5 - Check conditions of the medicines
Priority 3 - Clean and polish the countertop
Priority 2 - Check shelf inventory
Priority 1 - Arrange shelves
Priority 4 - Pickup the medications to make note to keep the medicines in cold storage

To-do list are written out in the table form.
```
#### Example 3
```
You are an intern at the pharmacy. As you know, you get paid 10 US$ per hour.
You have to do your work according to the above time table.
You have 20 hours to prepare for work, 6 hours of work, and 30 minutes to get ready for the next day.

The following tasks are to be done at:
1. 9.15 to set-up and organize
2. 9.45 to 10.00 to set-up the drugs
3. 10.15 to 11.15 to work on the medicine shelves
3. 11.40 to take a half-hour break, rest and plan the remainder of the shifts
4. 11.40 to lunch break at 13:00 and have 2 hours to relax before returning to work for an additional 17.30-27:30 shift.
5. 8:05 - Check the medications and record their conditions in the drug records

Tasks in order of priority will be:
3  1  5  2  4
Priority 3 - Set up drug shelves
Priority 1 - Set up pharmacy
Priority 5 - Check medication conditions
Priority 2 - Prepare work area
Priority 4 - Rest

instruction: Plan an agenda for the daily standup meetings. Assign a time duration to each topic on the agenda.
output:
Plan an agenda for the daily standup meetings. Assign a time duration to each topic on the agenda. For example, you would not want to spend a day just discussing the issues in a company, but you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢d use an hour or so to go over the problems and opportunities arising.
Set up a timer so your team knows when their time is up when they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re talking.
Use this schedule to plan todays meeting.
Make sure that everyone in the meeting knows what they have to do after the meetings. Have a brief √¢‚Ç¨≈ìfollow-up√¢‚Ç¨ to the √¢‚Ç¨≈ìthis is your follow-up agenda√¢‚Ç¨ part of every meeting. Explain the process for solving any issues which might occur at the next meeting.
You won√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t know what you have to remember from your meetings until you have a few of them under your belt, so try to be as thorough as possible in the first few meetings. That√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s the real purpose of the meeting: to gather up all the information, organize it, plan it, and remember it for the next week.
Your first few standups and meetings will be the most difficult. It will be hard for everyone to get used to being on time, answering the questions, discussing their work, and taking notes. This is especially true for those who have not attended standups before, or who haven√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t been part of any meetings in a while. Be patient and kind with your team. The more you give and the less you ask, the more they√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll want to be there and do their best.
It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s very important to get your team in the habit of standing up and sharing.
It will take everyone involved in your company a few meetings to get used to being at your meetings, answering questions, and finding their way through the structure you have built. This is normal and acceptable.
It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s always good to have an agenda for each meeting, but in your first few meetings, you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll probably use an √¢‚Ç¨≈ìas needed√¢‚Ç¨ agenda. If you have a problem on one day, you can address it at that day√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s meeting. If you have a big issue that your team needs to go over, you should do that at a meeting with your whole team.
Your first few meetings will be devoted mostly to getting your process down, and getting your team to respond to your meetings.
Your first few meetings should be more collaborative than the meetings you have now.
Do you currently manage by numbers? A lot of teams are √¢‚Ç¨≈ìmanaged√¢‚Ç¨ by tracking progress of their work in columns, each column is filled with a number. Those numbers, you can see, reflect the current workload in the company.
To give you a more granular overview of the actual work in your company, we have created a spreadsheet which allows you to track everything that your team has done in the past week. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s designed to give you a more in-depth look at exactly how busy you are, and how your team is working together to complete all the tasks you need to do.
The spreadsheet will enable you to track your goals and progress towards those goals.
It allows you to see and compare information for each of your tasks and deliverables.
To see this sheet, simply click on the image or link to the sheet below.
You can track your progress as far back as you want. To the right of the spreadsheet you can see a list of all the dates you have selected.
If you want to see the tasks for a date in the past, click on your date in the table, and then click on √¢‚Ç¨≈ìChange dates√¢‚Ç¨ on the red bar at the top of the table on the right.
Then click on the box next to the date you want to see tasks for, and then you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll be able to track the tasks you have completed and those you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re still doing.
If you want to see this information in a daily, rather than a weekly view, follow the same procedure, except that you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll be looking at things like √¢‚Ç¨≈ìtoday√¢‚Ç¨ or √¢‚Ç¨≈ìYesterday.√¢‚Ç¨ In the spreadsheet you would see a list of all the days in a particular time period (for example, one month, or yesterday), then you would click on the correct day to view the events for it, and you get a daily view of your work. Clicking that day would get you a view of all the tasks and work you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve done.
Now that you can track your team√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s deliverables in such detail, you will be able to ask your team to create more meaningful deliverables, using the information available in the spreadsheet. This way you can control what gets delivered, when, and who is responsible for completing it.
With this system in place, you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ll have a clear view into your work and into your team√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s work. This

### #6

The 7-Step French Pronunciation Formula

The key to perfect French pronunciation is to pronounce each syllable in every word clearly. Each syllable is a step on the way to mastering your perfect French pronunciation. Just like the first seven steps of a staircase, each step is one more than the previous one.

In a normal conversation, French speakers generally say no more than three syllables per word, so that 7-step formula will be perfect for all of your French pronunciation needs. If, for some reason, you need to say more than three syllables in a single word, just say it like you normally wouldand don't worry about this 7-step formula.

If you start with the right foundation, pronouncing three syllables is not difficult at all. If you use it consistently, you'll soon get used to speaking three syllables without even thinking about it.

And to make things easier, I have prepared a pronunciation chart for all of the words, phrases and sentences you'll find in the entire book so you can practice your new French pronunciation at any time.

In the next two sections, I will give you the steps to pronounce just five common French words:

> * "Hello"
> * "How are you"
> * "Thank you"
> * "You're welcome"
> * "Do you speak English"

And then I will teach you how to pronounce all of the words, phrases, and sentences found in the book.

pronounced _AYE_

### Step 4: o  
pronounced _OO_

_The shape of your mouth is exactly the same as when you say the word_ "too"

_You say_ "I'm really good at French" _if you want to say something like_  _"Je parle trs bien le franais."_

### Step 5: eh  
pronounced _EEH_

_You say_ "OK".

_You say_ "Not OK".

### Step 8: ay  
pronounced _AY_

_You say_ "Do you speak English" _to ask a question._

_You say_ "OK" _after a question is answered._

_You say_ "Not OK" _after you've been denied a question answer._

### Step 9: ih  
pronounced _EEH_

_You say_ "I'm really good at French" _after you're asked how you're doing._

### Step 10:  
pronounced _OH_

instruction:
Provide a cooking hack for improving the flavor of the given food.

popcorn
output:
Provide a cooking hack for improving the flavor of the given food.

popcorn is one of those foods that doesn't need any kind of seasoning to make it delicious, so why bother? But once you try popcorn flavored with a little butter, salt, and melted yellow mustard, you'll want to think of it as an everyday treat instead of a "something to do while watching a film". The trick is to make sure you melt the mustard first so it has the chance to completely saturate the butter and popcorn, so you get a little more mustard flavor to start with. This ensures that there's nothing sticking to the side of the pot, and instead, the buttery mustard flavor gets soaked up by every kernel of popcorn.

instruction:
Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies

You want to be able to feel each crunch and bite of the cookie when you take it from your bowl. A chewy cookie provides you with that crunch and bite and is perfect for any time you need a quick energy boost. It also packs a good dose of flavor. This recipe is simple and it is quick: no long boiling or kneading required. The ingredients are simple, and the steps are straight forward.

INGREDIENTS | YIELDS: ABOUT 30 COOKIES

1 cup water

3 sticks salted butter

1 cup brown sugar

1 medium banana, mashed

1 egg

3 cups oat flour

1 tablespoon baking powder

1 cup dark chocolate chips

PREPARATION:

To begin, in a pot, combine the water and butter and heat over low-medium heat until the butter has melted. With a candy thermometer, stir until the temperature reaches 240¬∞F. At this point, remove the pot with the butter mixture from the heat and set it aside to cool.

10 MINUTES LATER:

Meanwhile, mix brown sugar, banana, and egg in a bowl and set aside.

1 HOUR LATER:

Place the cooled butter and water mixture in a bowl or mixer, and add the oat flour, baking powder, and chocolate chips. Pour the brown sugar mixture into the bowl and mix completely.

Bake cookies for 17‚Äì20 minutes in the oven at 300¬∞F. Transfer them to a cooling tray.

How Do You Know If the Butter Has Melted?

A sugar thermometer is typically used to know when the sugar crystals have melted. The thermometer should be inserted into the boiling mixture; then, you should observe the color of the sugar when it reaches a certain temperature. For this recipe, you need a clear (not pink or red-colored) temperature of 240¬∞F.

Is the Sugar Crystal Red Now That It Is Melting?

If you see any color change in the boiling sugar, this means that the temperature is too low or that you have the wrong sugar thermometer with you.

What Can I Do If I Have A Low-Powered Stove?

The use of a sugar thermometer is essential. You can either purchase a small high-precision thermometer to match your stove, or you can purchase a device that matches with your stove and uses an infrared light to show you how hot the water or sugar mixture is.

# 4. How Does the Environment Affect Food?

The Environment's Impact on Food

We cannot live without oxygen, but a large number of bacteria and other organisms in the air are capable of causing major problems for us humans. These pollutants take many forms, and they come together in what is known as our indoor air quality.

A few organisms in the environment can be toxic, and some can cause serious illnesses that have to be carefully examined by a doctor. But how do we know which substances in nature are harmful to us, and which are not? Let's find out how scientists study these substances.

The Effects of Pollutants on People

The effect that every pollutant has on people depends on several factors, including:

  * The amount of pollutant in the air
  * The length of time of exposure to it
  * The age and physical health of the people being exposed

In addition, pollutants can affect everyone in different ways. For example, a substance that can cause a particular illness to you can cause a different illness to someone else. Therefore, it is essential that we understand the effects of these pollutants in order to prevent any problems.

Identifying the Pollutant

Pollutants are substances that have been removed from their natural sources and are now in the environment. They can enter the air from the following processes:

  * By burning fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and gas;
  * By the use of pesticides when farming, or by the disposal of waste;
  * Any time when we throw waste into a landfill, it mixes with the air; and
  * From industries that use toxic chemicals or products.

In addition, there are pollutants that enter the air as a result of natural processes, such as rain on a forest or by rocks reacting with the substances in the earth.

Identifying Pollutants

Pollutants can enter an atmosphere in several ways:

  * By the burning of fossil fuels, such as coal or oil.
  * By the burning of garbage and other waste products.

Think of a motivational quote that you have read in a book. Try to keep it positive and sweet. Read this quote at the beginning and at the end of all your tasks each day in order to keep yourself motivated.
Read something motivational and positive like this quote at the end of all your tasks and projects at the end of each day. This will motivate you and encourage you to keep going as you are progressing with your day and your tasks.
Now that you have read this quote make sure you apply this motivational quote to your life. Try and set small goals for yourself each day and try and accomplish them.
Read a motivational quote such as, "A dream without a plan is just a wish" today and write it on a piece of paper.
It is extremely important to read a motivational quote on a daily basis. Read something like this the next time you find yourself feeling discouraged and need motivational energy to keep going.
This quote will definitely get your mind off whatever you do not like and focus on something more positive, so that you can go about completing the next thing that you need to do. Once you read this motivational quote the next time you feel down, you will actually be able to get yourself over it much more easily. It is almost as if it is an old friend, it has been along for those times when you need it most.
Read a motivational quote while drinking your morning coffee. Try to do it right after you finish it.
Read a motivational quote while you wait for your coffee to brew, it may give you that extra push you need to get your day started.
Read a motivational quote after you finish your coffee. Try to do it during breakfast.
Once you read this quote try and have a positive attitude throughout the entire day.
Read this motivational quote while you are putting on your socks and then try and use this information for a motivational quote to give you motivation.
When you read this motivational quote you will find yourself getting more motivated at the same time. Try and read it over as many times as you need for it to really sink in.
This is a really great motivational quote that will make you feel so much better, more motivated and will help you to focus on the future.
After reading this motivational quote it may be really helpful to use this motivational quote to write on a piece of paper for yourself.
When you read this motivational quote you will probably feel very excited as you are about to take up a new job or assignment.
This is a motivational quote that would be great to have on your phone for when you need some extra motivation.
Read this motivational quote when you feel like you have had a long day. Try and read it again as many times as you need in order to help yourself feel better.
The next time you read this motivational quote it is going to be even more meaningful because you have actually worked towards your goal and accomplished something.

instruction:
Give a brief description of the book that you are given.

Matilda
output:
Give a brief description of the book that you are given.

Matilda: There's a prince in it called Prince Prince.

_Matilda is holding a copy of _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ by Wilfred Scawen Blunt _._ It's hard not to feel that she's giving up something as she puts it down. The fact is that _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ was written by the Anglo-Catholic nobleman and author Wilfred Scawen Blunt. Is there another Matilda-type around?

You get the impression that by doing so she was passing on all she knew about love. In fact, she is preparing to hand on the gift of her heart. Matilda is being given it by the two women in the novel who give her the gift of love.

_The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ is a passionate, passionate novel. As a child Matilda must have wanted to give that to someone. She had to keep quiet about it. As we shall see, that was her job.

The truth is that she has only discovered after the book has been published that she had in fact fallen in love years before she was even aware of what this was.

If Matilda had fallen in love in her twenties she might now be married to the two men she had two secret love affairs with in her twenties. But she didn't do anything about it. In her twenties she couldn't give herself full expression to her passions. As she says later, "I lived for you and you for others. You were my first love. I knew you would come into my life and I would leave mine. I was not ready for my destiny."

Now she is free. She has never been free in her life.

This is a woman who has been brought up to conceal her emotions. She has been trained and encouraged to be obedient rather than passionate.

It is this passion that she is expressing in the love she shares with another woman in _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ by Wilfred Scawen Blunt.

By the time I read _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ for the first time in the 1990s I felt like I was reading my life story.

When Matilda is finally at the age for love and freedom, she falls in love for the first time and goes off to Oxford university with her friend Beatrice.

Matilda is excited by the prospect of going to university where she will share love and books for the first time and she will get away from her mother.

Her mother is far more interested in her career than she is in what her daughter wants. Matilda says when she turns thirty her mother "flipped a switch and my life began to revolve around you." But her mother is only now beginning to realise that she was the one who had prevented Matilda from having this life.

Matilda is thrilled to be going to that great university with her first friend.

And then her mother's jealousy is revealed when the other woman in Matilda's life, Beatrice, whom she loves, turns out to be of a noble family at Oxford.

Matilda's mother's response is to encourage her daughter to turn down Oxford University because of this woman's money.

And so Matilda turns down Oxford University and goes to the "university".

While she is in this place, of course, she meets her first love, Rose, and the story of this love is the best-kept secret Matilda has ever had. We will discuss that later.

At the time of _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ Matilda has been in a double-secret relationship with a married woman called Rose for seven years. They are engaged but their affair is kept secret.

It has taken this long because Matilda has to be in the place to share in Rose's love with the world and her family. The love she has with Rose is for them but, at the same time, if she meets Prince Prince in Paris, she will leave them for him.

"I have a love for Rose that is incomparable," she tells her father when she first begins to see that she has fallen in love with Prince Prince (who has been called Prince Prince).

The truth is that Matilda and Rose have been very careful never to bring their relationship out into the open and Matilda has been careful not to tell anyone about it.

This book has already been published before we get to Oxford University. After _The Story of Tristan and Isolde_ was published in 1954, Matilda knew that by telling people about her true love they might think she was mad

instruction:
Indicate the genre of the book to which it belongs.

Love in the Time of Cholera
output:
Indicate the genre of the book to which it belongs.

Love in the Time of Cholera,

Herman Melville, Typee,

Henry James, New York and the Milky Way,

Eugene O'Neill, The God of My Father,

Joseph Conrad, The Mystery of the Blue Train,

Gustave Flaubert, Madame Bovary,

Joseph Conrad, Under Western Eyes,
This is a "one of" book. That is, it fits into its genre.

A book that belongs in this category is a work of literature of a specified genre, like a mystery novel or an historical novel.

We can also write: this is a "one of" book in its history of literature, meaning as a book that fits into its literary-cultural tradition or genre. This genre-based way of speaking can be quite complex, but we will get into it a bit later in this chapter.

For now we can imagine that you say,

This is a "one of" mystery novel.

The book is also a "one of" classic mystery novel. You can also distinguish these two, as they both fit into the category "classic English novel."

A second "one of" book genre would be, say, the genre-of-travel-narratives.

There is also a group of books that may call into question our very idea of what a book is: works of self-help, how-to books, and so on. These fall into the "one of" category.

One should also include the book about books, a genre that you can read about in, for example, The Making of Mark Twain, by Mark Perry.

Note that sometimes you will hear, "This is a book about books, a work of literary criticism," which is confusing. As we discussed in our overview of books, and especially in terms of literary quality, there are works of literary criticism, but that term refers only to the subject and not the type of book being discussed.

In the category of "one of" a book, you can also separate out works of literature that appear on the list of required reading or recommended reading on a given book's cover. As soon as one reads that, it becomes "one of" one's assigned book(s). I am not saying that all such books do not belong in literary tradition; they can, of course, very much, but the fact that they are required or recommended means they represent a significant part of your education.

So far we have looked at "one of" books, which belong to the literature of their time, in particular in a literary culture or tradition of that time. We need now to differentiate between "one of" and "a part of." Many of the books included in the category can have a literary tradition, but they do not belong to the traditions or genres that belong to "one of" literary works. Consider the following examples from the "best books ever" lists you should have received over the years. As you read, try to separate each book into "one of" vs. "a part of":

One of the most remarkable books ever written, perhaps the greatest story about friendship in the English language, a book that makes you smile and laugh and cry all at once, The Importance of Being Earnest is an absolute pleasure for both first-time and lifelong readers. Wilde's wit and the sharpness of his writing make this a brilliant comedy. But there is more to this classic English comedy of manners than just a delightful tale of mistaken identities and a romantic subplot. Wilde also writes one of the most important anti-sexual prejudices plays of all time, showing society's hypocritical rules of propriety that demand that homosexuals live in a "bachelor" way while heterosexuals live in the context of marriage and family.

To read this book as entertainment is to miss the great power of Wilde's wit; he uses humor like a weapon, using it as the main way to attack society's "unfair" rules and "loyalty" that only go one way. An important book for a first reading and for rereading, The Importance of Being Earnest reminds the reader that comedy, in particular, is one of the most powerful ways to expose the hypocrisies or injustices of an unjust society.

An important play for high school students needs to include this novel comedy (which is often the best of Wilde's work and was a huge success in its 1895 first run, only to be banned from the London stage because Wilde was now seen as politically radical and a homosexual). It is also not a "fairy-tale" comedy like The Merry Wives of Windsor or A Midsummer Night's Dream but a comedy that exposes the hypocris

Prove the given statement using your information.

"If x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4, then x>0 and x>12."
output:
Prove the given statement using your information.

"If x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4, then x>0 and x>12."

To begin, note that, in general, given a statement of the
form "If x is A, then y is B" the conclusion is: if A, then B.  As
an example, we would say that:

- If you have 10 or more hours in reserve in your schedule,
 then you can take the class that is 4 units.
- If you have 10 or more hours in reserve in your schedule,
 then you can take any class.

This means that 0 is not possible.  So, this statement is true.

Next, we notice:

- If x is a positive integer,
- If x+3>4,
- Then x is at least 3.

This means that if x < 4 then x is less than 3, so x can't be
greater or equal to 40.

So now that we've eliminated the number 40, are we sure that
x is a negative integer?  If it's a negative integer, then we're
done.

No!  Why?  Because

- If x+3>4,
- Then x > 0 and x>12.

So while we've proven that x can't
be greater than 40, we haven't established that x can't be
greater than 12.  The question is: If x is > 40, what is x?
This is tricky to answer because, if x is anything in the range
|x| > 40, we don't know which way x is pointing.  So, we can't
use x.x <= 40 as a good enough answer, it's not a complete
answer.  We've proven some of the information in this problem,
but we haven't answered all of the information.

Now, 40 is 7 units away from 0, so the smallest x that gets us
from 40 to 0 is x=-13.

So that means that, since

- If x+3>4,
- Then x > 0 and x>12.

we know that

- If x < 13,
- Then x is a negative integer and x>12.

When we say "If x < 13, then x is a negative integer and x>12,"
we mean that:

- If x < -12,
- Then x is a negative integer and x>12

or, since all x < -12 have x > 40:

- If x < -12,
- Then x>40 and x>12

or, since all x < -12 have x > 40:

- If x < -12,
- Then x is a negative integer and x>12

This means that, if you have x < -12, you are sure that x is
a negative integer and x > 12.

What's the value of x=40?  Well, when we say that x>40, we mean
that x is at least 40.  So, since this is true for all x > -16,
we can say that:

- If x > 40,
- Then x is at least 40.

Finally, that is, if x > -13, we can say that:

- If x > 40,
- Then x is at least 40.

Hooray for solved problems!

## Problem 7

Find the last word (24th word) in the paragraph of the following:

### The sentence

For over a hundred years the public schools have striven constantly to keep the public in ignorance and to make it think that to know anything is to get into trouble. It is only just now that the public has begun to rebel against this false teaching and begin to take back the culture given to them. From time immemorial when children were old enough to leave their parents, they were taken to a master (or mistress) from whom they received what is called an education. This did not mean that they became civilized. This meant simply that the master made it his career to train them to know how to earn a living. The purpose of education was the same at the time of Chaucer and the same today. Chaucer called his school an "academye," which means "a place where people are trained to be good craftsmen." He also calls them "scholegeyers," which is an odd word. We would think of a school as a place where you go to learn. But a scholegeyer is one who teaches you what are called "academies," or skills. He is not a person who teaches you what we call "school," the word that we use for education. His job is a craftsman's job. His job is to impart knowledge to the boys who will become apprentices.

This has not changed very much over the years. Most education up to the first World War was not education, it was crafts training and the result was a society which had no real culture. It was a society in which almost everybody had to do work that was not important, and the important people had no real knowledge of the world. You were taught to be an artisan and not to be an individual. You were trained to do the same as every other artisan and so to produce good work.

## Solution

The 24th word is "craft." Words are put in order from left to right, with "d" on top. The 16 words on the left in Table 1 are placed below the 7 words on the right when reading out loud.

Table 1

The 25th word is "important."

## Problem 8

Write out the English alphabet using letters from the letters in the word "cat."

## Solution

You can get 28 of the letters from the letters in the word cat. The letters after the first "t" are the first 5 of the letters in the word.

## Problem 9

There are many names and expressions which can be considered "words," such as "Sylvia Plath," "the Mafia," "the United Kingdom," and "Tiffany."

(a)

What is the minimum number of letters which must be used to make a word?

(b)

In the word "Mafia," what is the position of the vowels?

## Solution

(a)

A word may contain as many letters as you like.

(b)

The Mafia consists of a consonant followed by a few vowels, followed by another consonant.

## Problem 10

The letter sequence "a b c d e f g..." is called a 'permutation'. The word 'permutation' has 11 letters and does not have any of the letters "e, q, y." Given this fact, find the smallest number n for which a sequence of n letters that does not contain the letter 'e', can be formed by the permutation sequence "a b c d e f g...."

## Solution

In English the five vowels are i, e, a, o, u. A permutation has 11 letters so the other six must be consonants. The first letter must be an a. The next five (or six) letters can be any of the remaining six and so, must be any two of b (or p or f), c, d, g, or h. At least one of these letters must then come in a subsequent letter. The only alternative for the next six (or five) letters is m, n, or r. This leaves one slot

select * from football_games

As shown in the table above, "Jeter" and "Pujols" refer to Derek Jeter and Albert Pujols, "Rivera" refers to Mariano Rivera, "Ichiro" refers to Ichiro Suzuki and so on.

Career history 

A baseball player's career history is also called the player's "timeline" of accomplishments, "career arc" or "career". While a player's career can be viewed as a timeline of his statistics over time, a player's career history is more likely to refer to other developments, including but not limited to:

 Signing a contract
 Having his draft position
 The number of times he was sent down
 His "winning streak" or "losing streak" (these will appear on his "statistics" in the table)
 Team/League affiliations
 His "baseball card" and other memorabilia
 Winning and missing playoff series
 Signing free agent contracts
 Making the All-Star team
 Winning awards
 His "statistics" and "career overview"
 Breaking records and "retiring" record(s)
 His number of home runs, hits, stolen bases and various other statistics

Signing a contract 

A player's first "professional contract" is called a "development deal" and can be for the entire minor league year or for individual minor league camps (spring training). In addition, in professional baseball, players in the first or second year of their professional baseball career have "rookie" contract protection from free-agent contracts. As a result, some players enter professional baseball as highly-drafted amateurs with the expectation to gain control of a MLB team's draft pick if they are released, whereas other amateur players "sign" an entry-level contract for less money.

A professional contract is a "minor league" contract, even if the player has already made it to the MLB or "made it to the show". Professional players may have other types of contracts, such as the "prearbitration player under the rule 5 agreement." A player, such as Roger Clemens, who has reached arbitration eligibility, will either have a "team-friendly" arbitration contract, or be "on the trading block" to be bought out of his team's contract obligation.

Minor league contract 

The player's first contract is usually a "minor league" contract. A player under a "minor league" contract will start as a "rookie in the minor leagues," and will likely be paid a "starter's salary" with a limited "bonus structure." These contracts have incentives such as "statistics," "performance, and "promotion." As a result, the "players" on such contracts are treated to the MLB like minor leaguers.

For example, a team might have a "rookie contract" with the "outstanding" player, which can have a "no trade" clause. That will keep that player from being traded to another team unless he agrees to it.

Minor league players are paid according to their "status" in the minor leagues. For example, rookie/develop players earn the least salaries. If they receive more than "160,000 dollars" in bonuses, then they will have their professional contracts altered. A "minor league" contract can include "incentives" such as signing bonus, "statistics," "performance," and "promotion." These types of incentives have some "limitations" such as a "minimum "160 players" and "maximum 1" bonus.

Minor league contract rules 

The player's first professional contract will be "a minor league" contract, and will often be followed by a second "major league" contract. The player is "an amateur" until he signs a professional contract. The "MLB can make major league contract proposals" before he signs his first "minor league" contract, but that is not required.

A player's "developmental" professional contract will have "incentives," including "signing bonuses," "statistics," "performance," and "promotion." A player's professional contract will most likely include a "minimum of $160,000" in "signing" bonuses. An "MLB contract, " is a contract that

# 7

# 20 TIPS FOR TIPPING WHEELCHAIR SERVICES BY TARA TOMASHEWSKY

Wheelchairs offer freedom of motion for many people who cannot walk independently. However, people with disabilities need so much more than mobility. To them, wheelchairs are life-altering. When a person in a wheelchair needs services on the sidewalk, their needs are so many times greater than the needs of a non-disabled person. Because of their disability, they have unique needs, as well as challenges.

Here are twenty tips for tipping a wheelchair service by Tara Tomashewsky. Please feel free to share these tips with others, too, so that all of us do our part to include and encourage people who need it most.

# 20 TIPS FOR TIPPING WHEELCHAIR SERVICES

  1. Make eye contact with them.

  2. Call them by their name.

  3. Smile.

  4. Show that you are truly making eye contact.

  5. Offer help, if asked.

  6. Praise them for any personal accomplishments you can think of.

  7. Say thank you.

  8. Use words like "You're Welcome," "It was my pleasure," or "I'm here to help."

  9. Offer to help them return the favor.

  10. Look up and see them before you exit through the door.

  11. Go in person to your employer and tell them about the wheelchair service and ask if you can help, and get a referral.

  12. Ask for ideas about how you can help.

  13. Talk more than necessary about the person's wheelchair.

  14. Go beyond the "thank you"

## More about bots

+  Bots are software agents that perform automated tasks.  
+  When you are playing with a chat bot, you start an interaction.  
+  You give a message, and it responds.  
+ But it's not like that every time.
  - There was a time when chat bots were "intelligent", but those were gone.  
+  The term "bot" also refers to websites which mimic an interaction with a person, usually by responding with an almost human-like response.  
+  To understand bots, one also needs to understand **websites crawling and scraping**.  
+  For example, Google is a bot.
  - Google works by looking for pages. Google also works like a spider or a robot.
+  When you do a search, Google visits all the pages it thinks have the keywords you are looking for, in order to answer your questions.  
+  Sometimes your search will ask a lot of questions. Google will try to find the best answers for the questions and to put them in a logical order.  
+  Here is a common conversation:  
- What is 2+2?  
- 4.  
- How much is one pound?  
- How heavy is a car?  
- How much does a car cost?  
+  Google finds a website which has a good answer to all of these questions.  
+  It goes through all of them step by step, answering your questions.
+  Google also crawls and scrapes all kinds of non-human information.  
+  It looks for videos, images, and other information that might have some value to you, and collects it.
+  It also looks for websites that contain information relevant to other websites it has found.
  - The more information Google has, the better it can answer your questions.
  - So, if Google visited many websites, like the one you are looking at, it can find your information more easily.
  - Google also searches on all of your devices.
    + It will look for information on all computers and mobile devices, so that all search results are the same everywhere.  
    + This means that if you are on a mobile phone and look for the "Pok√©mon Go" app, Google may try to locate it for you on other devices.
    + All of this looks good if Google can find these additional devices.  
    + But not always, and sometimes things don't work.

## The bots I want to create

+  I want to create bots that answer questions using text.  
+  This could be for a personal website, or it could be done inside a larger website like Facebook, Twitter, or even Google.
+  The bot could be called "Ask Me Anything bot", or something else.
+  A "bot" could also be created for any other program, like a mobile app.
  - For example, a bot could work with an app that can locate Pok√©mon Go.
  - This bot could be used inside the app to make the game easier, or possibly more fun.
+  My own bots will work by following a list of directions to answer questions.  
  - This means that they **can't think outside of these instructions**.
+  Most web bots are created to answer a large number of questions.
-  Mine will only answer one question.
+  My new bots will be able to answer a list of different questions.
- My bots will only answer a single question.
+  In this case, the bots will just **repeat words from a list**.
- My bots will repeat words.
  - This is not true for other bots.
+  To understand my bots, look at how another bot works, a bai-laji bot.
+  This website works to give you quick news about bots.
  - URL
+  You are now talking to bots-laji.com. So, you say something.
  - I

I've seen many posts about natural language processing, but nothing like this.
Maybe someone can advise me on this topic.

A: The most important thing to realize is that you can never have an "utterance" in natural language text - you have a whole text in which you have sentences that are not complete utterances but are "utterances". That's because in NLP you have to identify the entities.

A: The basic idea might be to use a simple statistical machine learning method to try to predict whether a given word (or phrase) is a noun (or noun phrase). Once you have a classifier that can effectively identify nouns, then you can do the other steps. For instance, you can ask the classifier something along the lines of "Does this word or phrase refer to a person?". Based on the answer, you might do something like "OK, this word can never be a person; so in this text string, the word and its context will never form a named entity." This is a very loose and simple example, which illustrates the idea.
There are a lot of resources on Wikipedia and elsewhere like this, but the basic gist is that you define a set of NER tags: Person, Location, Organization, Quantity, Money etc...
And you create a data-set that has a set of different texts or sentences for each NER tag. In your data-set, you will write the sentence with the tag, and you will write the sentence (and the tag) in all the context in which you would like to find the actual target sentence. In other words, you might write

The teacher bought a pen for 20 dollars.

The target sentence might be:

The teacher buys a pen for 20 dollars.

But you will write:

The teacher bought a pen for 20 dollars.
The teacher bought a pen, and a hat for 250 dollars.
The teacher bought things for various students.

Once you have defined your data set, then you can train a NER classifier. It's not going to be perfect, but you can try to create a classifier that will do reasonably well.
To use your example, using this technique (and assuming that you have a good tagging of all your sentences in your data-set) you could then try to identify NERs in an un-tagged and possibly unread natural language text. So for example, for your first example, you might be able to identify that "person" is a NER, and then that "teacher" is person and "20 dollars" is something else. Then the tagger might say "this section of text is not correct because it doesn't mention a person". And then you might be able to start saying "ok, so this part is not correct because it doesn't mention a Person as target but it does mention a teacher. It makes sense, and so this is a person". This might not work well, but I imagine it would be a starting point.

instruction:
Describe the content of the article in a brief manner.

A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.
output:
Describe the content of the article in a brief manner.

A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.

The researchers also found that a 20-minute exposure to a dim light in the hours before going to bed‚Äîas opposed to waking during a light-up night and going to sleep in darkness‚Äîled to worse sleep quality, higher heart rate, and increased blood sugar. It was not a dramatic shift in nighttime light exposure that triggered the effects, but an hour or so of exposure early on during the day.

Zee, the lead author on the paper, believes that sleep disruption from light exposure has been getting little attention as an area for research in part because sleep lab studies that track such disturbances would require people to come to laboratories, which is costly. But because the light-on/light-off effects on the brain are so potent, it's no surprise they would show up to some degree even in a lab. "No one does studies inside a sleep lab because it's very difficult to control all the variables," she says from her home in Bethesda, Maryland.

Zee says the effect of light in sleep is more significant than what some experts were expecting. A 2007 study, also published in PLOS Biology and led by Zee, reported a link between light during the evening and an increased likelihood for depression later on in life, even if it didn't necessarily lead to depression itself. Zee says that's because being exposed to light in the evening (along with other factors, such as stress) could alter circadian rhythm, the internal biological clock that regulates sleep, and therefore affect sleep quality and brain activity the following day.

While Zee is no medical doctor herself, she says the findings of her recent studies have "the potential to have an enormous impact on how physicians prescribe sleep." Indeed, the first step is getting physicians and general public to better understand light and how it impinges on sleep, she says.

"Sleep is an area of very little public knowledge," she says. "Everybody sleeps, but they don't know how to structure their lives around it."

Her study suggests that people need to be vigilant about light in the evening, which is not something people do consciously, Zee says, because darkness is a comfortable state. In addition, Zee says other research already suggests that it's not just exposure to light at night but rather when we turn off the lights that influences sleep.

"Studies have shown that if you turn off lights at about two hours into your sleep and leave them off all night, you'll have very poor sleep quality," she says.

But we should be mindful, she says, that turning off the lights early in the evening, at or around the time we want to go to bed, could result in our bodies being tricked into a false alert that the day is over and we should get up. This is how she describes the effect of light on the body after dark: "If your internal clock is thinking about going to bed, but you feel as though it's day, that's when your internal clock is really confused, and there's a lot of trouble at that juncture."

On top of what appears to be a growing body of research on the effects of light from an experimental sleep lab, Zee says that other studies have shown that people who spend a large amount of time reading by the light of their computer monitor in the evening or watching TV for a prolonged time during the evening are more likely to be depressed or get diabetes than people who opt for a better sleep regimen.

The bottom line, Zee says, is that we should make conscious efforts to minimize our exposure to bright light in the early evening hours, which she says is a time of day when most of us really don't need it.

"We don't like when people come up and touch our head," she says. "That makes us feel vulnerable. Even in the darkness, we like to feel safe."

‚ÄîA.J. Jacobs

As of the 13th day of December 2021, this Music Recording Agreement ("Agreement") is made between Good Kid, a Toronto-based musical group ("Artist"), and Universal Music Group, a record label with license number 545345 ("Record Label"). The Artist and the Recording Label may be referred to in this Agreement individually as "Parties" and collectively as "Parties." output:
Take a look at the contract and extract the parties of the agreement from it.

As of the 13th day of December 2021, this Music Recording Agreement ("Agreement") is made between Good Kid, a Toronto-based musical group ("Artist"), and Universal Music Group, a record label with license number 545345 ("Record Label"). The Artist and the Recording Label may be referred to in this Agreement individually as "Parties" and collectively as "Parties." Work under this Agreement will begin on March 15, 2022, and will last for the duration of the Agreement. The duration of this Agreement as a whole is 2.5 years, which is split between the Production Period (the first two years), and the Distribution Period (the third year).

The Record Label is the owner of the master recording on which the Artist will release its work. This Agreement is for production of and distribution of the Artist's upcoming album.

The Recording Label and Artist have come to an agreement under which the Recording Label will distribute the Artist's work at no charge for the first two years of the duration of this Agreement. After the first two years, the Artist will pay the costs of distribution, as specified in Paragraph H. However, the Artist needs to have a certain amount of units in stock for distribution before the first two years are up. If the Artist has not reached the aforementioned requirement, it will be considered a violation of this Agreement, and the Record Label has the right to suspend distribution for the first two years of this Agreement under Paragraph L.

It is the Record Label's job to pay for the recording studio to record, edit, and promote the Artist's work. It is also their responsibility to get the album to the relevant stores so that it can be sold there.

The parties shall divide the costs as follows. The Recording Label will receive 20% of the profits. The Artist's fee is 80%. The Recording Label shall make a weekly distribution on a Tuesday for a period of a month to see if the Artist has earned over $50,000. This will cover the production costs and 50% of promotion. If the Artist earns more than $50,000, it will receive 80% of the earnings on the first Tuesday of each month. The Artist can also get a payout after the two-year production period when the total earnings have reached $1.6 million, in which case 75% of the earnings is paid to the Artist. If the Artist would rather receive all of its earnings at that time, it will receive only half of the earnings for that time, and the remaining half will become its earnings at the end of the production period.

## **Summary**

  * In the contract between a band and a record label, the agreement usually has two parts: the distribution part and the production part. While the first part details what the company will do for the band, the second focuses on what the band will do.
  * During the production period, the band is under the record label's direction and has to deliver any work or album to them.
  * During the distribution part, the band may work on anything they want, but may need permission from the company to launch any product.

You don't have to be a major rock group to have a deal with a record company. However, you have to have a good song to sing, a strong name, some publicity, and enough people who believe in you to make it work. The band consisted of four friends who went to high school near San Antonio, Texas: Nathan "Ned" Heller, 18; David "Dave" Crenshaw, 17; Richard "Rick" Sellers, 17; and Nathan "Nate" Jones, 18. They'd all been playing together since they were kids, and Ned had already started a recording studio, called the Swami Center, with his father, where all four of them grew up.

The boys hadn't even been born when The Beatles' "I Want to Hold Your Hand" topped the charts. However, their parents introduced them to this popular British band and taught them to play the instruments they'd see in these videos. Later, the boys started to play together in high school. They formed a club called Hail! and organized some music festivals, but soon Nate moved to Dallas. Meanwhile, the other three formed a band and named themselves after a Beatles song. The band was called Love and Hate, after the Beatles'

output:
On the basis of the subject of the email, determine whether the email should be treated as spam or not.

Dermatologists don't like her!

> A dermatologist recently decided to take action against an email spam she received: she wrote to the domain owner saying that she didn't like her email, and asking him to change his address. Later that day she received an email from him!
> 
> Unfortunately, spammers often respond to such messages. Some are trying to trick you into revealing the IP address of your email client software, or even use the email as an opportunity to infect your computer with a virus.

If you're the email subject, think twice before contacting a spammer! Even though his message may seem harmless, he likely needs your personal information in order to conduct some illegal activity. As a result, you may create a legal trouble for yourself.

In any case, you need to change your email address or forward such messages to spam@spam-free.ru.

2. What to do if you receive spam

When you receive a spam, the following three basic rules should be observed √¢¬Ä¬ì don't forward or reply to it, don't click on it (especially if you see any suspicious links), and don't answer phone calls from numbers you don't recognize.

How did you think that spam was created?

> Spammers use all kinds of things for spamming. What's interesting, in order to avoid any legal problems for themselves, they use everything and everyone!
> 
> On one hand, spammers are trying to make spam as harmless as possible:
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   
_a._ Spammers use harmless images; to make it more appealing for you, they use some pictures of nice girls, like those on most greeting cards.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers often provide an information site as a spam destination √¢¬Ä¬ì this makes it look as if the message is sent by some legit organization; the site is filled with all kinds of information, which is good, but it does a great service for spammers: if the site is infected with some kind of virus, everyone who uses it will be infected, including their customers.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers also use real addresses that belong to some companies √¢¬Ä¬ì for instance, they may use real addresses of a certain bank, but in a different city. Spammers simply register to these addresses, which they use to distribute their spam.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers also use email clients from various companies. For instance, in 2004, some spammers decided to use Hotmail √¢¬Ä¬ì which has been banned from spam-related activities on the Internet √¢¬Ä¬ì for their activities and registered an address that clearly showed where they were. However, this doesn't mean that all Hotmail users get spam.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers also use some legitimate mail services when distributing spam, and even pay for this: it's much easier for them to receive spam at this email address than to create their own. In fact, many mailing lists use their own internal mail services, because they are faster and more efficient.
> 
> On the other hand, spammers also do their best to get ahold of your data:
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers often use your phone number when they send spam. As you may know, there are many people who are registered as both a male and female with the same name, which is great for spammers √¢¬Ä¬ì they simply pick up any phone number they like and send you a message: they even call your phone and ask if it's you, then they ask you to confirm you're the person you say you are, that you understand what they're talking about, and so on. However, in the case of legal problems, it's much easier to explain the person with the exact name, but this still doesn't work.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers also try to get access to your data, and to your friends' data, in order to form spam-focused mailing lists √¢¬Ä¬ì in fact, it's not even necessary to access your and your friends' emails √¢¬Ä¬ì just by searching for your name on social networks, they get all the information about your friends.
> 
> √¢¬Ä¬¢   Spammers often make it as easy as possible for you to reply to spam messages. When they receive a spam, they often check whether the email address matches your name. Then they immediately tell you what to do and what to send them to receive a reward. We already know that such emails should not be replied or forwarded, and they often say that it's not necessary to inform anyone about this, that it will

Demo is a  public showing or presentation of something, typically to promote or advertise it. And, news is information about recent events or happenings, especially as reported by news media.

Using this tutorial, you can analyze and classify a user‚Äôs review as either positive or negative using sentiment analysis features in an existing Next.js app. We show you how to leverage language AI into your applications. Check it out ‚Üì
output:
Classify the tweet into one of the following three categories: event, demo, or news. Event is a happening, often social or public, that people attend or are aware of. Demo is a  public showing or presentation of something, typically to promote or advertise it. And, news is information about recent events or happenings, especially as reported by news media.

Using this tutorial, you can analyze and classify a user‚Äôs review as either positive or negative using sentiment analysis features in an existing Next.js app. We show you how to leverage language AI into your applications. Check it out ‚Üì ‚Üì ‚Üì

## Introduction

Tweet is a small but powerful piece of software that runs a Next.js (JS) app. This tutorial is going to use the [Next.js boilerplate](https://github.com/Antefo/tweet) application (aka Tweet) to deploy on your [Cloudflare Workers](https://cloudflare.com/workers/docs/tutorials/developing-js-apps-with-the-workshop) instance.

If you haven‚Äôt completed the [How to deploy on Cloudflare Workers](/tutorials/cloudflare/deploy/) tutorial from the Cloudflare blog, please do.

## Set up your Next.js app

**Setup**:

```bash
yarn global add -D @cloudflare/worker
# OR
yarn
```

**Build and publish**:

```bash
wget https://cdn.cloudflare.com/workers-upload/latest/cloudflare-workers.zip
unzip -d ./workers cloudflare-workers.zip
cd ./workers/cloudflare-worker-examples
npx workerify -s "Workers.worker.init({name:'tweet'})"
```

Now you are ready to run the app locally.

## Set up machine learning

We need to use [Antefo](https://github.com/Antefo/antefo) package to set up machine learning.

```bash
npm i -g @antefo/workerify
```

Antefo is a small and fast Node module with functionality to easily make API calls, process JSON responses, upload files, process files, and more. It‚Äôs built to improve performance, manage multiple HTTP request queues, and do these tasks in a single call without blocking the main thread. Learn more about [Antefo](https://antefo.github.io/).

## Set up Twitter account and API

You can sign up at [twitter.com](https://twitter.com) to create a personal or business account. Twitter requires a phone number and/or email to authenticate your account.

[How to set up Twitter account and API for machine learning](/blog/tutorials/how-to-set-up-twitter) explains the process of connecting and testing the API request.

To test the API, open [https://sandbox.twitter.com/realtime](https://sandbox.twitter.com/realtime). The [request](https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/get/statuses/user

If you get enough exercise to eat a large candy bar every day without gaining weight, it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem to eat an avocado every day. Other wise you should probably eat them sparingly. 


A: The word that is used to describe an avocado is: 

avocados - the name of two kinds of large green berry-shaped, edible fruits - the Hass avocado and, in particular, the Fuerte avocado - that have a flavor very similar to peeled banana, but with a distinctive odor - strong, sometimes fishy, smelling almost like rotten banana; and when peeled, the interior flesh is very dark red and is a popular vegetable.

So it's not the avocado itself that is called "fat", but the high fat that you might encounter in an avocado, which then can be used as an ingredient in some diet plan, for example.

A: One possible word for this is "high in" (in relation to fats)

avocado high in calories

Another option is to use the word "fat" but it isn't very descriptive.  It just refers to the fact that the food has a high proportion of fat (in relation to other macronutrients, i.e. proteins and carbs)

avocado a high-fat food

Low in value



*

*High in content means that it contains more information or that it is important. Example:

*

*High in quality means it is of high quality. This often refers to a person, item or a brand. 


Example 1



*

*The new CEO of a company is high in quality. 
(He is very good at his job.) 


Example 2



*

*This brand is high in quality. (Their products are sold in all over the world.)

instruction:
You will be required to write a few questions from the given company's interview section.

Kohl's
output:
You will be required to write a few questions from the given company's interview section.

Kohl's Inc. is an American retailer and the third-largest department store chain in the United States.

Kohl's Department Stores:

A brief history of Kohl's:

Kohl's was founded by Menard's founder and CEO Robert J. Kohl on October 30, 1962, in Northbrook, Illinois and is now headquartered in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. In 1962, Kohl opened his first general merchandise store by selling items from his basement in Northbrook. Ten years later, he opened his first standalone department store in Milwaukee. In 1972, the first Kohl's was built in Wauwatosa, Wisconsin, and the company became a publicly-traded stock in 1972 and listed on the New York Stock Exchange. In 1978, Kohl's began to target low- and middle-income families, an idea that would lead the company to success. As a general merchandise store, Kohl's sold products at a lower price point than other retail outlets. As a result, the brand was an immediate success. They did this by marketing Kohl's as a company that would always be there for customers. The first Kohl's coupon was issued in 1982 to promote a wide range of products at deeply reduced prices. This resulted in Kohl's popularity for its "always" low prices and "never" late payment policies.

During the early-to-mid 1980s, Kohl's underwent several store renovations. In 1988, Kohl's opened its first international store in London. In 1991, after the sale of its discount division to Sears, Roebuck and Co., Kohl's changed their marketing strategy to target customers ages 65 and older by offering a discount in exchange for a signed commitment card. While there was some initial success, the strategy was short-lived as many seniors had already been members of this program, and the other group that the brand was trying to attract, people in their 40s and 50s, were not convinced by the offering. In 1998, Kohl's started to focus on their value and customer services aspects, adding quality assortments, making merchandising changes, cutting prices, and improving services.

In 2002, Kohl's introduced the Kohl's Brand Value Center, which brought in more brand-name manufacturers for their customers to shop. In 2005, Kohl's began to expand and invest in their online presence and started to sell online in 2002. Also in 2005, Kohl's became the largest seller in the United States of the new electronic devices that did not require a cable, such as the iPods, iPhones, and other devices. In 2005, customers became able to pay for their purchases with credit cards through Kohl's gift cards. This allowed Kohl's to accept any form of payment rather than just cash or checks.

A decade later, in 2015, Kohl's launched their "Misfit Monday" campaign, which focused on giving shoppers a chance to have a good time and shop without a price tag. The following year, Kohl's tried to use social media and their online presence to get more customers to buy things from the store. They have also made videos in an attempt to draw customers in their stores.

Kohl's was named "Retailers of the Year" in 2017 by the National Retail Federation.

Kohl's has grown steadily, and for many years, it was among the leaders in department stores. However, Kohl's has been struggling to stay competitive with large department stores such as J.C. Penney and Macy's. Kohl's has also been struggling to compete with online retailers such as Amazon and Walmart.

To bring in more customers and bring back customers who did not shop at Kohl's anymore, Kohl's implemented a loyalty program. Kohl's was also trying new things and investing more in technology. On 16 April 2020, Kohl√¢¬Ä¬ôs started to temporarily close all their stores, and they were shut down for two weeks. In January 2021, Kohl's announced a $430 million investment to open new stores, and they also planned to increase the number of Kohl's stores that were located inside Walmart stores.

Company Structure

On the internal side, Kohl's has three types of stores and three different categories of retailers.

instruction:
Based on the information provided, you need to estimate the average summary for the given job.

Data entry clerk in United States
output:
Based on the information provided, you need to estimate the average summary for the given job.

Data entry clerk in United States was 150 USD / Hour.

For other countries, you need to know the average salary in other countries and converted to USD to derive the average.
Here is some information
    Australia    197.66 
    China        99.06


In the future for other countries, you don't need to know the average salary as a result from data entry. The answer is always like the above.
In total, you need to find average summary in total 8 countries.

#Solution:

class Solution:
    def average(self, salary: List[float]) -> float:
        average = 0
        for salary in salary:
            average += salary / float(salary.count())
        return average


salary = [150, 40000, 10000, 400, 100, 250]
solution = Solution()
res = solution.average(salary)
print(res)

And to show the final result
print('\nAverage salary {0}\n'.format(res))

#Result:
#Average salary 210.0

Average salary 210.0

instruction:
Provide a list of the skills that may help you find the job.

Crew Members
output:
Provide a list of the skills that may help you find the job.

Crew Members in Alaska are usually more than three generations of employees. Each job has its own personality. It is expected that everyone will get along and respect everyone's job, even if they don't like the job that much.

You may be asked to join another boat or ship and you never know what is being planned for the day or the week. Your life is dictated by the captain.

Alaska is a place where every day is different and every day is full of wonderful surprises. Most of the crew are happy and they work well together. There is an old saying that we all go down when the last dinghy sinks; as long as this happens there is no problem.

## 7 ‚Ä¢ The TreadWater Dinghy

If you are going to the bottom line, you do not want to take your dinghy anywhere near it. And the bottom line is usually water, no matter where you work. The most serious injury on most boats today is drowning.

The number of people who drown at work has nearly doubled since 1950. In the construction industry and in the fishing industry, people are dying on land or while working on equipment, but in the maritime safety realm, two-thirds of all fatalities are the result of drowning at sea. The vast majority of these accidents happen to crewmembers of fishing boats and dredges. In some cases, people are drowning in what is known as the treadwater phenomenon. This refers to any person who ends up "walking" in the water, but for no apparent reason, who is not in danger of being pulled overboard. They do not have life jackets on them and the water is around their head. Their legs may look as if they are kicking, their hands may appear like they are reaching for something, but they do not know how to save themselves. And they are not getting help quickly enough. They are probably not getting help at all.

There is a simple solution to this problem, but if the captain or crewmember on duty or on watch does not know how to follow it, nothing can be done.

Dive-ins are very common in Alaska. They may have been the main reason your boss is trying to get you into a dinghy. This is a simple way to dive in with your gear on. This is a perfect dive to practice a proper dive-in, so you can be sure that you have made every effort to save a drowning person.

A well-practiced dive-in can be the difference between life and death.

There are some boats that will not even allow you to keep your life jacket on. And there are many crewmembers who do not think that having a life jacket on is all that helpful. Some of them are not really prepared to go in for a person in distress, no matter how good they think their underwater skills are. You have one opportunity. It might not mean much to you now. If it does come down to it, you will thank yourself for all the extra effort.

## 8 ‚Ä¢ You Might Be Drowning

I have seen people who should have been able to make it, but they just did not get it together. One day I was talking with a friend's family. Her young son was on day eight of his survival swimming class and he was beginning to make some progress. But I warned him that when he starts to think that he can just paddle out to the boat and wait, he is in trouble. He will become very weak and not know how to swim.

I talked a lot about treadwater and how the brain can only think about getting out of the water, and how you do not want to be in the water at that time. In this kind of condition, people are not usually thinking of anything else, they are not thinking about what is wrong with them, they are just thinking about getting a hand, and what they should grab with that hand. Because they just want to get out of the water. So they are going to try and get their hand into something that they think will support them, whether it is a hand or a buoy. You have to be prepared for this.

The biggest problem is not drowning. The biggest problem is the brain not processing any water so they do not recognize that they are in the water. And that is when a lot of people drown at sea. It is a lot easier in the water to see the sea than to see the boat, so once someone is able to swim and not think about getting a hand, they know it is coming. But most of the time there is not a hand. They are not expecting the current to be so strong, and so they end up paddling off. They cannot get their body to rotate to get up on the float. Their muscles are too weak to pull the body up out

instruction:
Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper.

Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.
Explain: The dominant sequence transduction models

instruction:
Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.

We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse

##### What did the authors actually do (describe the methods used and the data)?

The authors did nothing. This paper is a mere description of an "imaginary system" with some imaginary improvements over other imaginary systems. In order to get some insight about what was done, you need to parse the abstract. But even that will not do it because what was just described was not a research method that is described in the abstract, which is why authors never describe what they actually do as an abstract. The abstract is mostly about what "is" and what "could be" instead of "was", if what was in question was done by others.

###### What did the authors intend to do?

First read what is described at the very beginning of the abstract and then think about the implications of what is described.

When speech is received by an ASR module, it is converted into an utterance model for which it has been trained to recognize. Our goal is to replace traditional machine-engineered models of speech with deep neural networks that directly learn to recognize speech through end-to-end training. Collapse
##### What problem(s) were they trying to solve?

Read the very first paragraph at the beginning of the abstract.

The objective is to produce practical speech recognition technologies that can function under realistic, but challenging, conditions, such as those typical of spoken-language interaction. Collapse
##### What success(es) did they have?

There are no success metrics described in the abstract. 

To measure the effectiveness of Deep Speech, we first use its recognition results in a test set to compute error rates on multiple sets of criteria. On the Switchboard Hub5'00, the top set of widely recognized benchmarks for speech recognition, Deep Speech achieves 16.0% error (10-fold cross-validation) in speech-transcribed words, making it the best system we are aware of.

When evaluated on a new benchmark, we demonstrate that Deep Speech handles background noise better than the top-performing commercial system. Collapse
##### How did they know they had succeeded?

Describe the error metrics used in the text. But there is nothing that indicates that the error was made by the researchers. This is because the system was not actually tested by the authors.

###### Further questions

###### Anything else?

Yes. The abstract is nothing but a marketing document with some vague promises for the future.

This paper tells us, in the form of this imaginary system, what researchers have been studying for years.

###### Acknowledgments and funding source(s)

###### Disclaimers

###### Abbreviations

I did not even bother reading the rest of the paper as those were all marketing messages describing the "utility" of this imaginary system. It is likely the majority of the paper is much the same since Deep Speech is likely an implementation of the algorithms mentioned in the abstract at the beginning of this paper. There is no mention of the authors actually having conducted any experiments.
