You need to come up with the names of some of the papers that relate to the paper you are given.

RoMQA: A Benchmark for Robust, Multi-evidence, Multi-answer Question Answering
output:
You need to come up with the names of some of the papers that relate to the paper you are given.

RoMQA: A Benchmark for Robust, Multi-evidence, Multi-answer Question Answering
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This paper is meant to be used as a single paper submission, the main
submission of RACLIC.

This document is a detailed analysis of a paper that has been submitted
to NeurIPS 2021 but has not yet been accepted.

The final version of the paper is due to be available soon from the
website <URL The final version of
RoMQA is a 18-page paper with 10 figures and no additional materials.


**Authors**:

<NAME> (<EMAIL>)
<NAME> (<EMAIL>)
<NAME> (<EMAIL>)

**Contact**:

<NAME> (<EMAIL>)

See details for the full list of authors on my CV:
# URL


## Abstract

This paper analyzes a system named RoMQA, which was submitted on May 4th
and is due to be published in July 2021 on the NIPS website. It is an
extended version of the paper that was submitted for the [MICCAI
2021](URL call for papers in June 2020.

RoMQA is a system for multi-evidence question answering (MEQA), where
answers should be provided on the basis of more than one evidence token
in a passage. It is designed to be a system for long fact extraction;
the authors refer to it as a "robust fact extraction system." It is not
a machine learning model for MEQA, so "the most straightforward way to
test the effect of data augmentation" is not considered by
RoMQA. The paper "concentrates on two different aspects:
(1) robustness, and (2) robustness against single-evidence questions,"
but does not "explore how the accuracy is improved by learning the
underlying mechanisms of the question-answering problem and by using
data augmentation."

The problem of long ROPA has received renewed attention after a talk by
<NAME> at NIPS 2019, and is explored in this paper to the greatest
extent it can be without the use of a machine learning model.

The final version of the paper was due in July, with a due date of August
1st. It took only about five months to write and a month for revisions.

## Content

1. A brief description of the content of this and the previous draft of
   RoMQA
2. Analysis of the evidence and model tokenization
3. Analysis of the dataset
4. Analysis of the main contributions - model, tokenization + data
   augmentation
5. Modeling of the question/title
6. Evaluation methodology
7. Question answer pairs
8. Evaluation results
9. Evaluation for accuracy, MF1/MRR/MAP, and a model-specific accuracy
   metric
10. Discussion of the findings

## [Conclusion](URL

This paper was written in response to the call for papers for MICCAI 2021,
the deadline for which was July 15th, 2020. The research was completed in
summer 2020, at which time MICCAI was canceled. This paper presents the
first public analysis of the work, was prepared for submission on May 4th
and due on August 1st at the latest (the submission form specified a
due date of August 1st in the original proposal for MICCAI 2021).

The final version of the paper is due to be published in July 2021 on the
[NIPS website](URL The papers published have
to be accepted before July, so it was possible for the paper to be
published in July 2021.

The paper is not available in the form in which it was published, yet, but
will soon be available for download at

 <URL

Please download the paper in PDF format to be able to print and read it.

The [RoMQA code](URL is
also available on Github for anyone to use. It is only possible to use it
for free as a non-commercial academic research project.

To allow comparison with the RoMQA papers of MICCAI 2021 (available
here: <URL
<URL

instruction:
Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.

*

You'll see each emoji after some time has passed by. **When you see an emoji, you press the button to take you through 60 seconds before you're shown the same emoji again.**

It's important to note that you cannot go back to any time in between to change an emoji selection after it's already been selected.

You'll be shown the name of the movie if you choose the right emoji combination correctly.

# Scoring

1 point per correct answer.

Your score will be saved on the system.

---

# Gameplay

Click a key to play the game.

You score 1 point for each correct answer. Your score will be saved on the system.

You can only choose one emoji per time, because some of them will appear several times.

---

# Winning with a wrong answer

If you select the wrong emoji, you don't get any points for it and you are shown next emoji.

---

# Time limit

Every single emoji will be shown 30 times (30 seconds worth of time). If you haven't completed guessing the emoji combination when all the emojis are shown only once, you lose.

---

# A special emoji

The final emoji is an additional 30 seconds worth of time.
If you've completed guessing the emoji combination by the time the emoji appears only once, you lose.

---

# Pause

You can pause the game at any time during gameplay.

During a pause, you will be shown this screen. Press the 'PLAY' button to continue.

- **Tournament** - every time you win 3 rounds, you will be given an extra 30 seconds before the final time
- **Time Trial** - each emoji that appears on the screen will be shown 3 times - 30 seconds worth of time will be taken from your score each time

## Tournament mode

You start from 30 seconds. This game is in round-based.

Round1 & Round2 are 30 seconds worth of time. Round3 is only 10 seconds worth of time.

Each player will start with 30 seconds for every Round

The winner is the one who has had less Time over all rounds.

instruction: Come up with an interesting idea for a new movie plot. Your plot should be described with a title and a summary.
output:
Come up with an interesting idea for a new movie plot. Your plot should be described with a title and a summary. Then you should create character descriptions and their backstory. Next, you must create a synopsis and character relationships. Finally, you should write scenes, dialogue, and special effects for your movie. To add to the fun, you can also make a script and cast it, too! Just make sure to keep the movie plot and characters interesting, while not losing sight of your theme. By the end of the time you've spent on this project, you will have earned a chance to work in the film industry, either on the big screen or behind the scenes.
Make an original poem about a special place you've visited, such as the Grand Canyon, Old Faithful, or Times Square. Your poem should start the moment you step into the special place and describe how the place you've visited makes you feel. You might write that you feel inspired, invigorated, or joyful. Then, end the poem with a wish that you'll return with your friends and family.
If you want to make money as an artist, you need to make money selling work you've made, so come up with a list of ideas for things to sell. Then, choose one or two items to make. As you're making those, come up with ideas for other items you could sell as well. At the end of the year, you will have created a whole catalog of artwork and ideas for things to produce.
Create a comic drawing showing a scene with three superheroes in it. They're battling bad guys in a comic strip, or at least they were. Suddenly, something happens outside that changes the whole mood of the comic strip: the bad guys attack their friends! This scenario can be a way to end the comics, or you could have all three characters work together once their friendship is rekindled.
Get together with some good friends and write original plays and musicals based on fairy tales. You might not be as creative as Shakespeare, but the point is to write something fun that people enjoy. You can write one of the parts, or you can help out on direction for someone's play! Maybe you want to be in charge of the costumes, the set, or the props. The way you'll learn the most and have fun is by being involved. Also, be creative and see how many you can write. Don't be afraid to mix up the fairy tales, too.
Draw a new map of the world using only objects found in your home, such as a glass of ice cubes, a ruler, a pair of scissors, and a red pen.
Design a unique card game that has only one winner. The objective of this game must be to get cards in a specific order from the deck. For example, on the first turn, a certain player gets a certain number of cards, then the next person gets a certain number of cards, and so on. Maybe every player wants to get to the final prize card on their turn. To win, each player must get the cards in a specific sequence. So, the first player's turn must look something like this: Get 5 cards from the deck on this turn, and then end your turn. Now let the next player turn. She must do the same: Get five cards from the deck on her turn.
Plan an eco-friendly vacation. Start with an eco-friendly vacation trip to somewhere like Hawaii. Then, write at least ten questions about the vacation and research your answers. For example, you might want to know: What is the best way for vacationers to reduce their carbon footprint during a trip to Hawaii? You must answer the questions (in full sentences) by the end of the year. At the end of the year, you will have the answers to these questions, and that way you have taken a trip to Hawaii and know all about it. Cool!
Design a computer game that's more about helping and learning than it is about destroying anything and everything. The game should feature several levels, puzzles, and something special the player can do at the end.
Create one hundred words that match two different categories in order to win a prize. For example, words that start with "t" could fit five different categories, such as "tomb," "truck," "trek," "turtle," and "turtle."
Find a story that can be transformed into a movie script, and add one of your favorite actors' names to the end. For example, you might like "Hercules" so you choose an actor who looks like him, such as The Rock. This gives you a movie script and can change into a movie script. You might want another script that you could turn into a movie storyboard, too. Either way works, but you need to have fun doing it.

    def capitalize(word):

instruction:
Please prepare a table containing a summary of the information of the participants at the conference.

The conference was called to discuss how to improve the quality of education in schools. The main speaker was Professor Crew Purdie (cpurdie@email.com), who spoke about the importance of setting high standards for students and teachers. He said that schools should be places where students can learn and be challenged. Other speakers included Teacher Oliver Malachi (oliver@email.com) and Parent Kolby Reese (kolbyreese82@email.com). The teacher talked about the need for teachers to be well-prepared and to have high expectations for their students. The parent spoke about the need for parents to be involved in their children's education. There was also a discussion about the importance of funding for schools.
output:
Please prepare a table containing a summary of the information of the participants at the conference.

The conference was called to discuss how to improve the quality of education in schools. The main speaker was Professor Crew Purdie (cpurdie@email.com), who spoke about the importance of setting high standards for students and teachers. He said that schools should be places where students can learn and be challenged. Other speakers included Teacher Oliver Malachi (oliver@email.com) and Parent Kolby Reese (kolbyreese82@email.com). The teacher talked about the need for teachers to be well-prepared and to have high expectations for their students. The parent spoke about the need for parents to be involved in their children's education. There was also a discussion about the importance of funding for schools.

# Chapter 2

## Prepare a list of the objectives for the meeting

Prepare a list of the objective for the meeting. The objectives should be:

  * To increase student engagement in school
  * To increase parent involvement in school
  * To increase school funding

## Prepare an agenda for the meeting

Prepare an agenda for the meeting. The agenda should include:

  * Introduction and opening remarks
  * Discussion of objectives
  * Discussion of strategies and solutions
  * Closing remarks

## Prepare a list of the members of the meeting

Prepare a list of the members of the meeting. The members of the meeting should include representatives from the following groups:

  * Students
  * Teachers
  * Parents
  * Principals
  * School administration
  * District administration

## Prepare a list of the attendees

Prepare a list of the attendees. The attendees should include all members of the group previously listed in 2. Prepare an email invite and a list of names that will be invited.

## Prepare a list of the discussion topics

Prepare a list of the discussion topics. The discussions can include the following:

  * How to increase student engagement in school
  * How to increase parent involvement in school
  * How to increase school funding
  * The best practices for improving the quality of education

You can also include additional discussion topics that have not been mentioned in this list.

## Prepare a template for the discussion

Prepare a template for the discussion. It should include an outline for the different sections of the discussion. These sections should include:

  * Introduction and opening remarks
  * Discussion of objectives
  * Discussion of strategies and solutions
  * Closing remarks

## Prepare a survey

You should also prepare a survey for attendees to fill out and give feedback. This survey will include questions about:

  * The overall quality of education in your school
  * How to increase student engagement in school
  * How to increase parent involvement in school
  * How to increase school funding
  * The quality of student engagement in specific subjects
  * The quality of parent involvement
  * The quality of school funding

This can provide valuable insights into how to improve the quality of education. You may also want to consider creating some short videos to help explain the issues and answer any questions that attendees may have.

## Prepare a summary of the discussion

At the end of the meeting, you should summarize the discussion and make recommendations for future steps. You should also include a note to the attendees reminding them to complete the survey.

# Chapter 3

## Prepare a report

After the meeting, you should prepare a report that summarizes the main points and the actions that have been taken. The report should include:

  * The objectives of the meeting
  * The agenda
  * The attendees
  * The discussion topics
  * The outcomes and next steps

The report can be sent as an email or uploaded to an online platform such as Dropbox or Google Drive.

# Chapter 4

## Identify a topic for the presentation

Choose a topic that is relevant and engaging for the audience. You can research current events or ask the attendees for their feedback on the most important issues.

## Prepare a slide deck

Use a presentation tool such as Microsoft PowerPoint or Google Slides to create a slide deck with the following sections:

  * Slide #1: Introduction
  * Slide #2: Topic
  * Slide #3: Data and statistics
  * Slide #4: Solutions and actions
  * Slide #5: Conclusion

You can add other slides as needed, but keep it simple and manageable. You can use bullet points or images to highlight the main points.

## Practice your presentation

Practice the presentation several times until you feel comfortable with it. You can use a friend or colleague to give feedback on your presentation

instruction:
Assess the sentiment of the given tweet and categorize it as Positive, Negative, or Neutral.

"This is the best cheat-sheet paper that I've found in a LONG time."
output:
Assess the sentiment of the given tweet and categorize it as Positive, Negative, or Neutral.

"This is the best cheat-sheet paper that I've found in a LONG time."

"The best content you can read to boost your writing and learning."

"I'm so glad it is over, now on to my next project."

  

1

How to: Use the "How to" and "Learn" Category

    "How to" and "Learn" are subcategories under "Advice."

    "How to" contains posts that give advice on how to go about doing things, such as "How to Become a Good Writer."

    "Learn" posts provide information that teaches you new things or expands your knowledge.

    "Learn" is sometimes used interchangeably with "Learn," but "Learn" is usually more specific to things you can learn in your work such as "Tips for Learning JavaScript for Web Front-End Development."

    When you're considering a post, ask yourself, "Is this post giving me more information or helping me do things?" If you can't decide, choose "Learn" instead of "How to"

  

2

How to: Use the "How to" category to identify those posts that are "How to" posts and that are not yet categorized as a subcategory of Advice, which is under "Career."

"How to: Become a Good Writer"

"How to: Turn your Passion into Your Career"

"How to: Make a Living as a Music Producer"

"How to: Build a Career as a Freelance Writer"

  

3

How to: Use the "Advice" category to identify posts that aren't classified as "How to" posts but that have an Advice-type category inside them.

"Advice" and "Tips" are two popular subcategories within "Advice."

"Advice & Tips" or just 'Advice" is another example.

  

4

How to: Choose between Subcategories

    The first time you work on a specific post, you can make a guess.

    Use "Passion" subcategories to organize those posts where the "Passion," "Lifestyle," or "Career" category is not important, but where you'll be talking about your passion for writing, drawing, making music, or being an entrepreneur. Posts will be categorized in this subcategory, if not in one of the "More Subcategories" categories.

    Use "More Subcategories" to organize posts that will be categorized in a subcategory under "Advice" or "How to."

    Use "Advice" and the 10 "Advice" subcategories to organize posts if they aren't categorized in "More Subcategories" but don't fit into "Passion."

    Use the "Inspiration" category if you need inspiration for your post and don't know what category to choose.

    Use the same "How to" category to organize posts that may or may not contain advice on how to do that thing, but would be useful for someone wanting to learn more about that thing, such as "How to Write a Poem" or "How to Become a Voice Actor."

  





# Categories

## How to use the categories on your blog

A post is classified in one category if it fits well into one category and can't fit well into others. You will likely want to classify at least some of your posts in the "More Subcategories" subcategories. As of April 2019, they are not listed on the WordPress Dashboard or in the Appendix. The ones on the site are:

In the following, we will use the term *error* to refer to an element of the error sequence.


# Theorem

Let Œ± be an error sequence. Let t be the minimal integer such that 0 ‚â§ t ‚â§ 4t + 2 and let B be the *2t √ó 2t-square* consisting of the first 2t rows and columns of the matrix

\end{pmatrix}$$


Let K be the *K-tableau* which consists of the following subset of B

* The elements corresponding to all the base change sequences in Œ±

* The elements of B corresponding to the edge sequences of Œ±

* The elements corresponding to the error sequences of Œ±

Then 2t columns from B and K together form a basis for the free module which is K[B]. 


## Proof

This is essentially a standard example illustrating the relationship between K-tableaux and bases. (For an introduction to K-tableaux, see the discussion in Chapter 3 of Hironaka's book.)

We can represent a group element in the following way:

$$\begin{pmatrix}

\end{pmatrix}$$

Then K ‚àà K[B] becomes

$$\begin{pmatrix}

\end{pmatrix} + a
\begin{pmatrix}
0 & 1 \\ 
1 & 0
\end{pmatrix}.$$

(What we do here is to write down the element in a very specific way, leaving us a lot of room to work with. For example, the element will just use the first 2t columns. This will allow us to rewrite our error sequence in a way that involves only one error from the error sequence.)

We can then represent any element of this subgroup K[B] in terms of the group element K and the vector x ‚àà B as

instruction:
Create a list of subtopics for the given topic.

Music theory
output:
Create a list of subtopics for the given topic.

Music theory and composition

Melody
A melody usually consists of a combination of notes and is most often described as a sequence of chord tones performed in a particular sequence or pattern. Melody may be written using a music staff (i.e. an abc notation). The melody is notated directly above the staff. Chords (chord forms) are written in the same key as the melody using an appropriate chord symbol. The notes are arranged into scales and keys for composition and are the basis for composing a song. Since in music each key sounds different from all others, a key is assigned to each piece of music. A key is determined by the most prevalent chord form at the start of the piece of music.

In a phrase the melody will change at intervals but always return to the same key. The melody can be any rhythmic pattern. For example, a "familiarly repetitive" or a "dizzying array of short notes" can be a melody. The notes are divided into melodic groups which may be of equal length.

Rhythm and tempo
The tempo is the speed of a piece based on the length of each musical beat or note.  Rhythm refers to the length and placement of each successive note, or more generally, the musical patterns of repeated notes, rests, or non-diatonic harmonic intervals. A piece of music with a repeated refrain can be called a "rhymed song". Rhythm also has an effect on the tone produced by vocalists or other instruments. It is used to create musical phrases and patterns. As different languages have different rhythmic values it is often difficult to understand the rhythm of a piece of music without prior study of the language, so sometimes it is necessary to give a separate explanation of each phrase and the overall rhythm to understand the piece of music.

Melodic line
Note values
Length of a note

Melody and harmony
Melody is often composed with a harmony in the background, and will then either support it or oppose it. Many songs have a theme with two parts. Other variations include a first part that is usually repeated, then a second part that plays a contrasting melody, sometimes called a variation. Many songs will have only one part, and it is common that one melody is used in two parts without changing anything.

See also
 List of composition techniques
 List of forms in classical music
 List of styles in classical music
 Rhythm and meter (music)

References

External links

  Music theory is introduced in this book. A simple way to understand its concepts is by explaining the most important music terms.

Articles containing video clips
Composition techniques
Music composition
Music theory

instruction:
Summarize the movie in a snarky way. Try to explain the movie in just one sentence.

The Shining
output:
Summarize the movie in a snarky way. Try to explain the movie in just one sentence.

The Shining is a suspenseful horror film. It involves a very unstable family as they spend a winter up in a remote mountain lodge, and the father, Jack Torrence (Jack Nicholson), slowly goes crazy within this time. As strange activity comes to his family, including creepy children, weird noises, and an evil presence that haunts the entire lodge, the family tries to find help from the hotel manager, Tony, but his help isn't really helpful. But no one really knows what's going on, and things keep getting worse and worse, especially when Jack is completely off his rocker. His family (his wife Wendy played by Shelley Duvall, and his young son Dickie played by Danny Lloyd) try to figure out what to do, and decide that, in the end, they must leave Jack behind in the lodge. That doesn't necessarily end it. Jack is not a man you want to leave in a dark, dingy house with an evil presence. After the credits, Jack, who is still going slowly crazy, returns to the family back in the real world. Of the two options‚Äîhe stays in the lodge with the kids and takes care of them, or he destroys them to keep them with him, Jack chooses destruction and chaos, eventually murdering his family. A great film, and it's now a horror classic. It was also Kubrick's last film.

What was the most interesting concept you uncovered in your research?

A lot of people ask me why Shelley Duvall's character is so annoying and has no redeeming qualities. I found out it wasn't in the book. Part of Kubrick's genius is his ability to subvert the original work and not just to go with it but to change things that could make the movie better and create a more original movie. Kubrick's story was so amazing, and it seems a little crazy that he couldn't write that well. The only thing he wrote was a short story, which was later made into a movie called "Kroton's Face." Kubrick just didn't write. When The Shining came out, it was a bit like the movie of The Cat in the Hat when it came to sales. He wrote the movie with a really interesting cast, and they brought it to life. I think Nicholson is the most popular character, so in a way, everyone focuses on him. His psychosis, his anger, and his craziness is like candy for the eyes, so that's why he's the most well-known character. But I think Danny is the one who has the craziest story, or at least is the craziest in the end.

What film, or moment in film, would you most want to live via the memories of?

I would love to have the memories of my life by watching movies. I would love to learn a bit more about myself. Just through watching myself on camera, I can start analyzing myself a bit more and see where I've been. Also, there's no pain or grief experienced through watching yourself on screen. You only feel the positives, like I do now, living through the story of the creation of this book, or the memories of the stories told to me by those who participated in this movie. I would want to live by watching movies. I would love to have that opportunity to see myself on camera and analyze myself on such a personal level. It would be fascinating to see all of my friends. It's like a photo album.

What did you learn from Jack Nicholson's madness?

In general, I think this generation spends too much time on social media. The internet and social media aren't inherently any bad, but we spend way too much time on them. People get addicted to it, and they become very unbalanced. They can actually spend the rest of their lives on these media outlets. It may actually change our way of thinking. We now need to be on them all the time, and we get to know everyone who is on that website. I think we need to take it down and to enjoy nature and the outdoors. We would have a more healthy life if we weren't connected to phones or the internet. We all have smartphones now, so we aren't able to see what's going on around us. It seems like we have no time to waste, and we need to be on our phones. We need to get back to real life.

How much time did you get to spend with Jack Nicholson?

Jack was one of my favorite actors, so I felt honored to even be able to spend time with him. I talked to him about what it was like doing this movie, and some other things he had been up to. It was really great to

## 6. Chicken & Broccoli Quinoa

**_INDIVIDUAL SERVINGS = 7:_**

**_TOTAL TIME = 20 minutes_**
**INGREDIENTS:**
4 Tbsp olive oil
3 cups cooked quinoa
1 Tbsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp sea salt
2 Tbsp sesame seeds
1 tsp paprika
2 cups broccoli florets
2 cups chicken breast, cubed
1 cup red pepper, chopped
2 Tbsp dried crushed oregano
Juice of 1/2 lemon
INSTRUCTIONS:
	
In a saucepan, add the olive oil, garlic powder, salt and quinoa. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring until warmed through. Remove from heat.

Add sesame seeds, paprika and oregano to the saucepan and mix well, stirring until no clumps exist.
Place in a bowl, cover and keep warm while the chicken and veggies cook.
Melt a tablespoon of butter over medium-high heat in a medium pan, then add the chicken, stirring until all pieces are submerged. Add the red pepper and broccoli to the pan. Season with more salt to taste and cover. Cook for 6-8 minutes, stirring often.
Transfer quinoa to a flat serving plate or larger cookie sheet, leaving plenty of room for the chicken and veggies to be ladled onto the quinoa.
Once cooked through, ladle the veggies and chicken onto the quinoa and stir until thoroughly combined.
Squeeze a little lemon juice over the quinoa and vegetables, tossing until well coated. Sprinkle with additional oregano. Enjoy warm!



## 7. Baked Ziti

**_INDIVIDUAL SERVINGS = 4:_**

**_TOTAL TIME = 30 to 40 minutes_**
**INGREDIENTS:**
1 1/2 (14-oz.) cans Whole-Wheat Penne
1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
1/4 cup minced garlic
3/4 cup diced onion
3/4 cup green bell pepper, chopped
4 oz. cream cheese, room temperature
1 cup ricotta
3/4 cup tomato paste
3 (6-oz.) cans tomato paste
2 cups shredded white cheddar cheese
INSTRUCTIONS:
Preheat the oven to 375¬∞ F (190¬∞ C).
Put the penne in a large pot of boiling water and cook it until al dente, about 14 minutes. Once the pasta is drained, add it to a large oven safe dish of your choice, and pour out all of the liquid from the penne (you can save this for a future use). Cook noodles for an additional minute or two.

Mix the cream cheese and ricotta together in a measuring cup. Stir in the tomato paste and pour it over the penne.
Stir in the garlic, onion and green pepper. Sprinkle 3/4 cup of the cheddar over the noodle pasta and place it under a broiler until the top is golden brown, about 5 to 8 minutes.
Top with the remaining cheese crumbles and drizzle in the tomato paste (tomatoes) for an additional 4 to 5 minutes.

instruction:
Invent a new word based on a description of the word.

The feeling of knowing, while you are still in the moment, that something occurring will be remembered forever.
output:
Invent a new word based on a description of the word.

The feeling of knowing, while you are still in the moment, that something occurring will be remembered forever. But the feeling is fleeting because it won't last long enough to record it on to your memory device.

Not to be confused with:
a. _forever_. One of your feelings. But, unlike _knowing_ , not fleeting: _forever_ is a feeling that will always be with you.
b. _forever_. Like _knowing_ , but your definition doesn't include "fleeting." It _is_ permanent.
c. _forever_. A word that you are defining, but a definition that is wrong: _forever_ is not a permanent word. It is fleeting.
d. _forever_. An expression, like "forever" or "forever and ever." You will always feel "knowing" when you hear "forever."
e. _forever_. The name and description of a noun.
f. _forever_. A noun. You're trying to define the noun "_forever_."
A noun that is not always or most of the time a plural.

_It's_ your last meal.
_What's_ the opposite?
_There._ Why it's a noun, and what's so wrong with _it_.

**A noun that is a person but does not end in "-_er_."**

For instance:
Mr. Smith was a great man.
This is just an example of a phrase-noun that comes before an adjective or a verbal phrase. But in some examples, the adjective is missing. It's easier for a noun to come after an adjective or verbal phrase.

**An adjective that can be used as a predicate noun as a substitute for the usual noun and is used to modify a verb.**

**A pronoun that refers to a person or thing that is being talked about.**

**The plural form of "s."**
**A verb that has the form of a noun and takes object, subject, and a copular verb (to be).**

**A copular verb that is used to link a subject with a predicate noun or other adjectival phrase.**

**A verb that cannot be used as the subject of an _am_ or _are_ phrase.**

**A simple and/or compound verb with the exact same meaning**

Not to be confused with:
a. "The same as." A phrase that you want to say. But because there's no way to show that both of the phrases you're using are the same, you use the word "same."
b. "The same as." An expression or word that's already been defined, but it's a different one.

**A verb that is used as subject of a clause, even if it is not the verb "to be.**

This is a good example of how often you confuse the words that come before _to_ and _for_.

**A verb that you can use in the present or imperfect tense in the passive voice.**

Remember that these verbs also come with prepositions and auxiliaries, so that makes them plural.

**A verb that you can use in the present or imperfect tense in the passive voice to express that something is being thought about, talked about, observed, or considered.**

**_The verb "to be."_**

You're not making this up.
Not to be confused with:
a. "_to_ be" as an infinitive used with prepositions that express movement.
b. _to be_ as a preposition.
c. "_to_ be." A word, or a word, that you've already defined.
d. "To be." An expression or word that you're trying to define.
e. "To be." A noun that you're trying to define.
f. "To be." Like "to be a." A compound noun that comes before other words.
g. "To be," or just "_to_ be." Also a verb, but you don't say "to be in the passive or present tense."
This is not a noun, but a verb. It's the verb "to be." Here's a list of things that you've already defined, but don't realize this. You think that they're nouns, but they're actually verbs.

To encourage and to show one's sympathy.

When invited to a party and you are not sure you want to go.

When you have made a mistake and wish to apologize.

When you have a favor to ask someone, but don't want to be too straightforward.

To ask for a person's favor. (See also Chapter 7, under "to ask someone for a favor.)

To ask for a loan of an item.

To ask to be introduced to someone.

The expression used for giving or asking for an apology, as it is for telling someone no.

to ask someone to do something

Here is a list to help you decide whether your desire is a request or an "order":

Is it something you are asking because _you_ need it rather than because a third person does?

(e.g., I'd love some help on this assignment.)

Are you requesting something that someone else does or that someone else is responsible for?

(e.g., Would you help me make this change to the page?)

If yes, you should say:

to ask someone to do something

Do you want to get the most out of the other person's time?

You can say:

Would you...? ( _When you are asking someone to do something for money because you don't want to give them time or because you know they are very busy, you need some more persuasive words._ )

Would you help me [with]...?

...you need a little time, it might help if you...

...you'd just have to...

...you'd have to have some time to...

to ask someone to do something

When someone has failed to fulfill a request

(e.g., to answer a question)

**You:** Oh, look. The traffic's backed up. It looks like we missed the exit. Do you mind if we take an alternative route?

**He:** I can't leave you like this. You'll have to get out and walk, at the expense of wasting time.

When you don't want to give someone an opportunity.

(e.g., to make a suggestion or to ask a question)

**You:** Can I use your phone to make a call?

**He:** No, it's not a dial-up phone. You have to plug it into the computer.

When you are trying to persuade someone.

(e.g., to stop talking or to agree with you)

**You:** Oh my, it must be late. Please, I don't want to be here much longer.

**She:** It's just been such an interesting evening.

**You:** I wouldn't get into an argument about it, would you?

**She:** I already have.

**You:** Please.

**She:** Well, I was.

When you are trying to get out of doing something, but your request is not clearly no. You can either go along with the initial refusal, but ask for a little time, or change the subject.

**Your:** What did you think of the music?

**She:** You're welcome to go in that direction...

When someone agrees with you.

(e.g., to get out of an argument)

You can:

accept a suggestion or a decision.

let someone's expression of thanks/praise/sympathy show that you were happy about it.

to agree with someone.

If you want to get out of a conversation.

to agree with someone who has just made a suggestion or decided something.

You can:

respond by saying "Yes, that makes sense."

respond by repeating the person's first suggestion or decision.

If you want to stop someone from making a remark or argument.

A phrase to change

output:
Make a list of adjectives that can be used to describe the given brand.

a creative tech startup that is not only fast and cheap but also reliable

a fast-fashion brand with great value and no quality  
 _(A word that is commonly used where there is no quality)_

a cheaply made brand without any quality, but it is so cheap that you don't want to care

a company that makes great stuff but is so exclusive that it's not accessible to most consumers

a cheap tech brand that has some issues with poor quality but in the end it's okay

# 3  
Developing Competitive Advantage

## HOW TO SELL STRING THINGS ON A NEGATIVE SALE

**S** ome brands want to do everything themselves. They might want to create beautiful print ads, develop the website, own the domain, and maintain an online store. All of it.

For many things to get done, however, there is a tradeoff between cost and quality. While it is possible to find an affordable website developer and have a competent SEO expert, the problem is that many things can go wrong, and these people aren't that great about troubleshooting those issues. For example, it is not uncommon for a brand to be penalized by its search engine because its website was taken down due to some glitch with its web host. Once a site is down, it can take a lot of work to get things back on track, even if it's only one thing.

A smarter route is to do one thing, but to do it so well that you can win through it, especially if it's something that happens for everyone.

To solve the issue, I created The String Thing. It is a t-shirt with a printed design on it using only 20 to 25 characters with no spaces. To make sure it's done right, I went through a long process of testing designs and quality. I used a special font called Futura, which has a small number of characters to work with. I asked my friends about every aspect of the project. I got feedback on almost everything. I made lots of changes, and then changed some more. I tested my product in a way that made my t-shirt even better than my competitors.

I sold all 30 T-Shirts on the first day. From then on, I kept the price high and sold out every day. The first T-Shirt I made cost me about $420 because of the cost of printing. The shirts I sold after that ranged between $390 and $450, but I gave out shirts free of charge to bloggers that reviewed my brand. One of these bloggers said, "I was skeptical about The String Thing at first, but now I can't live without it."

Here is how it worked.

If someone wanted to make a custom T-Shirt to commemorate their wedding, for example, my product page would allow them to choose the type of material, their size, the color, the type of shirt collar ("standard," "sport," "vintage," etc.) and the number of characters for the logo. They would then have the option to add the characters (no spaces, 20 characters maximum including numerals and space) for the logo on the shirt itself. Their total t-shirt cost would be based on the price of the materials, the size, and the number of characters used on the shirt.

Once a T-Shirt was sold and delivered, it was ready for printing. The printing cost was more than $400. I was also paying for the shipping and insurance, and the site was not charging my customers. The T-Shirt was going to be expensive and high-quality. I wasn't getting into this for money, but to get my message out.

I advertised like it was a normal discount. It is interesting because I didn't want to put an extreme discount on it. I wanted it to be priced so that the T-Shirt would not seem too expensive and then when I sold it, people would say, "How come this is so cheap?" instead of thinking, "This is a really expensive shirt." The main thing was to not do it for cheap, so my target customers were looking for quality.

However, the brand's product page made it look like everything was at a discount, even the 25 characters for $4.20 or the "design yours" model where you could choose your own images for $4.90. I was selling a $42 printed T-Shirt for $4.20 and saying that it was going to cost almost as much.

In order to put it on display, I gave it away for free for a day. This was

Regex is a set of characters that define a search pattern. This kind of pattern is usually used by string-searching algorithms to find or replace strings or to validate inputs. Convert the natural english text to regex.

Match a valid ip address
output:
Regex is a set of characters that define a search pattern. This kind of pattern is usually used by string-searching algorithms to find or replace strings or to validate inputs. Convert the natural english text to regex.

Match a valid ip address eg `192.168.1.1`


## Pattern: `ip`

This `ip` conversion rules allow a developer create a regex with a valid ip address. The validipregex can be matched using the `validip` input.
```dart
final ip1 = validipregex.match(validipregex.format('192.168.1.1')); 
```

Note:
this is the same pattern with `validipregex1` with a different text.

Match a valid ipv6 address eg `192.168.1.1`


## Pattern: `ipv6`

This `ipv6` conversion rules allow a developer create a regex with a valid ipv6 address.
```dart
final ip1 = validipregex.match(validipregex.format('192.168.1.1')); 
```

Note:
this is the same pattern with `validipregex2` with a different text.

Match a valid ip,v4 or ipv6 address eg `192.168.1.1`


## Pattern: `ipv4 or ipv6`

This `ipv4 or ipv6` conversion rules allow a developer create a regex with either a valid ipv4 or ipv6 address as a string.
```dart
final ip1 = validipregex.match(validipregex.format('192.168.1.1')); 
```

Note:
this is the same pattern with `validipregex3` with a different text.

## Pattern: `ip or ipv6`

This `ip or ipv6` conversion rules allow a developer create a regex with either a valid ipaddress or ipv6address as a string.
```dart
final ip1 = validipregex.match(validipregex.format('192.168.1.1')); 
```

Note:
this is the same pattern with `validipregex4` with a different text.

instruction: List some of the top real estate marketing words to add value to the listing and engage more potential buyers.
output:
List some of the top real estate marketing words to add value to the listing and engage more potential buyers.
Top Real Estate Marketing Words
As you know, words do not have a direct correlation with selling and buying, for example. What they do mean is they create emotion, which may or may not mean they are attractive and a benefit for either the seller or buyer.
Let‚Äôs put it this way: Your goal is to sell your home and your goal is for my home to sell; but, can you agree that we both want to spend less on our home for the most bang for the buck?
And if the answer is yes, we can agree that we want the best seller to get the best rate and as an agent, to make the best profit.
Now, let‚Äôs look at this article and use it as motivation to help you develop marketing strategies that may appeal to today‚Äôs buyer.
To find your dream home with more confidence and ease, take the extra time and make sure you know these 36 top real estate marketing words, as you will see their words mean so much more than sales are made on the internet, or real-life selling.
Why You Need to Know These Real Estate Marketing Terms
We‚Äôve already determined the words do not have an immediate correlation to selling or buying, but one would agree they do have an affect. And, although no one likes to talk about the emotional part of selling or buying a home, the words do create emotion. And you could agree (or could disagree) that these emotions can create an effect. And as an agent, you want to use these words to create the best offer and the best deal.
So, what do you think? Is this an article on ‚Äúwords‚Äù or an article on ‚Äúreal estate marketing?‚Äù
You decide.
36 Top Real Estate Marketing Words
So, are you ready to find your home?!
Let‚Äôs start the list with the Top 15 real estate marketing words first, and then we‚Äôll see how each word relates to marketing.
1) Luxurious
As an agent, how often are you able to get a listing with the word ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù attached? Well, here it is.
Luxurious is the top word (you know a top seller of any article).
But what does luxurious mean? And what does it mean to a seller? Well, to begin with, luxury indicates something of high quality, and when a seller looks at their 2-bedroom, 2-bathhouse, they wonder, do I have anything really special? And now, when you say the home was ‚ÄúLuxurious,‚Äù the seller realizes that he or she has an ‚Äúupper-class‚Äù home.
But more so, luxury often has to do with value. In this case, the luxury of a ‚Äúluxurious lifestyle.‚Äù
As you can imagine, luxury is a very top of mind real estate marketing word, and if you need a ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù home to be listed, you may ask yourself, what am I really trying to create?
2) Custom
As you learn about many of the top real estate marketing words, you find some have two meanings.
There is the real estate marketing meaning, and then the seller‚Äôs meaning.
One such example of two meanings is the ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù meaning and the ‚Äúcustom‚Äù meaning.
As a house seller and buyer, you want a home to reflect a custom luxury look-and-feel. But, also, you can agree, it is just not possible to have a custom luxury home for the low-ball price that every house has had for years and years.
You can agree now that the luxury of a custom house can be over $300,000.
As a ‚Äúluxury‚Äù (in this case the top seller in terms of the word), when you describe your house as ‚Äúluxury‚Äù you can also say it is ‚Äúcustom.‚Äù And then you would have two meanings and two results.
Think of it this way: You can create the luxury look of any house and increase the value by over $100,000, or you are a bargain hunter and say there is a $50,000 difference.
3) Top-Quality
You will also find some of these best-seller words can mean two (or more) things. But, one thing we can agree on when we say the word in this list is ‚ÄúTop-Quality.‚Äù
For example: You could say you have a high-quality home with or without the word. If you are high-end, you can say you have a high-end home. But you can also say you have a ‚Äútop-quality‚Äù home with no mention or attachment to upper-class.
But when you say you have a top-quality home, you would be saying your home is well put together. And, you

instruction: Create a template in markdown to create scope for Jira tickets. Members should use this template as a checklist to ensure they have included all the necessary information when creating a ticket.
output:
Create a template in markdown to create scope for Jira tickets. Members should use this template as a checklist to ensure they have included all the necessary information when creating a ticket.
The template is available here. It may look like a long document, but it uses the Markdown "fenced code" syntax, which lets us use inline code while using Markdown.
The code block below has a couple of pre defined variables defined for use inside the template.
These should all be included in every ticket. See the wiki page for more information about these variables.
To ensure everyone is on the same page when creating tickets, we should make sure that each ticket is unique and contains only relevant information.
To do this, any tickets that are more than three messages old and are still open should be closed. Any tickets that were closed more than three messages old should also be reopened so all members are back on the same page.
You can see the list of tickets here.
Jira tickets must not be closed.
Jira tickets must have a clear title.
Jira tickets must not be empty - at minimum they should include a description and assignee.
Only one ticket per issue is allowed.
A "duplicate" is a ticket where the content is exactly the same, and it is not clear why it has been created. A ticket that is duplicate of it's existing parent cannot be created. If you find another ticket that is a duplicate of your existing ticket, and the existing ticket is not an issue, you should either close that ticket and merge it into your existing ticket or else close it and notify the appropriate person to merge it. If that ticket has a bug assigned to it then you should create a comment to the original person responsible for the issue explaining why you are closing it.
A ticket should not be closed without a comment on why - this should be the same if you are closing it, merging it or commenting on it.
Only members who have the responsibility/accountability flag should close tickets.
A ticket can and should be reopened on request - if it has been closed, a ticket can be reopened regardless of who has closed it. However, please ensure that one person owns the ticket and has the responsibility/accountability flag and that they are also listed as one of the assignees - otherwise it may be very difficult to resolve the issue.
For people that have the accountability flag, they should be given warning if tickets are being closed without explanation.
Any tickets which are a duplicate of other tickets should be closed in one of two ways - the old one should be closed and marked as a duplicate or merged into the original, or the new one should be closed and the original should be commented on along with a link back to the duplicate.
A note added to a ticket should always have a timestamp and be a comment - not made from a reply action.
We should make sure a single ticket exists for each issue, but more than one ticket can be defined as a "version" of the issue.
We should use the ticket system for discussion on issues, rather than having personal slack groups.
Tickets must be closed if the issue is resolved - these are then archived. Please consider archiving tickets that are not being actively discussed or closed for 3 months even if they have not been resolved as this will free up space on the ticket system.
Ticket numbers are important - ensure that old numbers are still used in older tickets.
Tickets should not be marked as resolved. Once resolved, old tickets should be deleted.
Any ticket where there is an issue and no resolution should be added to the "Open issues list"
When tickets were started, each member who was on the project and has the 'responsible/accountability' flag was asked to add themselves as a primary assignee. Since then, the membership has changed. Therefore, make sure you add yourself as an assignee, either 'primary' or 'secondary' if you can assign yourself there.
The "responsible/accountability" and "primary assignee" flags should be held by the appropriate project leads.
The name of the primary assignee should appear on all tickets as a link that automatically takes you to their ticket.
Please do not leave yourself as a primary assignee in all tickets if you are not involved, unless there is no one else available.
Where someone is only listed as secondary assignee, if they are still in the project or team, they may also be asked to take primary status for any ticket.
If you find someone who is a primary assignee without being on the project, please add them to the project.
We should add people who are in the team to the project - if you added yourself but somebody else got in first, don't be sad about it.
When someone has worked on the ticket you were assigned to, it's a nice gesture (from you) to update the ticket and include

instruction:
As part of software engineering, user stories describe what the user wants the system to do, while acceptance criteria describe the conditions a specific user story must meet. Create basic acceptance criteria based on the given user story.

User story: As a user, I want to use a search field to type a city, name, or street, so that I could find matching hotel options.
output:
As part of software engineering, user stories describe what the user wants the system to do, while acceptance criteria describe the conditions a specific user story must meet. Create basic acceptance criteria based on the given user story.

User story: As a user, I want to use a search field to type a city, name, or street, so that I could find matching hotel options.

Acceptance criteria: For a hotel search, the Search box should accept either a city name or a hotel name.

The Search box should provide an option to search for multiple hotels (e.g., show all results if user search for the name of multiple hotels).

The Search box should provide search filters to enable a user to sort the returned results based on location, price, or other parameters.

A search function should be available in the navbar.

instruction:
A user story is an informal, general explanation of a software feature written from the perspective of the end user or customer. Write a user story for a given software.

Gmail
output:
A user story is an informal, general explanation of a software feature written from the perspective of the end user or customer. Write a user story for a given software.

Gmail

Gmail was a product that was released to the public in 2004. The purpose of this web application was as an e-mail interface that allowed users to have more email than they could send with any other company. The business model, or how Gmail made money, was their ads, which were displayed right next to the users' messages and which were of great interest to the e-mail users. At present, the use of Gmail has dropped significantly in terms of users from 2015 to 2019 and this is a major problem for Google itself because they need to find ways to get this app back into the field.

This product is of interest to the end user because they're getting all of their e-mails in one place, rather than needing to go through a series of different apps to do the same thing. Gmail also has the ability to keep other types of information such as videos and photos separate, rather than having to go through a separate app to get this information, which can be time-consuming and frustrating for many individuals who wish to do more things quickly.

This product is also good for customers because it's easy to use, has great customer support, and is very reliable.

The customer who is using this product is not using it because it's free, or because it's the best product on the market; it's because they need to have their emails stored somewhere.

You would have to do something specific about this product to make it better, but let's say you have 10 seconds to think about it. You may want to improve the way that emails are saved so they never expire, or make it easier for people to sign in and out at Google. It's really up to your imagination!

The purpose of writing a user story is to allow the software developers to come up with a concept for making a product or app better.

I have written stories of this sort of nature. A good user story allows the software developers to see what is important to the customers. They see this story as a guideline, rather than a written contract.

I came up with this story:

As an e-mail user, I want to be able to view and send emails to other users in Gmail. But as an e-mail user, I need to be able to see all of my emails so that I can see which ones have been sent and which ones will be received.

This is an important question and I'll answer it here. We are trying to see what is the most important task or task that we can do with our software.

This means that the first thing we need to do is write a user story that describes how our software works.

User stories are written according to what the user is thinking, and if it is possible to provide it for them. They are supposed to be written in terms of an end user, rather than in terms of the developer, which means that the user shouldn't have to make any decisions about what she wants to do in terms of the software, if it's in terms of what she wants or needs.

A user story can be written in terms of what the user is thinking or in terms of what she would like done with the software.

It can be written in terms of what we would like done with the user, and in the case of this product, we have the user story below.

User Story 1: The user will be able to send emails to anyone from anywhere in their email account.

User Story 2: We will be able to save our contacts list as they come into the account.

User Story 3: We will be able to see all of our emails, and we can see who has sent us an email and when the emails were sent.

All that I can say about user stories is that we can write them in any way that we like.

As a software developer, you can write them as we have done with this one.

If you were to write one that was more formal and detailed and which was more technical, there would probably be many things that you could add to the story that would make it more interesting.

This one user story that I have written is called a user story because it's about a user.

As a user, the user story describes the behavior of a user.

The user story says that if you want to send an email, you will be able to send emails to anyone from anywhere in your Gmail account.

A user story can also include things that have to do with the software.

This means that you can include things such as what is most likely

instruction:
Make a list of the pros and cons of the given decision.

Implementing a Remote Working Policy
output:
Make a list of the pros and cons of the given decision.

Implementing a Remote Working Policy
------------------------------------

A few years ago, you were hired to work for a small start-up in an upstate
city called New Paltz. The company was very small with
only a handful of employees, but it had an excellent reputation in the
industry. You were hired as the project manager for a new game the
company was producing. There were four employees that were directly
working on the project, with your boss responsible for other games
the company was producing. There were also six contract employees working
in New Paltz and three people who were working from home. Your company
saw a huge success for the game and asked you and your boss to move to
NYC to manage the project. We will assume that at least 2,000,000 people
have now purchased the game. There are now 34 employees across the US
who work for the company, and with the success of the game, a new
project manager is needed for the current project.

You and your boss are now both in NYC, and you are both struggling to
work with people that are not in the office because you are so close to
each other. This is really not conducive to the workflow you are used
to. Your boss has suggested that people who work remotely need to
bring their work to the office and work during the week. He is
concerned that you may be at a disadvantage using remote workers when
trying to solve problems that can only be solved by people in the same
office because people that are able to work remotely come from different
life experiences and might not have the same perspective as someone who
grows up and lives in the same area. He has even asked your boss to send
out an email with a proposed solution to this problem, but he does not
have the full bandwidth necessary to create a proposal or to answer all
the questions that you and your bosses need to address in order to
implement a new remote working policy. 1

.. [1]
   - You do not need to have an answer to this question, but there must be
     some sort of description of why you are thinking the way you are and
     why you need to present this work.

After some discussion about the logistics of the problem, your boss
concluded that since you and your coworkers had been able to manage the
project to this stage successfully, that the process you started
already meets the expectations, even if you are now in need of a
policy.

You recently have two weeks off where you are not working, and you would
like this extra time to think about how this process could be improved
over the next two months when you will need to manage three new people
working remotely. If you succeed, your boss will suggest that you
work remotely for more than two months. There is also a possibility
that your boss could give you a full-time position and make you live in
New York if you are able to produce a good result. You are a young
married man and you do not have a mortgage or rent to pay, but your parents
currently lend you $1200 a month, and your wife is also helping make you
buy a one-bedroom condo that you had found through a local real estate
agent. You have $300,000 in your savings account, which you are using
for emergencies. You and your wife have both had your salaries frozen
for the next month, but you have been able to save $8,000 this year.
The last time your parents had made a loan for you, you returned to them
$5000 because you just had not been able to get yourself on track to
repaying them.

You feel strongly that you do not want to live in New York. You did not
study at Syracuse University. You know about the different neighborhoods
in the city, and you feel that NYC might not be as expensive as other
places you have experienced, you have heard people say that you can do
fifteen subway rides for $200 a month, but you know nothing about the
commute so you have no evidence to back this statement up. You have
heard your friends from college talk about how they are going to New
York because it is a big city and a lot of opportunities are available.
You have also heard them talk about how it is a lot more expensive to
move to New York than it is to move to Philadelphia, so you have no
idea if NYC is any closer to what you can afford to pay each month.

Your first reaction is to try to decide if you would like to work in
NYC

An
unscrupulous person is trying to deceive a rich businessman.
This person is very crafty and cunning. The business cannot
discriminate himself, and he trusts the person. As a result,
the businessman loses his money.


# 1.4.  Punctuation

As mentioned previously, one of the main differences
between English-language and LaTeX is the way to
use punctuation. In LaTeX, you usually use a special character to
mark punctuation, such as parentheses and square brackets.

## 1.4.1.  Brackets

Brackets are used to define a word phrase where the meaning
is not completely clear from the general grammar rules.

You can use braces for that:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
\[
  \begin{array}{cc}
    a & b \\
  \end{array}
\]
\end{lstlisting}

As you can see, you have to start and end brackets with the
special character `\[`. And only the beginning of the
brackets must be surrounded with something else (typically
newlines).

If you have to add text in brackets, you can do it like this:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
\[ I am adding text. \]
\end{lstlisting}



## 1.4.2. Curly braces

Curly braces are used to mark a set of rules or a list.

If we wish to describe a list of items, we can use them like:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
\textbf {This is a list of items}.

The items are (they are separated by commas):
\begin{itemize}
    \item item 1
    \item item 2
    \item item 3
\end{itemize}
\end{lstlisting}

You can also use curly braces to indicate a set of statements. If
it‚Äôs the case, we sometimes use words like ‚Äúif", ‚Äúor", ‚Äúfor", and etc.


## 1.4.3. Double Quotes

In LaTeX, you can use double quoted text to mark text that
represents an exact value.

If we have a list of numbers, we can use double quotes like this:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
We have these numbers:
1, 2, 5, 9, -37, 17, 700 \\
What is the sum of these numbers?
\end{lstlisting}

Here we have a set of numbers, and LaTeX understands it as an unordered collection.
As you can see, we write the numbers one by one.
Now, if you need to say that the sum of these numbers is a number,
you can add a \verb|\hfill| to the end of the list. That is
sometimes called a \textbf{hanging indent}.


## 1.4.4. Single Quotes

Here we use single quoted text to mark text that has a special meaning
within a certain macro, which we will touch on in the future.


## 1.4.5. Text with Symbols

Sometimes you wish to add the mathematical symbol to your text:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
This is a text with symbols:
\begin{equation}
\sqrt{x^2}=x|
\end{equation}
\end{lstlisting}

As you see, \verb|\{| is called \textbf{aligning bracket}. You should
not try to use it as a quotation mark, or as a set of rules indicator.


## 1.4.6. Alignment

Some items in the list might have to be aligned:

\begin{lstlisting}[language=latex]
Here should be an aligned list:
\begin{align}
f(x) = & x^2 \\
& x = 2
\end{align}
\end{lstlisting}

For example, you can make align a list of expressions:

\

instruction:
Provide an ESRB rating for the following game.

This is an action-adventure game in which players help Kratos and his son on a dangerous quest. Players explore various realms and engage in frenetic hand-to-hand combat against human-like raiders and fantastical creatures (e.g., centaurs, trolls, dragons). Players use axes and chained blades to battle enemies, often resulting in large blood-splatter effects and dismemberment. Players can perform finishing attacks that depict close-up impalement via bladed and hand-held weapons; repeated axe strikes to a creature's neck results in decapitation. The words ‚Äúf**k‚Äù and ‚Äúsh*t‚Äù are heard in the game.
output:
Provide an ESRB rating for the following game.

This is an action-adventure game in which players help Kratos and his son on a dangerous quest. Players explore various realms and engage in frenetic hand-to-hand combat against human-like raiders and fantastical creatures (e.g., centaurs, trolls, dragons). Players use axes and chained blades to battle enemies, often resulting in large blood-splatter effects and dismemberment. Players can perform finishing attacks that depict close-up impalement via bladed and hand-held weapons; repeated axe strikes to a creature's neck results in decapitation. The words ‚Äúf**k‚Äù and ‚Äúsh*t‚Äù are heard in the game. At the end of the game, players can choose from one of three endings based on the actions they take throughout the play time.

```
============
EAS33092    
3/28/2018   
Kratos and his son are on a quest for a magical orb in order to save his son‚Äôs life. Enemies that Kratos battles are human like (centaurs, trolls) and fantastical creatures (dragons.)

The story is a fantasy, which means that the game is not realistic as a whole, with all the creatures that you do battle with.

It is an action game, which means that it consists of a lot of fast action. From what I have read, this game is the most demanding one PlayStation 4 has ever developed.

The story is simple and can be understood quickly. There really is not much to the story. It is mostly about getting to the end and finishing it as quick as possible.

The main character, Kratos, is known as the Greek god of war. It is said he had been defeated by Zeus, and then had his daughter (Athena) murder in the temple of Zeus. The game shows a flashback of Kratos murdering the rest of his family, which consists of his wife and son.

Kratos‚Äôs son has been turned into a baby for 100 years due to being the one who had destroyed Zeus. Now he is old enough and powerful to kill him.

Kratos needs to stop Zeus and his companions in order to save his son, as he is the only one who could defeat Zeus. Since Kratos killed Zeus earlier in the game, he also has to find the remaining gods to defeat Zeus and save his son.

The game has three different endings. One has a happy ending where Kratos and his son are reunited. Another ending leaves you wondering what happens next, as you did not know what is right and wrong in the last storyline.

The story is so fast paced that your concentration is easily sucked into the game. The graphics are outstanding with little or no slow down.

Frightening scenes: The scene in which the monsters of the world are destroying everything. Kratos and his son battling the monsters and then finally being victorious.

The violence in this game is so intense that when it is over you will think that you have died. The last portion of the game will give you such a shock that you will wonder why you ever started playing this game in the first place.

There are lots of weapons that you can use and each one is deadly. It is very easy to find the ones that you need as you progress through the game. You are able to choose which weapon you want to use.

In the beginning of the game, there are times when you will find yourself in a dark and scary place. It is so scary and intense that you will want to stop the game and turn off the TV. As you get down to business and finally defeat the enemies, the fear and anxiety fade away into excitement and accomplishment.

This game is not for the weak-hearted; it takes a strong emotional toll. The violence in the game is intense. You have to fight the monsters and demons that try to kill you, and the ending is so horrible that you will have nightmares for years.

I rate this one an 11/10.

(Overall rating = 9.0/10)

# Appendix

There are two appendices to this book. The first one is on how to build your own security awareness testing program. There may be other things that you will want to include in your program that are not mentioned in this appendix. It is up to you to decide what will best suit your needs.

At the end of this chapter are the questions used to test the knowledge, skills, and abilities that you should have when your security awareness testing program is completed. If you have already completed a program and you have the correct answers, you will be able to see how well you did the first time you answered the questions. If you have not completed your test yet, you should go back to the beginning of the chapter again and study it as you would any other lesson that we have learned about.

## Appendix 1

We have started this book with three lessons which will help you define and understand the problem. These lessons have covered the importance of security awareness, why we must have an organized program, and how we can test our program. In this appendix, we want to define the other lesson we have learned about. We want to help you better recognize the characteristics of being a good security professional.

This is a list of some of the characteristics that should be present in an employee who has received security training. It is not an all-encompassing list; there is not enough space to cover the full characteristics of a good security professional. The list that we have just shown you is, however, a good list of starting points that a company can use to gauge if its employees are as competent as required.

## An Overview of Characteristics

  1. Does the employee read the messages sent to the email account regularly?

  2. When an employee's name appears on a message that requires an action to be taken, is the employee able to identify it and deal with it correctly?

  3. Does the employee read training notices regularly?

  4. Does the employee take the trouble to make sure that each piece of training is understood and that the employee's understanding can be recorded?

  5. How does the employee react when a document is given to them that requires action?

  6. How does the employee react when the document that they are working on needs to be reviewed?

  7. How does the employee react when they become aware that they have received an email from an unknown address?

  8. How does the employee react when they receive an internal memo that requires them to take an action?

  9. Is the employee able to identify which computer needs protection, and how do they protect it?

  10. Does the employee have a good understanding of security policies and procedures?

  11. When the employee is in charge of a project, does their team work to a schedule or do they take their time to do it all?

  12. Can the employee identify when someone has a problem in their work, rather than waiting until it is obvious?

  13. Is the employee able to work with anyone of whatever color?

  14. Is the employee able to work with anyone regardless of religious beliefs or cultural differences?

  15. Is the employee able to take part in a group exercise without letting their individuality interfere with the group's performance?

  16. Does the employee feel comfortable communicating with the members of their project?

  17. Can they take a positive view about their work?

## Appendix 2

As with many things, security training is a skill that must be learned,

Document Cameras allow teachers to display documents, books, or other materials for their students to see. You can set up a camera to take live pictures or videos so that others can use online applications to see the screen. You can also set the camera to record footage in advance.

Use this technology to create a digital product, such as a book, a magazine, or an exhibition. Think about how you could use this kind of technology to connect with readers of your work.

Use your product to write a blog or update your social networking site profile.

##  **Lesson 32: Create a Book**

_I'm 57 years old. When I was in my youth, I had a small press. I had about half a dozen members who would join together and do the layout and typesetting, and each one would get one book (usually between 50 and 100) and that was it. I'll never forget it. I would print and publish between one and two books a week. Our books cost five dollars each and we sold them by the box. We all used to say that we didn't want our books to be bought; we just wanted to be known for our art. That was our dream. Now, instead of doing that, it's like a pyramid: there are big publishers and small independent press publishers in between and then there are artists or small presses. That has taken away the joy and the excitement. We lost all that energy when our press was taken over by other people. Those were more like friends of mine than just a business. I have a lot of friends because I put them into my company because they were nice people, and they could help. There was a lot of art behind that. Now, with so many more people involved, I don't feel the same feelings about it anymore. And so it's difficult. This is all very strange. Now they want me to work with them as a partner of sorts but it is all too much, and I just want to keep on going the way I've been going and let them do what they want to do._

_I'm interested in what might cause a change in anyone having an interest in the art? In people's lives, in society? In the world? In their creativity? I can't see any other reason than the influence of technology today. There used to be this kind of magic with the old printing processes and now technology is everywhere. Now it is all so impersonal. There is no soul to it because it is so impersonal. There is no creativity. It all takes place automatically but you don't feel connected to it. I think it all started with video, which was also a new invention. Video brought in the computer, which made so much sense for me. There is this machine, which records and can be edited or manipulated in a certain way. You didn't have to do it by hand. I could just type it into the machine and I would get the book. But that doesn't mean that anything creative was taking place. It did not have a soul nor did it have a human touch._

Now you know the basics of book publishing. Your next step is to choose a theme for your book and write it. Then you'll complete some of the most fundamental tasks, from editing and designing your cover to producing your first run of books and selling it as well. This is a long lesson, so we'll go through it in four lessons. In Lesson 33, we'll review what's involved in getting your book published. After that is Lesson 34, which will show you how to create the cover for your book once you've written it. In Lesson 35, you will learn how to design the inside of your book. And, finally, in Lesson 36, you'll learn how to produce and sell your book.

In the process, you'll create work from your imagination, work that you can be proud of, because it represents the fruit of your own creative efforts. We'll see how the technologies can be used to work on your book in ways that really bring out your individual vision.

If you want to be taken seriously as a writer, it is important that you have more than just a manuscript. A good way to start is to create an actual book with all the elements in place: a cover, a theme, an introduction. You might also want your friends to sign their names to the book with a few lines of their own (called an "inscription"). Remember, when you create a book like this, people know that you take your writing seriously and that you are not just someone who spends time in a dark room writing down gibberish. You are an actual author ready to take on
